loans.name: Jaime

texts.en:
Jaime is 44 years old and married with two children. He owned and managed rice production business for 20 years. It was a growing business for his family; they got their family living from it. He decided again to take a loan amounting to PHP 6,000 to buy organic fertilizers for the rice farm.

Jaime's hope for the future is to expand his business and make it more productive so that he can give a better living to his family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers for the rice farm.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan had enriched her business. She was able to buy products and supplies which are needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for the daily needs and expenditures of her family.

She is very positive that she could further improve her business, if you will let her borrow again, in the amount of PHP 40,000. This new loan will go to additional tailoring supplies she needs to improve her service and profit, like fabric, cloth, thread, and needles. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family through the help of this assistance.

Dominga dreams of becoming a successful sewer in her community. She also wants to buy another sewing machine, so she could produce more clothing items. Every week, she meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, thread, needles, and other materials.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna has taken out and repaid a prior loan as a way to expand her business by buying more ready-to-wear items to sell. The additional income she earned helped her support her family. She believes she can expand her business with a new loan and has requested 20,000 PHP to buy more clothing to sell. This will help her increase her profits and better support her family. Her goal is to establish a bigger dress shop, and she prays that her family will have good health and that her children will finish their studies with flying colors. Lorna meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from her religion.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study religion, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito is 42 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Charito runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, coffee, home care products and other groceries.  She has been in this business for 5 years now. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business. In the future, Charito would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, coffee, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is 44 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, Julita works very hard to provide for them.

Julita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock like eggs, detergent, soap, soft drinks, beers, noodles, cereals, seasonings, etc., to sell. She has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as eggs, detergent, soap, soft drinks, beers, noodles, cereals, seasonings, etc. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. In the future, Julita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock like eggs, detergent, soap, soft drinks, beers, noodles, cereals, seasonings, etc., to sell

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 52 years old and single. She is in the agricultural business, doing pig fattening in the Philippines. Marilou requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

Marilou has been in pig fattening for 15 years now, and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marilou would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 42 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school.

Eva works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Eva has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from charcoal-retailing.

Eva aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Mary Jane is 41 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Mary Jane has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Mary Jane has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en: Melinda is married and works hard to support her family by buying and selling dry goods in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan from NWTF to buy items to sell, including slippers, blouses, T-shirts, and pants. Melinda has been in this business for three years, and would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 42 years old and  works very hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Wilma has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, candies, biscuits, cereals, juice, beer, canned goods, etc. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Wilma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en: Belinda is 60 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan from NWTF to buy more groceries to sell. Belinda has been in her current line of work for three years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries. Her goal for the future is to expand her store.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Aimee

texts.en:
Aimee is 29 years old and a married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

Aimee has a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase more items, like snack foods, spices, eggs, and other groceries.

Aimee has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items, like snack foods, spices, eggs, and other groceries.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a farmer living in the Chuka area of central Kenya. She is married and has three children. Pauline has been farming for 30 years planting very good-looking vegetables that she sells in the area. She loves farming, because it is her income source. Her biggest challenge is lack of enough money for farming. 

Pauline chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, because their products are reasonable and affordable, and are offered at low interest rates. During the training, she learned how she can improve her living standards through farming. This loan will bring in more dairy milk from the dairy goats, increase her income, and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a dairy goat.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson is a 36-year-old man, married with six children, living in Kasese, Uganda. Johnson operates a retail shop for general merchandise, practices farming, and earns a salary as an additional income source. He began the business to improve his monthly income. He is a hardworking man, dreaming to expand his business into a big shopping center, however he is faced with challenges of limited capital, price fluctuations, and debtors. 

Johnson needs a loan to buy sugar, rice, soap, cooking oil and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, soap, cooking oil and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es:
María, con los créditos mantiene una tienda bien surtida con productos que los clientes necesitan, lo cual es de ayuda para tener ingresos necesarios con los que subsiste con su familia e ir cancelando sus deudas.
Por la facilidad de pago y los beneficios que los créditos le dan se ha decidido por hacer una nueva solicitud de capital, invertirá en azúcar, sal, cereales, gaseosas, jugos, boquitas, etc., para cubrir las demandas de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria, with help from the loans, maintains a well stocked shop with products that customers need, which has helped her to maintain the necessary income to live with her family and slowly cancel their debts. 

Because of the ease of payment and the benefits that the loans give her, she has decided to make a new request for capital, which she will invest in sugar, salt, cereals, soft drinks, juices, snacks, etc., to meet her customers' demands.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, salt, cereals, soft drinks, juices, snacks, etc., to meet the demands of her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase materials, stock and additional pieces for sales.

loans.name: Norberto

texts.es:
Sonriente, gozándose su trabajo, agradecido y bendecido por tener una labor para alimentar a sus 3 hijos, así es Norberto un hombre de 41 años de edad que se dedica a la distribución de alimentos, en un negocio muy familiar donde se apoyan para mantener el hogar, mientras que su esposa e hijos lo ayudan a la tienda, Norberto se encarga de repartir los domicilios y esto ha hecho una unión familiar y por eso sonríe, por tener trabajo y una familia unidad.

Inicio su negocio pro necesidad económica y como siempre quiso ser independiente, aprovecho una oportunidad que se le presento en el año 2007 e inicio su negocio.

Las metas con el negocio y su familia son dos, la primera es poder pagar los estudios universitarios de sus hijos, y la segunda es comprar una vivienda propia.

Norberto quiere solicitar un préstamo para dos cosas:
•	Reparar la motocicleta.
•	Comprar surtido en cantidades de productos como salchichas, panes, platos desechables, productos lácteos los cuales le solicitan mucho los vendedores de comidas rápidas.
texts.en:
Norberto, a 41-year-old man, is smiling, joyful of his work, and grateful and blessed to have a job to feed his 3 children. He works in food distribution in a family business that provides support to maintain his home. While his wife and children help in the shop, Norberto is responsible for home deliveries. The business has made the family union strong and so that's why he smiles: for having work and a unified family. 

He took the opportunity that was presented in 2007 and started his business because of economic necessity and because he always had wanted to be independent. The goals for the business and his family are two: first, he wants to pay for his children's college tuition; and second, he wants to purchase his own home. 

Norberto is requesting the loan for two reasons:

• to repair the motorcycle. 
• to purchase wholesale quantities of products such as sausages, breads, disposable dishes, and dairy products which are vastly requested by fast food vendors.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle and purchase an assortment of sausages, breads, plates, among other things

loans.name: Shamsidin

texts.ru:
Шамсидин   родился и вырос в семье  работника. Он очень вежливый, шустрый и порядочный мужчина. Ему 56 лет. Он женат и имеет троих детей. Он вместе с семьёй живёт в деревне. Шамсидин  уже несколько лет занимается животноводством, у него уже большое стадо овец, коровы, козы  и т. д.
Но для того чтобы прокормить своё стадо, вырастить, чтобы в дальнейшем продать и на вырученные деньги купить ещё ему нужны деньги. И поэтому Шамсидин  обратился в МДО Арванд для получения кредита. На деньги  полученные в кредит он собирается купить корм для своих животных и увеличивать своего бизнес.
texts.en: Shamsidin was born and raised in a family of workers. He is a very polite, smart, and decent man. He is 56, married, and has three children. He and his family live in a village. Shamsidin has been raising livestock for a while now and has a large flock of sheep, cows, goats, and so forth. But he needs money to feed his flock and expand his business so that he can sell livestock in the future and continue to buy more. He will use the loan to buy feed for his animals and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy feeds for cattle

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.en:
Sebastiana is applying for a loan of $600 to improve her business; this is her first loan. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as  body loosen, milk, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, biscuits, soap, shampoo and fish.

Sebastiana opened her kiosk in 2010 with her own working capital of $200. She is earning a good income and she will use the income to support her family and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy body loosen, milk, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, biscuits, soap, shampoo and fish

loans.name: Zaib  Unnisa

texts.en:
Zaib Unnisa is a 51-year-old widow with three children. One of her sons( also shown in the photo) started a business of selling cloth in his locality. He purchases cloth of different varieties at low prices from the city market and sells it in his own town. He has a strong customer base.

Currently, she has requested a Murabaha loan of 35,000 Pakistan rupees (PKR) for her son. He wants to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors to inflate his sales and profits alongside.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her son's business, to inflate sales and profits alongside.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To help her buy more blankets and products

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Suriya is 64 years old and an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She resides in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her spouse and six children. Her husband has been running his own tailoring shop in the local market for 10 years and is solely responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family.

Suriya's husband needs to buy a variety of tailoring items for his business, e.g., pieces of cloth, needles, and sewing machine accessories. But due to some financial constraints, her husband is not in a suitable position to buy these items. Therefore, Suriya has applied for a Kiva loan from field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of the loan, she will provide financial assistance to her husband so he can buy these items for his business and earn a better income.

Suriya is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy a variety of tailoring items for her husband's business, e.g., pieces of cloth, needles, and sewing machine accessories

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Roseline is 49 years old. she is the leader of a female community-based organisation in 2012. Since then, she has been involved in social and economic activities. Roseline is in the cosmetics sales. Last year, she registered a profit of about US$658 in her business. Roseline  distribute to retailers group to whom she is connected. She helped them by counselling them on small business management. Roseline is placed on the right in the picture and two other people (Yolene on the left and Fenol on the right) represent this group in the management of this loan. Her request will be an additional investment to support her group.

loans.use: to buy stock of cosmetics to retail

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a Solar Solution for her utility store and increase her productive hours.

loans.name: Laoyai Group

texts.en:
Kankham, the woman on the far left of the picture, understands the difference the water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families.  

Kankham knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption, and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources. The water filter she purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal, or decreasing the time and cost of foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.    

Kankham is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule, and that the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Nsenkyerene Ye Nna Group

texts.en:
Gordon is 45 years old and a member and group representative of Nsenkyerene Ye Nna group. He lives with his family at Efutu Koforidua, in the Cape Coast North District in the Central Region of Ghana. 

Gordon is married with five children, three of them are currently in school. The ages of his children are 10 months, 5, 8, 14, and 19 years. 

Gordon has been farming for the past 18 years. He currently grows oranges and other food stuffs such as cassava, plantain and vegetables.  Gordon has a wealth of experience in farming, however his farms are not accessible by roads and this makes it difficult for him to travel to and from the farm, as well as to transport his crops during harvest. Gordon has to hire laborers to apply fertilizer, insecticides, and to weed, prune, and harvest his crops.  He also needs support to cover the additional costs involved in transporting his crops to the road side. 

Gordon requested a loan to help cover the costs of maintenance, purchase of fertilizer and pesticides for his farm; and transporting his goods to the roadside. 

A loan will help increase his yield significantly, and his profits would far exceed the capital he has to invest in his farm now. The income from his farm will help pay the school fees for his children. Gordon and his entire group members are grateful to their micro-lenders for their generous support.

loans.use: To buy pesticides, fertilizer and for general maintenance of the farm and transport of crops

loans.name: Tete Nyame Group

texts.en:
Kweku is 48 years old and a farmer who is married, with seven children. The age of his eldest child is 21 years and the youngest is 3 years. All the children are currently in school. 

Kweku is a member of the Tete Nyame Group. He comes from Efutu Koforidua in the Cape Coast North District. He grows oranges on 9-acre farm land, with 20 years farming experience. He also grows cassava and plantain as other sources of income in addition to the income he derives from the orange farming.   

With a wealth of experience in the farming, Kweku has the confidence and expertise to expand his farm. However, he finds the manual labor involved in maintaining such a huge farm alone challenging as he is getting on in years. It is also difficult to work the farm when it rains. Kweku needs micro loan support to buy pesticides, fertilizer and cover hired labour cost of maintaining the farm. 

A micro loan will help him cover the high labor costs for his farms.  

Kweku is determined to increase his output so that he can improve the lives of his family. In particular, his income will fund the educational needs of his children. He is very thankful for the financial support from his microlenders.

loans.use: To buy pesticides, fertilizer and to maintain the farm

loans.name: Dugu-Yiriwaton Group

texts.fr:
Aissata  est la dame qui a ses mains sur  le sac d’arachide sur la photo.
Aissata est un malien non scolarisé. Elle est âgée de  39ans, mariée mère de 05 enfants ; âgés de 1 à 19 ans dont 3 scolarisés. Son mari fait l’agriculture.
 Aissata fait  le commerce d’arachide et du haricot, elle fait recourt auRMCR  pour acheter beaucoup de sacs d’arachides et de haricot. Elle s’approvisionne dans  une  foire de sa localité et revend  dans les foires environnantes. Elle a une expérience de 6 ans  d’activité.
Dans ses ventes, elle gagne en moyenne 25000FCFA de profit par vente, Avec le profit,  Aissata pourra subvenir aux besoins de sa famille (habillement, santé et frais de scolarité).    Elle est souvent confrontée à des   difficultés  de moyens de transport.Dans l’avenir Aissata veut construire une maison en tôle pour sa famille avec le  profit qu’elle gagnera.
texts.en:
Aissata  is the woman with her hands on the sack of peanuts in the picture. 

Aissata is an uneducated woman from Mali. She is 39 years old, married, and a mother to 5 children - ages 1 to 19, three of which are educated. Her husband is a farmer. Aissata sells peanuts and beans. She is appealing to RMCR to buy more sacks of peanuts and beans. She resupplies at a local market and resells her stock in the local markets nearby. 

She has 6 years of business experience. In her sales, she makes a medium profit of 25,000 FCFA. With the profit, Aissata will be able to fulfill the needs of the family (clothing, health, tuition costs). She often faces difficulties with transportation. 

In the future, Aissata wants to build a sheet metal house for her family with the profits she will earn.

loans.use: To buy sacks of beans and peanuts for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a Solar Solution for her business, which will help to increase her income.

loans.name: Micaela

texts.en:
Micaela is 22 years old she is divorced with a 5 month old baby. Micaela pays rent. She works at a grocery store from Sunday to Sunday from 8:00 am until 9:00 pm.

Micaela needs a loan to buy products for her grocery store (soft drinks, food cans, bread, etc). She hopes you can help her.

Micaela is healthy and she loves her baby a lot. She knows how to use the loan because she has experience with a grocery store

loans.use: to buy products  for her grocery store (soft drinks, food cans, bread, etc)

loans.name: Five Brothers Group

texts.en:
Idrisa, who is in his mid-40s is married with three children.  One of them is grown-up and the other two are still in school.  He has been running a genge duka (small grocery store) business since 2008.  He works from 6 am to 10:30 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Idrisa's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loan to open a duka and also increased the genge.  He has repaid his loan successfully.  He is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support.  

Idrisa used the profit to pay school fees, loan repayments and to cover household expenses.  He will use this loan to restock the out of stock items in the gengeduka, items like tomatoes, mages, bananas, onions, Irish potatoes, sugar, beans, flours, cooking oil and Melonie.  He dreams of building houses to rent.

Idrisa will share this loan with his loan group "Five Brothers" which has five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out of stock items in the gengeduka, items like tomatoes, magoes, bananas, onions, Irish potatoes, sugar, beans, flours, cooking oill and melonies

loans.name: Tanzanite Group

texts.en: Tabu, who is in her early 40s, is married and the mother of four children, three boys and one girl, all of whom are in school.  She has been running a retail shop for two years and earns a good living by working from 7.30 a.m. to 8.30 p.m. daily. This will be Tabu's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She repaid her prior loans after using them to buy fast-moving items such as bread, sugar, flour, salt, beans, sweets, biscuits, juice, water, and sodas.  She used her profits to pay school fees and household expenses. She will use this loan to buy more items to meet customers' demand.  Tabu dreams of expanding her shop and opening another business. She will share this loan with her loan group, Tanzanite, which has two members who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy  items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Rylen

texts.en: Rylen is 25 years old, married and the mother of three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur who runs a store in the Philippines. Rylen has requested a PHP 11,000 loan from NWTF to buy more items to sell, including soft drinks, bread, biscuits, canned goods and other groceries. She has been in this business for four years, and her goal for the future is to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Zhyldyz

texts.ru: Жылдыз 38 лет, не замужем, есть 4 детей. У Жылдыз среднее образование, 7 лет назад она решила открыть свой бизнес, которым и занимается до сих пор. Жылдыз печет и продает самсы, у нее есть 2 духовки.  Ее ежемесячная прибыль составляет всего около 16,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жылдыз обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS) на покупку муки, Жылдыз считает, что ее продукция будет пользоваться большим спросом. Она планирует расширить ее бизнес и накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Zhyldyz is 38 and single with four children. She has a high school education and decided seven years ago to start her own business, which she runs to this day. She bakes and sells samsas (pastries with a savoury filling) and has two ovens. Her monthly income is about 16,000 KGS.

With the goal of further developing her business, Zhyldyz has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 KGS to purchase flour. She believes that her products will be in high demand and plans to expand her business and save toward home renovations.

loans.use: to buy flour in order to invest in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure and insecticides to improve her coffee and banana plantation.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.en:
Genoveva is 62 years old and a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Genoveva has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Genoveva has been in this business for 40 years. In the future, she would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase linen and plain jersey to design clothing for existing and prospective clients

loans.name: Hernan De Jesus

texts.es:
Hernán es un hombre de 31 años de edad, un hombre que no tuvo suerte para emplearse, una persona que a pesar de que le cerraron muchas puertas en su vida, inicio desde el año 2000 su venta ambulante de ropa juvenil y lencería.

Al momento de iniciar su negocio se trazó una meta la cual es comprar una vivienda propia y 15 años después trabaja intensivamente para lograr su cometido.

Hernán necesita mejorar sus ventas, aumentar sus clientes busca alternativas para que su negocio prospere puesto que hay mucha competencia, mucho centro comercial que le quitan clientes.

Hernán solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercancía juvenil,  para Hernán este crédito es muy importante puesto que es el que le ha dado el sustento durante estos 15 años, y si lo perdiera no quiere pasar por esos momentos en donde le cerraron las puertas.

No le cierre la puerta a Hernán, apóyalo muéstrale que no está solo y que luche por lo suyo.
texts.en:
Hernán is a 31-year-old man who did not have much luck in getting a job. Despite being a person to whom many doors were closed in life, he began selling linen and clothing for young people in 2000. 

When he began his business, he marked out a goal for himself, which is to buy his own house. Fifteen years later, he is working hard to achieve his goal.

Hernán needs to improve his sales, increase his clients, and look for new ways to make his business prosper as there is a lot of competition and a commercial centre that lures his clients away.

Hernán is requesting a loan in order to buy merchandise for young people. This loan is very important to Hernán as his business is what has sustained him for the last 15 years and he wouldn’t want to go through the moments in which the doors of his business were closed if he were to lose it.

Don’t close the door on Hernán. Help him. Show him that he is not alone and that you are fighting for him and his business.

loans.use: to buy clothing for his business, which he has had for 15 years

loans.name: Jorge Leonardo

texts.es:
Jorge es un hombre de 25 años de edad, soltero y sin hijos, residente de la zona de turbo Antioquia, Turbo es una zona costera, no existen muchas rutas de acceso y el paso para algunas veredas se tornan muy complicados, algunos carros no pueden pasar y para desplazarse solo hay dos opciones, la primera es caminar, la segunda es usar el servicio de mototaxi, Jorge lo ofrece y con ello genera el sustento para su familia, conformada por padres y hermanos.

Su sueño inmediato es poder comprar una vivienda propia, y conduce diariamente a sus vecinos, juntando ahorros poco a poco, para cumplir su gran propósito.

Este trabajar Joven presenta una dificultad, la motocicleta que maneja no es de su propiedad y debe liquidar un dinero diario al dueño.

Jorge solicita un préstamo para comprar una motocicleta, con esto ganara un incremento de utilidad pues le quedara todo el dinero a él.
texts.en:
Jorge, age 25, is single and has no children. He lives in the Turbo area of Antioquia. Turbo is a coastal area and there aren't many thoroughfares; some routes get really complicated. There are places where cars can't get through and you only have two choices: walk or take a motorcycle taxi. Jorge offers these taxi services and by doing so, he is able to support his parents and siblings.

His short-term goal is to be be able to buy his own residence and drive his neighbors around on a daily basis, saving a little at a time so that he can achieve his larger goal.

This work presents Jorge with one difficulty: the motorcycle he drives isn't his property and he has to pay its owner for the daily use.

Jorge is requesting this loan so that he can buy a motorcycle. This will help him gain extra utility and keep more his own money.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle to run his taxi service more effectively

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover the cost of attending SPIRE Education's six-week career accelerator programme.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a vehicle to assist his mother in the delivery process and purchase kitchen equipment and grocery

loans.name: Many

texts.en: Many is a 19-year-old single nursing student who is from the Svay Reang province of Cambodia. She is pursuing an associate’s degree in the first year at a university in the province. Her parents run a business selling electrical devices. Due to a shortage of finances to cover her university fees from the first to the third year, she has decided to secure a loan. This loan will help her have enough finances for earning an associate’s degree and learn favorite skills to achieve her future goal. In the future, she is going to find a job with a reasonable salary to help her parents.

loans.use: to cover her university fees

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 42 years old and married. She has been blessed with four children aged 18, 16, 12 and 10 years old respectively, whom she supports. Beatrice has a curio shop which she has run for eight years now.

She is taking her second loan to purchase stock like beads, thread and materials to make curio items for her customers. She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. Her hopes and dreams are to live a better life.

loans.use: to purchase stock like beads, thread and materials to make curio items for her customers.

loans.name: Junalyn

texts.en:
Junalyn is 31 years old and a married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Junalyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 22,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Junalyn has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en:
Shiela is 38 years old and has four children. She is married and has three children who are in school.

Shiela is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Shiela has been raising pigs for 15 years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Shiela would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 56 years old and widowed with six children. With two children in school, Corazon works very hard to provide for them.

Corazon runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell. She has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, noodles, sardines and other groceries. 

In the future Corazon would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gertrude,

texts.en:
Gertrude is a divorced lady who lives in Kasese, Uganda. She has the responsibility of looking after her four children and meeting their basic needs. She operates a retail shop selling general merchandise, which she began from her salary savings; she also owns rentals. 

She has hopes of renovating her residential house and expanding her business to town centers. However she is faced with the challenge of competition. Gertrude wants money to buy paint, sand and cement to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy paint, sand and cement to renovate her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy salt, rice, sugar, maize flour and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for building materials and kitchen equipment for a restaurant

loans.name: Martha Lucia

texts.es: Lucia es una señora de 35 años de edad, Lucia es madre soltera, su hija tiene 7 años y se encuentra estudiando,  Lucia  se dedica  a la crianza de animales y también trabaja a medio tiempo de empleada domestica, Lucia va a invertir el dinero en la compra de chanchos, Lucia comenta que vive muy contenta junto a su hija y que lucha dia a dia para mejorar su calidad de vida, Lucia espera incrementar su negocio y mejorarlo para aumentar sus ingresos y salir adelante con su hija para vivir felizmente.
texts.en: Lucia, age 35, is a single mother. Her seven-year-old daughter attends school and Lucia is in the business of raising animals. She also works part time as a household maid. Lucia plans to invest her money in buying pigs. She says that she and her daughter live well and that she fights every day to improve their quality of life. Lucia hopes to expand her business and improve it so that she can increase her income and get her daughter and herself ahead and living happily.

loans.use: buy pigs

loans.name: Jorge Ignacio

texts.es:
Aquí se encuentra Jorge con su tienda de abarrotes vendiendo un producto a los clientes, él como siempre es un hombre tranquilo, amable, que busca progresar, expandirse nunca está conforme con un logro, su meta es llegar lejos, un día poder tener un supermercado, comprar vivienda, carro, pagarle la universidad a su hijo y en fin miles de sueños que con trabajo y humildad quiere lograrlos.

El inicio su negocio en el año 2011 como una necesidad ante la falta de empleo, necesita alimentar a su familia, y hoy en día mira la foto, cuenta con un lindo negocio y busca mantenerlo y mejorarlo continuamente.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos de la canasta familiar, como arroz, panela, frijoles, pastas, atún, quesito, arepas, papas, plátanos, papel higiénico, aceite, escobas, traperas, entre otros productos, también comprara una nevera para refrigerar bebidas como cervezas y refrescos.
texts.en:
Here's Jorge in his grocery store, selling his merchandise to his customers. As always, he is calm and friendly, looking to get ahead. He's never content with just one goal; his dream is to go far, one day running his own supermarket, buying a home and a car, paying for his son to go to university -- in short, thousands of dreams that he will achieve through hard work and humility.

He started his business in 2011 out of necessity when he couldn't find work and hard to feed his family.  Now just look at that photo: he's running a lovely business and is constantly seeking to maintain and improve it.

He is requesting this loan to buy merchandise for the everyday pantry, including rice, cane sugar, beans, pasta, tuna, cheese, corn tortillas, potatoes, plantains, toilet paper, oil, brooms and cleaning cloths, among many other things. He also plans to purchase a cooler to keep soft drinks and beer cold.

loans.use: supply his general store

loans.name: Eath

texts.en:
Eath, 53, is from a rural village located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She and her husband earn a living through planting rice. She and her husband have been in this business for many years. The current business earns her family about 24,000 KHR per day.

Eath has been with VisionFund for seven cycles. Now she is asking for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to have more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a 36-year-old married man who lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda with four children six, four, two and one year old. He deals in the produce business, mainly selling beans, maize and groundnuts. He has been in business for three years and has managed to provide for the basic needs of his family. His business dream is to have a well stocked strong business that will enable him to attain more profits despite the challenge of price fluctuations and high transport costs. Robert intends to use the loan to buy more produce like maize to sell.

loans.use: To buy more produce like maize to sell.

loans.name: Dora Aminta

texts.es: Dora de 54 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella se dedica desde hace 14 años a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz y también posee una tienda, cuando ya está su cosecha la almacena en sacos como muestra la fotografía y la comercializa en los pueblos aledaños, ya tiene muchos clientes fijos, Dora está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. para poder continuar con sus cultivos ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos
texts.en:
Dora, age 54, lives with her partner in their own home. For the last fourteen years, she's been in the business of corn farming and she also runs a store. When her harvest comes in, she stores it in sacks, as you can see in the photograph, and sells it in nearby villages. She has many steady customers. 

Dora is requesting this loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, fungicides, herbicides and more so that she can keep growing her crops. This will help her earn more income from her only source of work.

loans.use: buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Gathoni

texts.en: Gathoni is 37 years old. She is the mother of six children. She has been in the tailoring business for the last five years. She will be using the loan to purchase clothing materials and hopes this will help her generate profit. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to educate her children and buy a plot.

loans.use: to buy clothing materials to make dresses to sell to her customers and she hopes this will generate more profit to meet her family's basic needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to enable him to increase the number of litres of milk supplied to his increasing number of customers demanding the same product.

loans.name: Aminata M.

texts.en: Aminata M. is married and has two children ages 22 and 13. She also has four additional dependents who live with her under foster care. Aminata was brought up by a foster parent who did not give her the opportunity to acquire education. The foster parent only used her to do domestic work and to help in the foster parent's business. When Aminata married, her husband gave her money to start her own business. In 1995 she started selling cosmetics and baby accessories. Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, she currently earns about 3,318,000 SSL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SSL to purchase cartons of cosmetics and baby items. In the future, Aminata plans to educate her children and develop her land and rental shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cartons of cosmetics and baby items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow, which will enable her to meet the demands of her clients by supplying milk.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
From Cavite, Philippines, Emilia is married and has one child. She is employed in a garment factory in Cavite through the auspices of the Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT). Emilia works as a seamstress, sewing clothing according to the company or client’s dictates. She uses a sewing machine and other stitching machines as well as handstitching hems and linings.

One of the main dilemmas of employees like Emilia is meeting family expenses without access to savings or credit. Workers can become heavily indebted to money lenders who take their ATM cards as loan collateral.

For this reason Emilia is asking for your assistance to help her circumvent loan sharks. She has previously accessed loans through CCT and had no problem in repaying them since the loan payments were automatically deducted from her paycheck. She is seeking a 12,000 PHP loan to pay for their debts and personal expenses.

Emilia prays for good health so she can become more productive and efficient for work. She looks forward to your positive response and says any amount will surely be of great help.

CCT works to provide local communities with a trained labor force equipped with the skills required for employment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative assists its members in acquiring those skills necessary for quality jobs, cultivating savings consciousness and providing decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs include Professional Staff Services, Workers Guild Development, Enterprise Development and Consultancy Services.

CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for factory workers such as Emilia before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions, spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and after-work hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: to pay debts and family expenses.

loans.name: Anarzhan

texts.ru: Анаржан, 54 года, замужем, мать 2 детей. У Анаржан высшее образование, она с 1990 года занимается животноводством.  В настоящее время у нее есть 10 коров и 5 овец. Ежемесячная прибыль Анаржан составляет 17,500 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Анаржан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для разведения. Это поможет привлечь больше клиентов и накопить средства на покупку мебели для ее дома.
texts.en:
Anarzhan is 54 years old, married and the mother of two children. Anarzhan has higher education. Since 1990 she has worked with livestock breeding. Currently Anarzhan has ten cows and five sheep. Her monthly income is 17,000 som (KGS).

With an aim to further develop her business, Anarzhan turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) to purchase livestock for breeding. This will allow her to attract more customers and save money to purchase furniture for her home.

loans.use: to purchase livestock to increase the headcount

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to clear land for tea farming.

loans.name: Yorman Orlando

texts.es:
Yorman es un técnico en mantenimiento de aparatos electrónicos, un joven de 23 años de edad, inicio su negocio como un hobby por la electrónica, y poco a poco se fue convirtiendo en la actividad que le está dando de comer.

Su propósito es vivir bien y cómodamente, tiene su negocio y quiere comprar  una vivienda propia quizás un proyecto muy ambicioso, pero su dicho es si no se sueña como quieres lograrlo.

Es un joven que necesita apoyo de tu apoyo para salir adelante, esa oportunidad que le niegan por ser primerizo, ese préstamo que le dicen que no, pero esto va a cambiar, con la ayuda de Interactuar y Kiva sabe que tiene esa oportunidad que esperaba.

Con el préstamo que quiere solicitar, busca comprar una vitrina y un equipo de cómputo con la que dará un soporte más eficaz y a domicilio.
texts.en:
Yorman is a electronics maintenance technician. Now 23 years old, he started this business as a hobby based in his love of electronics. Little by little he began to earn his living from it.

His goal is to live comfortably and well. He has his business and he wants to buy his own home. It may be an ambitious project, but he likes to say that if you don't dream it, how can you achieve it?  This young man needs your support to get ahead. He has been denied the opportunity for being too inexperienced and a different loan agency told him no. But that will change and with the support of Interactuar and Kiva, he knows he will have the chance he's been waiting for.

With this loan, he intends to buy a display case and computer equipment. With these, he can provide more efficient support and in-home service.

loans.use: buy a display cabinet and computer equipment to provide home-based support and repair

loans.name: Dostonbek

texts.ru:
Достонбек молодой и трудолюбивый парень 25 лет. Он родился и вырос в кишлаке Ниджони. Достонбек женат, но пока что  не имеет детей.  У него есть двух комнатный дом со всех удобствами. Достонбек занимается земледелием и животноводством. В дехканском хозяйстве имеет 1,5 гектара земли, из них 0,5 га винограда и  1,0 га выращивает сельхозкультуры, такие как лук и морковь . Он имеет 1 корову  и 2  овцы.  В свободное время он зарабатывает столяром плотником. 
Достонбек обратился в Арванд за кредитом. Он хочет отремонтировать свой дом. Он заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Dostonbek, 25, is a hardworking young man.  He was born and grew up in a village called Nidzhoni.  He is married but doesn't have any children yet.  He has a two-room house with all commodities.  He is involved in farming and animal husbandry.  He owns 1.5 hectares of land from the midsized peasant farm and grows grapes on 0.5 hectare and various crops such as onions and carrots on one hectare of land.  He also owns one cow and two sheep.  In his free time, he makes extra money working as a carpenter.  Dostonbek has turned to Arvand to request a loan.  He wants to renovate his house.  He thanks Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover the cost of attending Spire Education's six-week career accelerator program.

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said is a 26 year old Palestinian refugee who was born and raised in a Palestinian refugee camp in North Lebanon. He is currently engaged but lives alone, having lost his parents when he was younger. Growing up without financial support, Said quickly learned how to manage his income and make ends meet right after he graduated from school. Today, he is hoping he can start his own family and provide his future wife with good living conditions. 
In late 2013, Said started running his own business. He opened a coffee shop in a busy street of the camp where he has little competition. He sells soda, juice and sweets to loyal customers who see him as a responsible young man planning for his future. 
He is asking for a 3,083,000 Lebanese pounds loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa. He needs the loan to buy a new fruit juicer and a coffee machine. This small investment will diversify his sales and increase his income and profit. In fact, replacing his old machines will boost his productivity and help him attract new customers.

loans.use: to buy a new fruit juicer and coffee machine for his cafe

loans.name: Ifrah

texts.en: Ifrah hails from Mogadishu, Somalia where her family experienced many years of trauma due to the turmoil occurring in Somalia.  Thankfully, she was able to flee Somalia to Kenya and pursued her university degree with the help of a Jesuit sponsorship.  Ifrah dreams of working for the United Nations in a social work role where she can advocate for and empower refugees.

loans.use: to cover the cost of attending Spire Education's six-week career accelerator programme.

loans.name: Resty

texts.en:
Resty lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed, with six children. She has no additional family members. 

Resty sells charcoal from home on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 20 years. She works seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan of UGX 1,400,000 from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT  SACCO) to buy bags of charcoal. 

Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a van for transporting charcoal from village to the market, so she can sell. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and utilities.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 30 years old, married to Henry, and they are blessed with four children. She has been practicing dairy farming for the last 14 years and earns KES 12,000 per month.

Mary has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow so as to increase the milk supply for her clients. She plans to use the generated profits to educate her children and to extend her farming.

Mary's future hopes are to grow her business and to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow so as to increase the milk supply for her clients

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is single and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Liza requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Liza has been in this business for twenty years now and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

In the future, Liza would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 29,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Arlene successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. NWTF is re-listing Arlene's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Choun's Group

texts.en:
Choun is 74 years old and married with two children. She lives with her family in a rural area located in the Kratie district of Kratie province.
Rice farming is the only primary source of her family’s income and she sells some small amount of groceries to make a living. With these current businesses, she can earn approximately 35,400 KHR per day and spend about 15,000 KHR each day for the family’s daily need.

This is the first Kiva loan for Choun’s group of two with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Choun will use her portion to expand her farmland. She hopes to increase her current business so as to earn a larger income to make a better living.

loans.use: to expand her farmland

loans.name: Sengang's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Kampong Cham district of Kampong Cham province, Sengang is a 36-year-old married woman without any children. Rice farming has been the main source of her family’s income for more than ten years. To better support the family and help to earn more income, her husband works as a laborer. Together, they can earn about 39,400 KHR per day to meet family’s needs and spend around 15,500 KHR per day. 

Sengang’s group consists of four members who have been with VisionFund for one cycle and have completely repaid the loan. The first loan has helped her better support her family members. Now she is leading her group to apply for the second cycle loan. Sengang, who is the leader, wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to grow her rice fruitfully and healthily and also hopes to make more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Kampong Cham District

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is married with six children, two of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (old parents). 

She has a business, selling sweet and Cavendish bananas and she has been in this business for ten years. She generates additional income from rental rooms. She works at the market seven days a week and sells on a retail basis only. 

Farida has applied for a loan of UGX 1,300,000 (Ugandan shillings) from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy bunches of sweet and Cavendish bananas. 

Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to start growing sweet bananas. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Her main monthly expenses include school fees, utilities, and feeding her family.

loans.use: to buy bunches of sweet and Cavendish bananas.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en: Zeinab is a 31-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and two school-aged children. Zeinab works hard to show her determination of being able to improve her family’s way of living. In 2013, she started her own business by opening a chocolate shop in her town and she works in parallel as a teacher in a local school. Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to increase her shop inventory.  She states that the loan will certainly help her extend her business and increase her income by a large percentage. In the future, Zeinab plans to take more Kiva loans to develop her business further.

loans.use: to increase her chocolate shop inventory

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 53 years old, married and a father of seven children. He has been in an herbal business for the last five years. 

He will be using the loan to purchase medicine and hopes this will help generate income for his family, which he will use to support his family.

William's hopes and dreams for the future are to educate his children and to cure many people.

loans.use: to buy more stock of herbal medicines to sell to his customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and begin selling milk.

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin is 39 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Jasmin runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Jasmin has been in this business for twelve years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, canned goods, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future, Jasmin would like to save more money to send her children to school and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Sophy's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Kratie province, Sophy is 42 years old. She is a mother of four children, three of whom are in school, and the fourth one is still too young. For her living conditions, she grows rice as the main source of income and works for others for a fee to earn more income. 

This is her third loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans. She is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her rice farming. She hopes that she can make more income than last year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to support her rice farming

loans.name: Chanthoeun's Group

texts.en:
Chanthoeun is aged 41 years and married with four children, one of whom is married, while the others are still single and help the family’s business. She is a rice farmer who has been in the business for 20 years to make a living, and she supplements family’s income by working as a worker to collect rice. With the current businesses, she can earn about 38,900 KHR per day to meet family’s needs and spends about 12,000 KHR per day for supporting the daily needs. 

This is the first loan cycle for Chanthoeun with VisionFund. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and will use a portion of it to buy potatoes to plant in addition to rice farming. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her current business to earn a larger income and also hopes to extend her current business.

loans.use: to buy potatoes to plant in addition to rice farming

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Gull Safia

texts.en: Gull Safia is a vigorous, 37-year-old, married lady. The man shown in the photo is her husband. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of available funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she has availed Murabaha loan( i.e. an islamic mode of financing ) of 20,000 PKR to buy a new stitching machine along with more spools of thread in different colors. With this loan, she hopes to create a means of increasing revenues so she is able to generate a healthier source of income.

loans.use: to buy a new stitching machine along with more spools of thread in different colors.

loans.name: Inti Pakareq Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “INTI PAKAREQ”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             
La socia es la Sra. Ruth Julieta, la socia sigue con su negocio de venta de tejidos y textiles, la socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido, la socia continua fabricando tejidos como chompas y chalinas y también textiles en base a hilos y lanas, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar lanas, hilos entre otros.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de alfombras, negocio de venta de cortinas, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de artesanías.
 Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
These people belong to the “Inti Pakareq” communal bank. This bank is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

Ruth Julieta is one of the members of the communal bank. She is continuing with her business, which consists of selling knitted garments and textiles. She is grateful to those who are part of her dream through this platform and she is committed to making her repayments on time. She continues making knitted garments, such as jumpers and scarves, as well as linen and wool textiles. She is a responsible and diligent person. She supports her family with this work.

She is requesting the loan in order to buy wool, threads, and other things.

The other members have businesses that sell carpets, curtains, groceries, and handicrafts.

The members in the photo attached to the main photo asked permission to come late to the meeting due to work-related reasons.

loans.use: to buy wool, thread, and other supplies

loans.name: Alba Nora

texts.es:
La señora Alba Nora tiene 38  años de edad convive con su compañero de hogar tiene dos hijos que depende de su matrimonio, y se dedica a la Venta de abarrotería en general  que es su fuente principal de ingreso, Ella cuenta con más de 1 años de realizarla dicha actividad económica la que le ha generado ingresos para satisfacer las necesidades del hogar, educación y crianza para sus hijos y cubrir gastos financieros, ella es una persona con mucha aspiraciones de superación, ya que de nuevo lucha con su negocio por que sufrió de un incendio donde perdió su negocio y su vivienda, con el apoyo que solicita lo empleara en la compra de churros, Pan, Café, Manteca, Pastas, Arroz, Frijoles y otros productos de consumo para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, lo que le generara mejores ingresos y la captación de nuevos clientes.
Doña Alba uno de sus sueños  es darle un mejor estilo de vida a su familia, y de tener un negocio más grande, con el apoyo financiero que se le brinde estaría dando un paso más en la carrera de sus sueños.  


	Trojes Honduras febrero 2015
texts.en:
Alba Nora is 38 years old. She lives with her partner. She has two children from her marriage. She makes a living by selling groceries, which is her main source of income. She has over a year of experience doing this work, which has generated enough income to meet the household needs, support her children, pay for her children’s education, and cover financial expenses. Alba Nora is a person who aspires to get ahead in life. She is struggling with her business again because there was a fire in which she lost her business and her home. With the help of the loan that she is requesting, she will buy churros, bread, coffee, butter, pastries, rice, beans, and other products to meet the demand from her clients. This will generate greater earnings for her and bring her new clients.

One of Alba’s dreams is to give her family a better lifestyle and to have a larger business. With the financial support that you are giving her, she will be one step closer to achieving her dreams.

loans.use: to buy churros, bread, coffee, butter, pastries, rice, beans, and other products for her business

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie, age 33, is from  Rizal, Zamboanga Del Norte: Philippines.  PMPC supported her by providing the capital to start her pig-raising business. She sells one pig at a time, helping the family survive. She gives her best efforts to produce good pigs in order to sell them continuously. 

Rosalie is now trying to expand her pig business and has also decided to venture into a little restaurant. She presented her project proposal to PMPC to finance the project and has applied for a loan of 5,000 PHP.  She is thankful to PMPC for financing her capital needs. 

In addition, she wants her business to be well known and to build good business management for her loyal customers.  With her extra income, she wishes to send all her children to school so they may have stable careers.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow so as to supply milk and increase her income.

loans.name: Divino

texts.en:
His name is Divino, 42, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Pilita, a school teacher and has two children of which one is a high school student and the other one is still at elementary level. He works hard to provide for his family and send his children to school.

Divino owns and operates his own jeepney transport service. He has one jeepney (14-16 person capacity). Jeepneys are the most common form of public transport and cheapest way of getting to one's destination. Most Filipinos commute, only a few have their own vehicle.

To help him continue operation of his business, Divino is requesting a PHP 40,000 loan which he will use for the maintenance and registration renewal for his jeepney unit. It is very important that his unit is always in good running condition to ensure efficient service. He thanks God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given him.

Divino hopes to buy another jeepney unit to improve his income. He dreams of giving his children the best education. He prays for his and his passengers' safety on every trip. Every week, he faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members* to share stories of his work and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance and registration renewal for his jeepney.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 36 and is a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Manuel, a factory worker. She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal and household needs.
Thelma operates a small general store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns income by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of Php 1000 a day. 
To help her continue operations of her general store business she is requesting a Php 15,000 loan which she will use to buy grocery items like rice, canned goods, instant noodles, soda, and other grocery stuff. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. Her earnings are their source to meet their daily expenses. She thanks God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.
Thelma hopes to maintain and grow her business so she can have a better life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for groceries, rice, canned goods, instant noodles and soda to sell at her small store.

loans.name: Bosco

texts.en:
Bosco is 56 years old and married, with eight children, living in Kasese, Uganda. 

Bosco has a butchery.  He also  practices farming and sells diary milk as additional sources of income. He has been in his business since 2005. 

Bosco needs the loan to buy cows and goats to slaughter and sell.   He has a dream of buying land to construct a commercial house for renting, although he faces challenges of bad debtors and market competition.

loans.use: to buy cows and goats to slaughter and sell.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is 46 years old and married with four children, three of whom attend school, Mary Jean works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Jean runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Mary Jean has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future Mary Jean would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Rosa de 51 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija, ella se dedica a la crianza de ganado bovino y al cultivo de maíz, adicional también se dedica a la costura, tiene 6 años de experiencia agrícola, inicio con capital propio comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde ella reside, Rosa esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de vitaminas y concentrado para el ganado y asi poder seguir con la crianza y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 51 years old and lives with her daughter in a home that she owns. 

Rosa earns a living through a combination of businesses: agriculture and dressmaking. Six years ago, Rosa used money that she'd saved to establish herself as a farmer and rancher, and she has since cared for a herd of cattle and grown corn. 

Rosa sells her corn crop and cattle in neighboring towns, and is applying for a loan for the purchase of vitamins and concentrated feed for her cattle. Investing in these supplies will thus help her raise the herd and boost her income.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and concentrated feed for her livestock

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, 39, is married and a mother of two children from Matag-ob, Leyte. She has been engaged in hog-raising for more than a year now. This is the source of her income. 

Elizabeth is asking for a loan to buy more piglets to raise and more animal feed. This loan will help her improve her hog-raising business as well as her income. 

In the future, Elizabeth hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise and more animal feed

loans.name: Roldan

texts.en:
His name is Roldan, 34, and he is a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Corazon, an entrepreneur, and has one child who is in the elementary level in school. He has an ornamental and landscaping business which helps a lot with their daily personal and household needs.

Roldan has been in the ornamental plant and landscaping business for ten years. He grows various garden plants like ylang-ylang, golden shower, and dahlias, bromeliads and also a variety of hanging plants and other similar ones. He has been known to give good landscaping service to his clients. His regular customers are local tourists, neighbors and the nearby community. He earns a minimum of PHP 2000 in sales every week.

To help him grow his farm and continue his landscaping work, he is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan which he will use to buy fertilizer and various kinds of garden seedlings for productive and healthy ornamental plants. He thanks God for a good return on his investment and the financial help that will be given him for it will surely help in their daily needs and fund his child's education.

Roldan hopes that his ornamental and landscaping business will continue to flourish in the coming years. He aims to send his child to college. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers and plant inputs for healthy ornamental plants and equipment needed for his landscaping business.

loans.name: Cathierin

texts.en:
From Cavite, Philippines, Cathierin is married and has children. She is employed in a garment factory in Cavite through the auspices of the Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT). Cathierin works as a seamstress, sewing clothes according to the company's or client’s requirements. She uses a sewing machine and other stitching machines and hand-stitches hems and linings.

One of the main dilemmas of employees like Cathierin is meeting family expenses without having access to savings or credit. Workers can become heavily indebted to money lenders who take their ATM cards as loan collateral. 

For this reason, Cathierin is asking for your assistance to help her circumvent loan sharks. She has previously accessed loans through CCT and had no problem with repaying them since the loan payments were automatically deducted from her paycheck. She is seeking a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos to pay for the expenses of her child's baptism.

Cathierin hopes that her family will always be healthy and happy. She looks forward to your positive response and says any amount will surely be of great help. 

CCT works to provide local communities with a trained labor force, equipped with the skills required for employment in construction and site-development projects. The cooperative assists its members in acquiring these skills, which are necessary for finding quality jobs, cultivating savings consciousness and providing decent shelter, food and education for their families. Its core programs include Professional Staff Services, Workers Guild Development and Enterprise Development and Consultancy Services.

CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for factory workers such as Cathierin before they start their daily work routines. Bible readings, prayer devotions, spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and after-work hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: to pay for baptismal expenses.

loans.name: Roeun's Group

texts.en:
Living in a house located in the Koh Sotin district of Kompong Cham province, Roeun is 31 years old and married. She has five children, two of whom depend on her. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice for almost 10 years, and she also works as a tailor to earn more income. 
Her group consists of eight members who are all female. She has been a member of VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the loans. The past loans have helped her family to have a better standard of living. She is now leading her group to request a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to expand the current business and earn more income to support her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Harrison Duvan

texts.es:
Apoyado por sus familiares y amigos quienes le enseñaron todo acerca de la barbería el joven Harrison de tan solo 18 años de edad monto su negocio, lleva dos años de operación, este joven trabaja por su estudio, por su familia, por su madre por  salir adelante.

Es joven sus sueños son locos, quiere viajar, quiere un automóvil, quiere una casa y se siente feliz de desarrollar su actividad y ahora se encuentra trabajando para mejorar.

Lo que se le ocurrió fue iniciar a vender mercancía Urbana como lo son gorras, camisas jersey, pantalones anchos, para ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para comprar este tipo de mercancía y una vitrina para exhibir.

Te invitamos a que apoyes la juventud colombiana que quieren cambiar la cara de Colombia demostrando que son capaces de crear y mantener empresa.
texts.en:
Supported by his family and friends who taught him all that he knows about the barbershop,  the young man Harrison, who is only 18 years old, began his business.  He has been doing this job for two years.  This young man works for his studio, for his family, for his mother, and to get ahead.

He is young, and his dreams are crazy.  He wants to travel, he wants a car, he wants a house, and he feels happy to develop his job.  And now he is working to improve.

What occurred to him was to start to sell Urbana merchandise such as hats, jerseys, and wide pants.  For that, he is requesting a loan to buy this type of merchandise and a showcase in which to display it.

We invite you to support this young Colombian who wants to change the face of Colombia showing that they are capable of creating and maintaining a business.

loans.use: To sell Urbana merchandise in his barbershop.

loans.name: Iris Lorena

texts.es:
Iris, es casada, vive con una hija de 4 años de edad y es dependiente, siendo una jovencita aprendió a comercializar productos varios, con el paso del tiempo logro establecer una tienda con un inventario mejor surtido, atiende a sus clientes de siete de la mañana a cuatro de la tarde.
Está solicitando un crédito para comprar bebidas, granos básicos, huevos, papel higiénico, productos enlatados, etc., diversificará mucho más su tienda con productos que satisfagan las necesidades de sus  clientes y le generan nuevos ingresos.
Los anhelos de Iris son mejorar su situación económica para ofrecer un mejor futuro a su familia y mantenerse trabajando para fortalecer más su negocio.
texts.en: Iris is married and lives with her four year old daughter. She works as a saleswoman. When she was very young, she learned to sell various products. Over time, she was able to open a store with a better stocked inventory. She assists her customers from seven in the morning to four in the afternoon. She is requesting a loan to buy drinks, basic grains, eggs, toilet paper, canned products, etc., to diversify more her store with products that will satisfy the needs of her customers and that generate new income. Iris's wishes are to improve her financial situation in order to offer a better future to her family, and to keep on working to strengthen more her business.

loans.use: to buy drinks, basic grains, eggs, toilet paper, canned products, etc. to diversify more her store.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en:
