Wilfredo is a 56-year-old married man with 18-year-old child. He catches and sells fish. He has been engaged in fishing for more than 10 years. 

He is asking for a loan to buy a fishing  net. This investment will help improve his ongoing catch and enable him to sell more fish. With an increased income, he will be able to afford healthy diets and continue financing the schooling of his child.  

Wilfredo would like to expand his fishing business so that it becomes sustainable.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net

loans.name: Jose Andres

texts.es: Jose de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos y su esposa, el se dedica a la crianza de ganado de engorde y al cultivo de granos básicos, tiene 4 años de dedicarse la crianza de ganado y 10 años a la agricultura, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside y ya tiene muchos clientes, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas y la compra de ganado para continuar con su trabajo y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Jose, 35 years old, lives in his own house with his two children and his wife.  He makes a living raising beef cattle and by cultivating basic grains.  He has been raising cattle for four yeas and farming for ten years.  He sells his products in the surrounding areas where he resides, and he has many customers.

He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and to buy cattle to continue with his job and, therefore, be able to have better income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and to buy cattle.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed with 7 children and three go to school. She has no additional family members.

Betty sells green bananas at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She gets additional income from rental houses. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 900,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas. Her major challenges includes seasonality and transportation.

Her goal and aspiration is to build more rental houses . She lives in her own house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: Juan de 68 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica desde hace 20 años a la agricultura siembra maíz, maicillo y hortalizas de verano, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Juan, 68 years old, lives in his own house with this wife.  For 20 years he has made a living farming.  He plants corn, sorghum, and summer vegetables.  He sells his products in the different markets that he are near his home.  With that which he obtains from his sales, he manages to cover some of the cost that he has with his home.  

He is requesting this loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pest control, etc, and to improve the land the is shown in the picture, to be able to continue with his job and to have better income.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pest control, etc, and to improve the land.

loans.name: Julifer

texts.en:
Julifer is a sari-sari store owner from Matag-ob, Leyte. She is married and has three children ages 14, 13 and 11. Julifer has operated her store for more than 12 years now. She also raises pigs in her backyard. These are the sources of her income. Her husband works as a carpenter.

Julifer is asking for a loan to buy more stock of items like canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, soap, toiletries, cooking oil, condiments, and piglets and animal feed. This loan will enable her to improve her inventories in her store as well as her hog raising venture.

In the future, Julifer dreams of making her businesses successful and stable.

loans.use: to buy more stock like canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, soap, toiletries, cooking oil, condiments for her sari-sari store and piglets and animal feed for her pig fattening business

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a 28 year old married woman from Matag-ob, Leyte. She is the mother of a 7 year old child.

Irene runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Irene needs a loan to buy new stocks for her store. She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise like canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, soap, toiletries, cooking oil, condiments, bread and biscuits.

A loan will help Irene to improve her stock thus attracting more buyers to her store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, soap, toiletries, cooking oil, condiments, bread and biscuits.

loans.name: Leonor Maria

texts.es:
Leonor es una modista de 52 años de edad que busca en su negocio poder pagar la educación de sus hijos, ella arregla ropa, y aparte compra lycras para confeccionar ropa deportiva, un negocio que ha estado explorando pero que ha sido muy rentable y gratificante para ella.

Trabaja diariamente 8 horas, en su nueva forma de vida motiva por sus resultados quiere solicitar un préstamo el cual invertirá en la compra de lycra para fabricar un mayor número de prendas deportivas, ya que está en crecimiento la tendencia por el deporte y el gimnasio.

Para ella una mujer que trabajo toda la vida pero no en una entidad y que no cuenta con un historial crediticio, se le dificulta mucho un préstamo, pero con el apoyo de interactuar esto cambio pues no solo está dispuesto a desembolsar el dinero la apoyara con asesorías puntuales para que su negocio sea préstamo.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de lycras, con las que diseñara ropa deportiva para hombre y mujer, esperando que tenga mucha acogida en el mercado.
texts.en: Leonor is a 52 year old seamstress, who with her business wants to pay for her children's education. She fixes clothes, and besides that she buys lycra fabric to sew sports clothes, a business she has been exploring, but that has been very profitable and gratifying for her. She works 8 hours daily. In her new way of life, motivated by her results, she wants to request a loan which she will use to buy lycra fabric to produce more amount of sports clothing items, because the tendency for sports and the gym is growing. For her who is a woman who worked her whole life, but not at a company and who does not have a credit history, it is very difficult to get a loan; but with the support of Interactuar this has changed, because they not only disburse the loan, but also support her with timely counseling for her business. She is requesting a loan to buy lycra fabric with which she will design sports clothes for men and women, with the hope that it will have a good reception in the market.

loans.use: to buy lycra fabric to sew sports clothes for sale.

loans.name: Maria Paula

texts.es:
Doña Paula vive en la aldea las marías una comunidad al norte de Honduras. Vive con su esposo y un hijo,  los cuales le ayudan en su negocio. Doña Paula es muy trabajadora y responsable en el año 2013 ella se enfermo al extremo que fue internada 2 meses es un hospital al norte de Hondura. Gracias a Dios ella se mejoro y de nuevo volvió a colocar su pulpería ya que por estar pendiente de su salud su esposo e hijo se tuvieron que vender su negocio y un ganado que tenían. Y valió la pena ya que de nuevo están luchando para seguir adelante con su negocio.
Doña Paula su pulpería tiene más de 18 años de tenerlo y esta solicitando el préstamo para comprar un freezer para su pulpería.  Espera que con este freezer  pueda comprar más carnes ya que la demanda que tiene es bastante.
El sueño de doña Paula es  poder hacerle mejoras a su casa y lo puede obtener teniendo bien surtido su negocio.
                                                                                                                                                                        




                     Santa Cruz de Yojoa Cortes. Honduras -Febrero-2015
texts.en:
Doña Paula lives in the village of Las Marías, a community in the north of Honduras. She lives with her husband and son, which help her with her business. Paula is a hardworking and responsible woman.

In 2013, she became very sick and had to stay in the hospital for 2 months in the north of Honduras. Thankfully she got better and returned to invest in the grocery store, for while she was out for her health, her husband and son had to sell the business and livestock they had. It was worth it, and now they are trying to get ahead with their business. 


Doña Paula has owned her grocery store for over 18 years. She asks for this loan to buy a freezer for the store. She hopes that with this freezer she will be able to buy meat, as her demand is quite great. 

Her dream is to make improvements to her home by keeping her business well stocked. 




                     Santa Cruz de Yojoa Cortes. Honduras -February-2015

loans.use: to buy a freezer for her grocery store

loans.name: Julio Ernesto

texts.es: Julio de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, se dedica a esta actividad desde que era un niño, aprendió este trabajo con su padre, su producto lo comercializa en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas es como logra salir adelante, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y asi poder seguir con sus siembras ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo.
texts.en: Julio is 38 years old. He lives in his own house with his wife and two children. He works growing corn and beans. He has worked in this field since he was a child, and learned this job from his father. His products are commercialized in the different markets near his house, which produce enough income to get ahead. He is asking for a loan to buy agricultural inputs such as fertilizers, manure, plague controllers, herbicides, etc. and thus continue with his crops which are his sole source of income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, manure, plague controller, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Alexia Jackima

texts.es:
El sueño de Alexia es graduarse de la universidad, este año. Ella siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una joven responsable y emprendedora, por ello desde adolescente comenzó a trabajar en una farmacia, ahí se enamoró de su actual profesión, y con la ayuda de sus padres, pudo iniciar su vida universitaria con la esperanza de prosperar y ayudar a su familia con los gastos económicos.
Alexia solicita el crédito para la compra de una computadora y para solventar los gastos de su título universitario. Esto le será de mucha ayuda porque podrá apoyarse con su nuevo sistema de cómputo y también podrá iniciar su vida profesional de tiempo completo. Entre sus planes a futuro está: abrir un negocio farmacéutico y así convertirse en empresaria.
texts.en: Alexia's dream is to graduate from college this year. She has always been known as a responsible and entrepreneurial young woman, given that, since she was a teenager,  she started to work in a pharmacy. That is how she fell in love with her current profession, and with her parents help she was able to start her college life with the hope of progressing and be able to help her family with their economic expenses. Alexia is asking for a loan to buy a computer and to cover the expenses for her college degree. This will be of great help because she will help herself with the new computer, and will also be able to start her new career full time. One of her future plans is to open a pharmaceutical business and thus become an entrepreneur.

loans.use: To purchase a computer and to cover the expenses for her college degree.

loans.name: Neftiss Shirley

texts.es:
Neftiss es una mujer casada madre de dos hijos de 4 y 13 años de edad, con su negocio de café internet logra generar el sustento para ellos, aparte de sus servicios, oferta productos de papelería, y ahora su pensado es iniciar con la impresión y fotocopias, pero para ello le hace falta una impresora multifuncional puesto que el precio está fuera de su alcance.

Ya que su idea es transcender, mejorar sus ventas, aumentar sus clientes, tener algo más que un simple negocio de barrio, dar la mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos, la señora Neftis quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de una impresora multifuncional.

Ella tiene la fe de que será muy importante este activo para su negocio ya que sus vecinos reiteradas ocasiones le piden el servicio de impresión y fotocopiado.
texts.en:
Neftiss is a married woman with two children who are 4 and 13 years old. With her internet café business, she manages to support them. Aside from her internet services, she offers stationary products, and her current plans are to start offering printing and copying services. But for this, she needs a multifunctional printer and the price is out of her reach.

Her goal is to go farther, improve her sales, and increase her customers. She wants to have something more than a simple neighborhood business and to give her children the best quality of life. For this, Neftis is requesting a loan to purchase a multifunctional printer.

She has faith that this investment will be very important for her business because on many occasions, her neighbors have asked her for printing and copying services.

loans.use: to buy a multifunctional printer

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos, de 25 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a hacer los oficios de la casa, tienen dos hijos, aún están pequeños y no estudian, su mamá también vive con él.

Carlos, tiene venta de pollos de engorde, ya lleva dos años de experiencia en el negocio, comenzó comprando pocas aves para criarlas y venderlas.- Carlos, también trabaja como motorista particular en camiones, antes solo trabajaba como ayudante de un agricultor.- Actualmente, su trabajo está a 15 minutos desde su casa; en el negocio se involucra su pareja y su mamá para ayudarle en la venta y sus labores comienzan desde las 5:00 a.m. 

Carlos, necesita el crédito para comprar más pollos de engorde, concentrado y algunos recipientes para ponerles la comida. El préstamo mejorará su granja, porque tendrá más pollos para la venta y sus ingresos serán más.
 
Sus sueños son, tener una granja grande con pollos de engorde y gallinas ponedoras de huevos. Además, espera darles a sus hijos una vida llena de oportunidades y que aprendan el negocio.
texts.en:
Carlos, 25 years old, studied until third grade.  He is married, and his partner is a homemaker.  They have two children.  They are still young and do not go to school.  Also, his mom lives with him.

Carlos sells broiler chickens.  He now has two years of experience in this job.  He began buying a few birds to raise them and to sell them.  Carlos also works as a driver, in particular trucks.  Before, he only worked as an assistant to a farmer.  Currently his job is 15 minutes from his house.  In his business, he involves his partner and his mother to help him in the sales.  His labors begin at 5:00 in the morning.

Carlos needs the loan to buy more broiler chickens, concentrate, and some containers in which to put their food.  The loan will improve his farm because he will have more chickens to sell and his income will be more.
 
This dreams are to have a bigger farm with broiler chickens and laying hens for eggs.  Additionally, he hopes to give his children a life full of opportunities and that they learn the business.

loans.use: To buy more broiler chickens, concentrate, and some containers in which to put their food.

loans.name: Servio Antonio

texts.es: A sus 64 años de edad Antonio aun trabaja duro para los gastos de su hogar donde vive con su esposa, Antonio tiene 4 hijos mayores de edad, Antonio vive en su humilde casa con su esposa, una hija y una nieta, la esposa de Antonio se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, Antonio se dedica a la crianza de terneros y el dinero del crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de un ternero ya que Antonio vive en el campo  y esa es su fuente de ingresos. Antonio aspira comprar mas terneros y seguir adelante en su negocio pese a su enfermedad auditiva que le apareció con la edad.
texts.en:
At 64 years old, Antonio still works hard for the costs of his home where his wife lives.  Antonio has four older children.  Antonio lives in a  humble house with his wife, a daughter, and a granddaughter.  Antonio's wife makes a living raising small animals.  Antonio makes a living raising calves.

He will invest the money from the loan to buy a calf since Antonio lives in the country and that is his source of income.  Antonio hopes to buy more calves and to get ahead in his business despite his ear disease that appeared with age.

loans.use: To buy a calf.

loans.name: Dalia Esther

texts.es:
Dalia es una mujer muy capaz, que muestra gran fortaleza, tiene una tienda de abarrotes con la que genera los ingresos para su sostenimiento, vive sola y depende únicamente de su tienda puesto que su esposo falleció y no pudo tener hijos y en honor a su marido se quedó soltera trabajando y extrañándolo mucho.

En su negocio ha tenido muchos altibajos y todos ellos por la inexperiencia que tuvo un tiempo cuando inicio este negocio, lo cual lo hizo por necesidad adecuando un espacio de su casa, pero sigue adelante y la consigna es mantenerlo.

Su objetivo con su negocio es generar los ingresos para mantener su forma de vida, que no aguante hambre y en la medida de lo posible realizar algunas reformas a su hogar para hacerlo ver más bello.

Solicita un préstamo para abastecer su negocio, hay que tener en cuenta que esta mujer perdió a su marido y por el amor que le tenía se quedó sola y monto la tienda para poder alimentar y pagar su tienda.
texts.en:
Dalia is a very capable woman who shows great strength.  She has a grocery store with which she generates the income for her sustenance.  She lives alone and depends solely on her her store since her husband died and she could not have children.  And to honor her husband, she remains single, working and missing him a lot.

In her business, she has had many ups and downs, and all of that due to the inexperience that she had when she started this business, which is by necessity located in her home.  But she continues forward and is consigned to maintaining it.

Her objective with her business is to generate income to maintain her lifestyle, so that she does not go hungry, and as far as it is possible make some reforms to her house to make it look more beautiful.

She is requesting a loan to stock her business.  One must keep in mind that this woman lost her husband, and out of the love that she had for him, remained single, and started the store to be able to feed and pay for her store.

loans.use: To stock her store with basic grains, groceries, snacks, among others.

loans.name: Olinda Esperanza

texts.es: Olinda de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, ella se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos tiene 20 años de dedicarse a esa actividad, aprendió e ese trabajando cuando el ayudaba a su padre, vende sus cosechas en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y asi poder tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Olinda is 34 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and four kids.

She makes a living growing basic grains, which she has done for over 20 years. She learned how to do so by helping out her father. She sells her harvests in different markets that are near her home. 

She asks for this loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, insecticides, herbicides, etc. Thus, she will be able to have greater revenues.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Nelly  Lucia

texts.es:
Nelly, tiene una venta de productos de la canasta básica, vive con un hijo de 20 años de edad, trabaja de forma independiente de 6:00 a.m. a 7:30 p.m., ya cuenta con mucha experiencia en el negocio lo que le permite administrar bien las ganancias y ofrecer un servicio de calidad a sus clientes.
Necesita de un préstamo para invertir en aceite, jabón, bebidas, detergentes, pastas, etc., ofrecerá un inventario más surtido a sus clientes, al comprar por mayoreo ahorrara y tendrá mejores ganancias.
Sus sueños son seguir ampliando su negocio, tener un puesto en el mercado y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Nelly has a store where she sells basic household goods. She works independently from 6am to 7:30pm. She has a lot of experience which allows her to manage her business well and offer quality service to her customers. She lives with her 20-year-old son.

She needs a loan to buy oil, soap, beverages, detergents, pastas, etc so that she can stock up on inventory for her customers. By purchasing items in bulk she will save money and have greater profits.

Her dreams are to continue growing her business, to have a stall in the market, and to help her family get ahead.

loans.use: to buy oil, soap, beverages, detergents, pastas, etc to stock her store.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi est une femme mariée qui est âgée de 30 ans. Habitant à Agoè, Afi est une mère de trois enfants à sa charge et travaille activement pour leur épanouissement. Pour parvenir à ses fins, Afi prépare et vend du fromage de soja en parcourant tout son quartier afin de satisfaire agréablement ses clients. Afi achète sa marchandise quatre fois par mois au marché et demande ce prêt pour commander quelques sacs de soja. Afi souhaite tirer un bénéfice pour contribuer à l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Afi is a 30-year old married woman living in Agoè. She has three dependent children and works very hard to ensure their well-being. In order to provide for her children, Afi prepares soy cheese she sells as an itinerant vendor. She stocks up four times a month at the market and is seeking this loan in order to buy bags of soy beans. Afi would like to earn a revenue to contribute to her children's education.

loans.use: to buy six bags of soy beans.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is married with six children, two of whom go to school. She has one additional family member, a grandchild. She resides in her own house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

Margaret sells charcoal on a retail basis at the market. She has been in this business for 14 years working six days a week. She earns additional income from roasting maize. 

Margaret has applied for a loan of UGX 700,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. 

Margaret is aspiring to build houses to rent.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Ana Ruth

texts.es: Ana de 34 años de edad es una mujer emprendedora que habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 3 hijos de 2, 4 y 11 años de edad, el de 11 años se encuentra estudiando. Ella es una mujer visionaria que buscando la manera de tener mejores ingresos y más tiempo para sus hijos decidió hace 6 años dedicarse a la venta de ropa actividad que realiza de forma ambulante recorriendo las calles de su municipio para ofrecer sus productos. Ana realizo anteriormente un  crédito con FUSAI el cual utilizo para encementar una parte del piso de su vivienda, por lo que actualmente solicita un crédito a FUSAI para terminar de encementar la otra parte del piso y para ello invertirá en: cemento, arena, grava y mano de obra para encementar el piso de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ana, 34, is an enterprising woman who lives in her own residence with her life partner and three children, 2, 4, and 11.  The 11-year-old is studying.  She is a visionary woman who, looking for a way to have better income and more time for her children, decided to make a living selling clothing which she does itinerantly, roving the streets of her municipality in order to offer her products.
Previously, Ana obtained a loan from FUNAI which she used to cement a part of the floor of her residence.  Now she is requesting a loan from FUNAI in order to finish cementing the other part of the floor and to do it she will invest in cement, sand, gravel, and the labor payment in order to cement the floor of her residence.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, and the labor payment to cement the floor of her residence.

loans.name: Jose Domingo

texts.es: Jose de 58 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz, posee 25 años de dedicarse a esa actividad, la cual inicio con capital propio, cuando ya esta su cosecha la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía, para comercializarlos en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su casa, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas para la preparación de la tierra como fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y asi poder seguir con sus siembras que le generan buenas ganancias.
texts.en: Jose, age 58, lives in his own house with his family group.  He works growing corn.  He has worked in this business for 25 years, and he started it with his own capital.  When his harvest is ready, he stores it in the granaries shown in the photo, in order to sell it in the various markets close to his house.  He is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies for preparing the land, such as fertilizer, compost, pest control, weed killer, etc.  He will thereby be able to continue sowing his crops, which generate good profits for him.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, compost, pest control, weed killer, etc.

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de ganado, es una persona muy sencilla que se esfuerza por mantener su negocio en el mercado, vive con su compañero de vida y un hijo de 17 años de edad, el cual depende económicamente, el negocio lo ha practicado toda su vida y se lo enseñaron sus padres, hoy en día lo desempeña con ayuda de su familia, no tiene un horario establecido, su ventaja es que es propietaria de los terrenos en que trabaja.
Invertirá en zacate molido y concentrado para alimentar al ganado, será de ayuda para enfrentar la época seca, espera fortalecer más su negocio para ir cambiando su situación económica.
Sus objetivos son adquirir experiencia en el uso de créditos para mantener su negocio  generándole los ingresos que necesita para cambiar el estilo de vida familiar.
texts.en:
María makes a living raising and selling livestock. She is a simple person who fights to keep her business in the market. She lives with her life partner and 17 year old son, who depends on her financially. 

She has been in the business her entire life, which she learned from her parents. Today she works with the help of her family. She doesn’t have a fixed schedule; the advantage is that she is the owner of the lands she works on.

She will use the loan to buy ground and concentrated feed to fatten the livestock. It will be helpful to prepare for the dry season. She hopes to strengthen her business to improve her financial situation. 

Her objectives are to acquire experience in using loans to maintain her business. The revenues she earns will be useful to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ground fodder and concentrated fatten the livestock

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a 47-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Leyte, Philippines. 

Rowena earns a living through her retail sales of clothes such as pants, dresses and others. Rowena has been in this business for more than two years now. This is the source of her income. 

Rowena is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell, such as pants, dresses, undergarments and others. A loan will help her increase her stock thus attracting more buyers to her store.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell such as pants, dresses, undergarments and others

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bread, tomatoes, cabbage, sausages, oil, etc. so she will develop the hot dog sales to cover the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Yolver Fabian

texts.es:
Yolver un hombre de 37 años de edad, que vivió y se crio con las excelentes costumbres del campo, sus valores de respeto, amor por la tierra son de admirar, él es un hombre soltero que desde muy joven abandono el nido en busca de su propio camino y ahora se desempeña como productor agropecuario, tiene dos vacas y con ellas logra generar el sustento para alimentarse y pagar las cuentas.

Inicio el negocio pro vocación al trabajo independiente y adquirió toda la experiencia gracias a trabajos similares y a las enseñanzas de su padre.

Su objetivo a corto plazo es mejorar las condiciones de vida, en pocas palabras quiere reparar su hogar, cambiar las cosas viejas y desgastadas, reparar el techo, las cercas que separan su terreno y poco a poco aumentar el número de animales en su granja.

Solicita un préstamo para completar el dinero que le están pidiendo para comprar 6 terneras, las alimentara, las criara y en un futuro serán unas potenciales productoras de leche bajo su manto.
texts.en:
Yolver, 37, was born and raised in the customs of the countryside. He has the admirable values of respect and love for his land. He is single and struck out on his own at a young age to find his way. Now he works as a farmer. He has two cows with which he generates enough income to feed himself and pay the bills.

He started this business because he likes to work independently. He gained experience from similar jobs and the teachings of his father. His short-term goal is to improve his living conditions by making repairs to his home and replacing things that are old and worn out like the roof and the fences that separate his land.

Little by little he hopes to increase the number of animals on his farm. He asks for a loan to buy 6 calves that he will feed and raise to be potential dairy cows.

loans.use: to buy 6 calves that he will feed and raise to be dairy cows.

loans.name: Liseth Paola

texts.es:
Liseth es una mujer joven de 25 años de edad, se dedica a la cría de ganado porcino gracias a esta actividad genera los ingresos para mantener a sus dos princesas de 5 años y 16 meses de vida, ella es una persona muy organizada, tiene unas cocheras de concreto con un sistema de hidratación y alimentación para cerdos, que le facilita mucho su trabajo y puede mantener en óptimas condiciones de salubridad.

Ella trabaja en post de sus hijas, quieren que estudien se capaciten y adquiera experiencia para afrontar en un futuro el mundo real, mientras las consentirá y los protegerá hasta que llegue el momento de su partida.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de lechones y alimento para sus cerdos.
texts.en:
Liseth, 25, raises pigs in order to make money to take care of her two daughters, ages 16 months and 5 years. She is very organized. She has pig sties made of concrete with a feeding and hydration system for the pigs, which makes her work a lot easier and maintains optimal conditions for health.

Liseth wants her daughters to go to school and learn and gain experience to face a future in the real world. Meanwhile she will protect them until the day she dies.

She asks for a loan to buy piglets and food for her pigs.

loans.use: to buy piglets and food for his pigs.

loans.name: Melbin Adilmar

texts.es: Melbin de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, el se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de ganado, tiene más de 20 años de dedicarse a esa actividad, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en sacos como los que muestra en la fotografía, para luego comercializarlos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas como: fertilizantes, abonos controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. para continuar con sus cultivos y asi tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Melbin, 39, owns the home where he lives with his two children. He is a farmer and raises cattle. He's been doing this for more than 20 years. When his harvest is ready he stores it in sacks like those shown in the photograph, which he later sells in different markets near his home. With his earnings he is able to cover some of the household expenses.

He is asking for a loan for agricultural inputs like fertilizers, compost that controls pests, herbicides, etc to continue with his crop production and make more money.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides, compost to control pests, etc.

loans.name: Jesus Hernando

texts.es:
Jesús cultiva mangos y aguacates, tiene un terrero en la zona del Carmen del viboral, su actividad es muy importante ya que surte la plaza de mercado del sector, agradece mucho por esta bendición que recibe dado que puede contar con trabajo para llevar el sustento con el que alimenta a su esposa y dos hijos.

Una persona como Jesús debido a sus cultivos se enfrenta a muchos problemas como lo son robos, plagas, dificultades climáticas, altos costos de insumos y todas esas pérdidas se ven muy reflejadas cuando saca la cosecha y denota que la ganancia es muy poca.

Pensando en estas dificultades el señor Jesús quiere solicitar un préstamo que invertirá en la compra de los siguientes productos:

•	Compra de insecticidas, fungicidas, larvicidas,
•	Comprar riegos y fertilizantes
•	Comprar cercas, madera para mejorar la seguridad para sus predios
•	Comprar semilla para plantar más árboles.
texts.en:
Jesús grows mangoes and avocados.  He has a plot of land in the zone of Carmen del Viboral.  His business is very important since it supplies the sector’s market square.  He is very grateful for this blessing that he has received, since it enables him to have work to bring sustenance with which he feeds his wife and two children.

Due to his crops, a person like Jesús faces many problems, such as theft, infestations, climate difficulty, and high costs of supplies.  All of these losses are reflected when he gathers the harvest and notes that the profit is very small.

With these difficulties in mind, Jesús wants to request a loan, which he will invest in the purchase of the following products:

•	Purchase of insecticides, fungicides, and larvicides
•	Purchase of irrigation and fertilizer
•	Purchase of fences and wood to increase security on his property
•	Purchase of seeds to plant more trees

loans.use: to buy supplies, irrigation, fertilizer, fences, and seeds.

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es: Sandra es una joven de 23 años de edad, Sandra esta casada y tiene 3 hijos de 1, 4 y 5 años de edad, Sandra juntamente con su esposo  se dedican a atender su local de venta de comida con mariscos, Sandra necesita el dinero del crédito para comprar mariscos y demás productos para preparar y vender a su clientela, Sandra tiene la aspiración de readecuar su negocio y por ende mejorar sus ventas para obtener mas ganancia, Sandra se a planteado la meta de trabajar duro y mediante su negocio lograr  bienestar de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sandra, 23, is married and has three children, ages 1, 4 and 5. Sandra and her spouse sell seafood. Sandra needs a loan to buy shellfish and other products that she needs to prepare the food and sell it to her customers.

Sandra hopes to make improvements to her business so that she can increase sales and make more profit. She has set a goal for herself of working hard and ensuring the well-being of her children through her business.

loans.use: to buy shellfish.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 29 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo se dedica a la siembra de maíz, cuenta con más de 5 años de experiencia en esa actividad, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en sacos así como los que muestra en la fotografía para luego comercializarlos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, la joven vive en casa propia con su hija, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y asi poder seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
This young woman has had her identity hidden because she is 29 years old and lives in a dangerous area. She has been growing corn for more than 5 years. When her harvest is ready, she stores it in sacks like the one shown in the photo which she later sells in different markets near her home.

She lives in her own home with her daughter. She is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, insecticides, herbicides, etc so that she can continue with her work and have better income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, insecticide, herbicide, etc.

loans.name: Fayez

texts.en:
Fayez is a 30-year-old single man who has been working as a barber for ten years to cover his needs and expenses. He is an ambitious man who has a good reputation in his region. He succeeded with his hard work and gained loyal customers. 

Fayez is trying his best to develop his business, thus he is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to move his barber shop to a better location, which is a little more crowded and will help him attract more customers. He also wants to buy new chairs for his new shop.

Fayez hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to move his barber shop to a better location and to buy new chairs for his new shop

loans.name: Victor Alfonso

texts.es:
Víctor, de 30 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a vender perfumes y carteras, tienen 1 hijo de 4 años de edad.

Víctor, tiene venta de ropa desde hace tres años, comenzó el negocio cuando compro algunas prendas para vender y así fue creciendo hasta que coloco un puesto fijo.- Víctor, antes solo era ayudante en un trabajo particular; su negocio está a una cuadra de distancia desde su casa y viaja a pie, el horario que tienen para abrir el negocio es desde las 8:00 a.m. hasta las 5:00 p.m.

Víctor, necesita el crédito para comprar 2 paquetes de ropa, porque ya los tiene encargados y solo está esperando que se lo envíen; su negocio mejorará con este préstamos porque tendrá más variedad de ropa y su necesidad será cubierta.

Sus sueños son, tener un puesto de ropa para él y otro para que se encargue su esposa.- Además, espera que su hijo crezca y tenga una buena educación.
texts.en:
Victor, 30, studied until the 9th grade. He is married and his wife sells perfumes and purses. They have one son, age 4.

Victor has been selling clothing for three years. He started the business when he bought some garments to sell, and continued to grow until he had a market stall. Victor used to just be an assistant in a private job. Now his business is one block from his home and he travels on foot. He is open from 8am until 5pm.

Victor needs a loan to buy two packets of clothing because he has already ordered them and is just waiting for them to be sent. His business will improve with this loan because he will have more variety of clothing and his needs will be met. His dreams are to have two clothing stalls - one for him, and one for his wife. His also hopes his son grows up and has a good education.

loans.use: to buy two packets of clothing.

loans.name: Eleanor

texts.en:
Eleanor is a 40-year-old married woman and a mother of six children from Matag-ob, Leyte. 

She has engaged in the hog raising business for more than two years now. This is the source of her income.  Eleanor is asking to take a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed for them. 

A loan will help her improve her hog raising business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed for them

loans.name: Jonavel

texts.en:
Jonavel is a 33-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. She lives with her family in Matag-ob, Leyte. 

She runs a small sari-sari or variety store business in the market. She wants to take a loan to buy goods like noodles, vegetables, cooking oil and condiments, seasonings, and others. 

This loan will enable Jonavel to improve her inventories, thus attracting more customers and buyers to her store.

loans.use: to buy goods like noodles, vegetables, cooking oil and condiments, seasonings, and others

loans.name: Toeb

texts.en:
Toeb, 44, lives in a community of Pursat Province, Cambodia. She is a lovely mother of seven children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland which is located near her house. So far, she has been in this type of business for twenty years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 4.00 a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is taking a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seedlings, pesticides, herbicides, and a forked hoe.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 51 years old, married to Onyari, and blessed with seven children. She has been a dairy farmer for the last 15 years and the business earns her KES 10,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy a dairy cow to enable her meet the demands of her clients for milk supply.

She plans to use the generated profits to repay the loan and educate her children. Her future hope is to be financially stable and expand in her agricultural sector.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to enable her meet the demands of her clients for milk.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mildred is 38 years old and all of her children are in school.

She has a buy and sell sea shells business in the Philippines. Mildred requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more sea shells to sell.

Mildred has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sea shells to sell

loans.name: Tilimbike Credit Group

texts.en:
Jenipher thanks Kiva for  the previous loan that they granted her. She used the loan to buy more fish and this successfully helped to increase her profits. With the profits she made, she was able to diversify her business by opening a restaurant and she runs this restaurant together with her husband.

Jenipher is now happy with this new business, as it brings her more profits than the previous one. She is requesting another loan  in order buy more foodstuffs needed for her business such as rice, Irish potatoes, and maize, as this will help help to further increase her profits.

She plans to open an orphanage, and hopes to continue helping the disadvantaged in the society.

loans.use: to buy rice, maize, and Iirsh potatoes for her restaurant.

loans.name: It

texts.en:
It, 36, lives in a community of Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She is a lovely mother of two children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland which is located near her house. So far, she has been in this type of business for ten years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 5.00 a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with two children, and one of her children goes to school. She has no additional family members. 

She sells green bananas and charcoal at the market on a retail basis. She has been in business for five years. She works six days a week. She requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas and bags of charcoal to sell. 

Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goal and aspiration is to build rental houses. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas and bags of charcoal

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, at heart, is a resourceful, loving man. His fatherly love has been enough to show him that he needs to work hard to help his children get ahead with excellent values and education. 

Peter, 46, is a smallholder farmer in the Kitale area of Kenya. In the past twenty years, he has bred more than one dairy cow and sheep and has developed his farm. He has also planted and sold a variety of crops. He says the secret to his success is thinking of farming as a way to make money, not just as a traditional way of life – adopting new technologies and methods, crop diversification, record-keeping and good planning also help. 

Peter was unable to study to get a professional career because of the economic situation that his family faced. However, he never gave up and he has been practicing farming. Because of how much he likes farming, he has even nicknamed one of his cows “Maua” (flower) which makes him a very proud farmer, especially when he is milking his cows. Through his dairy cow, he is able to get between 5-10 liters a day, and this helps him support his family. 

Peter also practices crop farming, but he has not been making good profits because of poor farming implements, and that is why he is kindly seeking a loan to buy farm implements. Through the loan, he will be able to buy high-quality seeds, good fertilizer, and pesticides that he will use to greatly improve his crop production. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques; using high-quality seeds will assure him of a bumper harvest and hence, increased profit levels. 

Peter is visionary, and his goal for the season is to boost his crop production and be able to get more crop output than the previous year. All this can be achieved through lenders’ help and goodwill. Peter believes that through the loan, he will turn around his family life and be able to give his child a solid educational background. This loan will be Peter’s way out of poverty.

loans.use: To buy farm implements

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 46-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Leyte, Philippines. Elizabeth has earned a living through her hog-raising business for more 10 years now. 

Elizabeth is asking to take a loan to buy additional piglets and animal feed. A loan will help her improve her hog-raising business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and animal feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to increase the milk supply to her clients.

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Rizalina is a 38-year-old married woman and a mother of two children ages 11 and 10. She lives with her family in Matag-ob, Leyte. Rizalina has been engaged in a hog-raising business for more than six years now. This is the source of her income. 

Rizalina is asking to take a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed. A loan will be of a great help for Rizalina for it gives her the opportunity to improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goods for the customers

loans.name: Ma. Ruby

texts.en:
Ma. Ruby is a 36-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Matag-ob, Leyte. She runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Ma. Ruby has been in the business for more than two years now. 

Ma. Ruby is asking to take a loan to buy more stock to sell like noodles, rice, canned goods, soap and toiletries, soft drinks and beverages, bread and biscuits, among other items. A loan will help her increase her stock, thus allowing her to sell more to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like noodles, rice, canned goods, soap and toiletries, soft drinks and beverages, bread and biscuits, among other items

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 28 years old, married and is blessed with two children. She is a dairy farmer and supplies milk to sell, a business she has been doing for the last five years.

She has applied for her first loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to buy dairy feed for her dairy cattle and hopes this will enable her to get more milk to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and buy another dairy cow.

Her future hopes are to grow her dairy farming and supply more milk in the area.

loans.use: to buy dairy feed for her cows and she hopes this will help her get more milk to sell.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
From Dasmariñas Cavite, Philippines, Geraldine is married and has children. She is employed in a garment factory in Cavite through the auspices of the Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT). Geraldine works as a seamstress, sewing clothing according to the company or client’s dictates. She uses a sewing machine and other stitching machines as well as handstitching hems and linings.

One of the main dilemmas of employees like Geraldine is meeting family expenses without access to savings or credit. Workers can become heavily indebted to money lenders who take their ATM cards as loan collateral.

For this reason Geraldine is asking for your assistance to help her circumvent loan sharks. She has previously accessed loans through CCT and had no problem in repaying them since the loan payments were automatically deducted from her paycheck. She is seeking a 9,000 PHP loan to buy groceries for her store and pay for her children's educational expenses and house renovation.

Geraldine hopes to give her children good educations. She wants her family to be always complete and happy. She looks forward to your positive response and says any amount will surely be of great help.

CCT works to provide local communities with a trained labor force equipped with the skills required for employment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative assists its members in acquiring those skills necessary for quality jobs, cultivating savings consciousness and providing decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs include Professional Staff Services, Workers Guild Development, Enterprise Development and Consultancy Services.

CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for factory workers such as Geraldine before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions, spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and after-work hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her store and pay for her children's educational expenses and house renovation.

loans.name: Esperanza Del Rosario

texts.es: Esperanza de 32 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 4 hijos de 12, 10, 5 y 2 años de edad que se encuentran estudiando. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se gana la vida atendiendo su pequeña tienda de productos básicos, actividad que realiza desde hace 10 años y que le ha permitido salir adelante al lado de su familia. Esperanza desea colocar un tapial alrededor de su terreno, ya que solo cuenta con unas varas de bambú que no le brindan mayor protección como se observa en la fotografía, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, maya ciclón y postes para colocar un tapial en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Esperanza is 32 years old and lives in her own house with her life partner and their four children, who are 12, 10, five and two years old and in school.

She is a hardworking woman who earns a living through her small store for basic products, an activity she's been doing for 10 years. This has allowed her to succeed alongside her family.

Esperanza wants to build a mud wall around her land. Right now, she just has some bamboo rods which don't provide good protection, as can be seen in the photo. For this, she's seeking a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, mesh fencing and poles to build a mud wall in her home.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, mesh fencing and poles to build a mud wall in her home.

loans.name: Dina Estelia

texts.es:
Dina, vende ropa para ambos sexos y variedad de sandalias, su familia está compuesta por su esposo y dos hijos, todos viven juntos, tiene su negocio desde hace más de 8 años, su jornada de trabajo es de seis de la mañana a tres de la tarde, lo emprendió por iniciativa propia y por la necesidad de apoyar económicamente a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar.
Comprará prendas de vestir y sandalias para tener mercaría que está de moda y que sus clientes  buscan, lo importante para Dina es mantener a sus clientes satisfechos para que sus ventas sean mayores y le generan nuevas ganancias.
Sus sueños son contar con un negocio más grande, cancelar su deuda y seguir siendo un apoyo para su esposo.
texts.en:
Dina sells clothes for both sexes, and a variety of sandals. Her family is made up of her husband and two children, who all live together. 

She's had her business for more than eight years. Her working day is from 6 a.m. to 3 p.m. She started it on her own initiative, and because of the need to support her husband financially with the household expenses.

She will buy clothing and sandals to have fashionable merchandise that her customers look for. The important thing for Dina is keeping her customers satisfied so her sales grow and she has more income.

Her dreams are to have a larger business, pay back her debt and continue being a support for her husband.

loans.use: to buy clothing and sandals to have fashionable merchandise that her customers look for.

loans.name: Jenny Alexandra

texts.es: Alexandra esta casada, tiene 25 años de edad, Alexandra tiene una hija de 4 años, Alexandra tiene arrendado un local donde atiende su negocio de venta de comida, Alexandra tiene su esposo que trabaja de chofer, Alexandra necesita el dinero del crédito para comprar productos para preparar y venderlo en almuerzos, desayunos, comidas rápidas y mas, Alexandra aspira mejorar su negocio, atraer mas clientela y de los ingresos espera cubrir los gastos de educación de su hija.
texts.en:
Alexandra is married and 25 years old. She has a four year old daughter. Alexandra has rented premises where she sets up her business selling food. Alexandra's husband works as a driver.

Alexandra needs the money from the loan to buy products to prepare and sell in breakfasts, lunches, fast foods and more. Alexandra aspires to improve her business, attract more customers and cover her daughter's education with the income.

loans.use: to buy products for preparing food.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a 68-year-old lady from Mamboleo Estate in Kisumu county. She is married and she supports 10 people in the family and has two children who are 30 and 15 years old respectively.

She is a farmer doing small-scale poultry farming. She has been doing this for the last 10 years and makes a monthly income of KES 40,000.

Rosemary has applied for her second loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase more chicken and animal feed and build another shelter for her chicks. This will enable her to get more income to support her family. She will use the anticipated profit to expand the business. Her dream is to become a large scale poultry farmer and support her family.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed and build another shelter for her chicks to enable her to get more income to support her family.

loans.name: Metrine

texts.en:
Metrine is a 28-year-old woman. She is an entrepreneurial woman who has been making a living farming for the last two years, in an attempt to give her family the best. She does so through her friendly manner and the good way in which she manages her finances. She farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Kitale, in the Rift valley region of Kenya. Metrine is happily married and together with her husband, blessed with one lovely child. For the past two years, she has been involved in mixed farming and her primary source of income has been growing maize and a variety of food crops. Metrine has been able to provide nutritious food for her family.

Although she has been making profits selling a variety of food crops, she is faced with a challenge of timely delivery of the produce to the market. This challenge has not made her give up. “I have to do something for my family,“ she said. Metrine mobilized other women in her village and joined Juhudi Kilimo, which is a microfinance institution that assists aspiring women like her. She is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy another motorbike. Metrine is from a remote village that has poor feeder roads and transporting her produce to the market has been a challenge; hence she has suffered so many losses. Perishable products such as milk, vegetables, and tomatoes require timely delivery to the market if you are to fetch a high price and through this loan Metrine is going to achieve her dream and goals.

Accessing a financial solution for women in Kenya is an uphill battle, but Metrine feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva that help out women so that they can gain respect and equality among their male counterparts. The benefits of this loan are astronomical, because Metrine will never suffer losses due to delays in delivery of produce to the market and also, she will increase her sales volume because she will be able to transport more goods to the market, hence increasing her income level. Metrine is a woman who is making a change for herself and for others in the community because she intends to employ someone who will be riding the motorbike and helping with farmwork. With your loan, Metrine will improve her living conditions and assure her child of a secure future.

loans.use: To buy another motorbike for timely delivery of produce to the market

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria earns a living offering printing and photocopying services. She is a widow and lives in Oroquieta. She is now well known for the nice quality of printing output she serves. She earns a net profit of about PHP 6,000 per month. Gloria is seeking a PHP 20,000 loan to buy additional bond papers, special papers, news print and toner for her printing services to maximize production and to be able to accept bulky orders. This is a regular loan, and will be repaid in few months. In her two previous loans, she has never had a delinquency. Gloria is very diligent and loves accuracy, which only adds to the effective management of her venture.

loans.use: to buy additional bond papers, special papers, news print and toner for her printing services to maximize production and to be able to accept bulky orders

loans.name: Milda

texts.en: Milda is 58 years of age and a resident of Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. She is married with five children. They have a little fishing business from which they earn for a living.  With their business, they meet many challenges, but they realized that it is good to face the challenges rather than get discouraged. Milda and her husband work hard in selling their catch to the market. Sometimes there are wholesale buyers from other towns and cities who come to buy their fish. With their savings, they welcome the idea of expanding their business and bought an engine for another fishing boat. They have requested from Paglaum MPC a PHP 5,000 loan to buy additional materials for her new fishing boat. They feel assured of Paglaum’s help, should there be a need for working capital in the future. Milda is now on her way to finish her new fishing boat and she is thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her new fishing boat

loans.name: Philis

texts.en:
Phillis is 39 years old. She is married to Peter and they are blessed with six children. She has had a farming business for 23 years, currently earning a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

She has borrowed KES 35,000 from VisionFund Kenya as her eighth loan, after successfully paying her previous loan. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizer, pesticides, animal feeds, animal licks, gum boots, a folk hoe and gloves. She hopes the anticipated profit will help her meet basic needs for her family.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a well expanded farming business, secure more market for her farm products, provide a better education for her kids and enjoy a better life with her kids.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, pesticides, animal feed, animal licks, gum boots, a folk hoe and gloves

loans.name: Ma. Berlinda

texts.en:
Ma. Berlinda is thankful that she was granted a 14,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses.

She would now like to apply for an 18,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, biscuits, rice noodles and frozen foods which she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She thanks God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Ma. Berlinda dreams of having a bigger general store and aims to give her children the best education to allow them better opportunities in life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: El Esfuerzo Es Grande Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “El Esfuerzo es Grande” conformado por 11 socias que buscan mejorar cada día. Este es el caso de Noymi de 49 años separada con 02 hijos, dependientes. Con los deseos de mejorar su situación económica decide poner una bodega de abarrotes, hace más de ocho años que viene ejerciendo dicho negocio. Los créditos de Edaprospo la han ayudado a mejorar cada vez  su negocio. Con el fin de seguir progresando solicitó el crédito para la compra de arroz, aceite, frijoles y lentejas. A futuro le gustaría terminar de construir su casa. El grupo “El Esfuerzo es Grande” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito. Noymi se encuentra sentada es la primera del lado derecho, ella viste polo color rosado.
texts.en:
The communal bank “El Esfuerzo es Grande” [The Effort is Great] consists of 11 female members who are seeking to improve every day. This is the case of Noymi, who is 49 years old and separated with 2 dependent children. In order to improve her financial situation she decided to set up a grocery store. She has been running the business for over eight years.

The Edaprospo loans have helped her to progressively improve her business. With the aim of continuing to progress she is requesting a loan to purchase rice, oil, beans and lentils. In the future, she would like to finish building her house. The  “El Esfuerzo es Grande” group thanks the people who make this loan possible. Noymi is seated first on the right and is wearing a pink top.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, beans and lentils.

loans.name: Margene

texts.en: Margene believes education is a key to succeed in life. She wants to become a midwife. Margene wants to help her family and her siblings to finish their education also. With the loan of PHP 15,000, she will be able to pay for her school fees. She is about to finish her course next school year. Margene sees herself to be in a position to help others too in the future.

loans.use: to pay for her school fees

loans.name: Lina

texts.en: Lina is gaining a profit through her retailing business, buying and selling various commodities in the local community and retailing rice. At the age of 36 and married, she never gets tired of displaying and tending her store since she is driven by her passion for selling and she earns a meager income from it that sufficiently supports her family. Lina is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of defaults. Now, she applied for a loan to purchase more inventory of various commodities and pay for five sacks of rice for retail to increase her inventories and her sales. Lina continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the determination and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory of various commodities and pay for five sacks of rice to sell to increase her inventories and her sales

location.town: Pagadian-Tuburan, Pagadian City Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is married and her husband is a farmer. With her desire to help the family, she has been engaged in a food vending business in Tangub, Philippines. She has been doing well at supporting the needs of the family. She has local customers and will also accept catering for added income. Recently, she borrowed an amount to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her food vending business to cook more dishes to offer more variety to her customers. This will help her in sustaining the needs of the family and help to support her children's education. She wants to expand her business and will be happy to open a small eatery at a nearby school.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her food vending business to cook more dishes to offer to her customers

location.town: Tangub-Sta. Cruz, Tangub, City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en:
Alphonsine is 27 years old. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 10 years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to the pay workers who harvested her maize. The profits from the business will be used to buy a cow to raise.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay workers who harvested her maize.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias is 38 years old. He is married with two children aged three and five years old. One of them goes to school. He is a farmer and has been growing maize for the past 15 years, while his wife is a businesswoman. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Annastacia

texts.en:
Annastacia is 39 years old. She is married and blessed with three children. 

She has had a hotel business, which she has been running for 13 years. 

Annastacia is taking a loan from VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase farm inputs for crop production and hopes this will help her pay school fees for her children. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a prosperous business and better the life of her family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for crop production to help her pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Abilio

texts.es:
El señor Abilio de 39  años de edad vive con su esposa  y sus dos hijos  en casa de sus suegros,   se dedica desde hace 5  años a la venta de verduras como, tomates, cebollas, repollos, papas, pepinos, zanahorias, plátanos, patastes, lechugas, brócolis,  manzanas, bananos, y otros mas, sus clientes son todas las personas que transitan por san Lorenzo y amistades que ya lo conocen,  sus clientes la prefieren por su buena atención y sus buenos productos.
Don Abilio radica en la ciudad de San Lorenzo Valle  al sur de Honduras, el  es un hombre  emprendedor  con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Don Abilio esta solicitando el préstamo para surtir su negocio de productos como, tomates, cebollas, repollos, papas, zanahorias, hojas para tamales,  lechugas, y también frutas como, sandias, melones, mínimos, manzanas, y uvas,  con este crédito él pretende mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
El sueño de Don Abilio es  crecer con su negocio para mejorar su calidad de vida y construir una casa propia en San Lorenzo.
San Lorenzo valle, Honduras - FEBRERO 2015.
texts.en:
Señor Abilio is 39 years old and lives with his wife and their two children in his parents-in-law's house. For the past 5 years, he has been selling fruit and vegetables like tomatoes, onions, cabbage, cucumbers, carrots, different types of banana, patastes, lettuces, broccoli, apples and others. His customers are people passing through San Lorenzo as well as friends of his. His customers prefer him for his good customer service and the quality of his produce. 

Abilio lives in the city of San Lorenzo in Valle in the south of Honduras. He is an enterprising man who wants to get on and he fights every day to improve his quality of life. Abilio is requesting this loan to stock his business with produce such as tomatoes, onions, cabbages, potatoes, carrots, leaves for tamales, lettuces and fruit such as melons, bananas, apples and grapes. With the loan he hopes to improve his income and quality of life. 

Abilio's dream is to grow with his business to improve his quality of life and build his own house in San Lorenzo.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions, cabbages, potatoes, carrots, leaves for tamales, lettuces and fruit such as melons and bananas

loans.name: Jennete

texts.en: Jennete is a 41-year-old married woman and the mother of three children from Leyte, Philippines. Jennete runs a small eatery or carenderia in her place. She sells home cooked foods to the people in her place. She has been in the business for more than 15 years now. Jennete is asking to take a loan to buy more materials like plates, chairs, spoons and forks, and other kitchen wares. A loan will help her improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy more materials like plates, chairs, spoons and forks, and other kitchen wares

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is a 63-year-old married woman and a sari-sari store owner from Leyte, Philippines. She has operated her business for more than two years now. Her husband works as a farmer. Virginia is asking to take a loan to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments among others. A loan will allow her to improve her stock, thus attracting more buyers to her store. In the future, Virginia dreams of making her business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments among others

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goods to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Emilda

texts.en:
Ma. Emilda is a resident of Cavite, Philippines. She is a widow and has a child. She is working in a garment factory and was employed through the help of Covenant Community Service Cooperative*.

Ma. Emilda is a Roving Quality Control Officer. She inspects garments, such as men's denim bottoms, during manufacturing operations to determine the number of defects per worker and reasons for rejects by examiners. She counts the number of pattern parts, layers of cloth prior to cutting, number of stitches per inch during sewing operations and collects other measurement knowledge.

One of the main dilemmas of employees like Ma. Emilda, is the improper balancing of their salaries with family expenses. They have no access to savings or credit, a situation that makes them heavily indebted to usurious money lenders who capture their automated teller machine (ATM) cards as loan collateral.

For this reason, Ma. Emilda is asking for your assistance to prevent her from being exposed to loan sharks. She has also previously accessed loans through CCT Credit Cooperative and she had no problem in paying it back since the loan payment is being deducted every pay day. She looks forward to your positive response and any amount coming from you will surely be of great help. She will use the loan for her child’s education.

Ma. Emilda wants to become a supervisor and manage her own business. She dreams of giving her child a better future. She meets up with her co-fellowship** members to share stories of her work.

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, qualify for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

** CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for the factory workers before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions and spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and post-working hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: To pay for the tuition fee of her child.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mary Jane is a businesswoman from Tangub, in the Philippines. She is 33 years old, married, and has an expertise in sales. Mary Jane runs a little sari-sari store from their house and she is also engaged in buying and selling dried fish. Mary Jane also makes banana snacks for additional earnings. This is how she helps her husband to sustain their family. Mary Jane is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken out several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. Now, she has applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items and to pay for more stock of dried fish to sell in the local community. Mary Jane continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items and to pay for more stock of dried fish to sell in the local community

location.town: Tangub-Sta. Cruz, Tangub, City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Eve

texts.en: Eve has owned and managed an internet cafe shop, in Sta Cruz Tangub City, Philippines. This has been doing well for five years, supporting the needs of the family. Recently, she borrowed an amount to purchase construction materials for the repair and improvement of her shop for the safety and comfort of her customers. This will help her to continuously sustain the needs of her family, especially her children's education. She wants to expand her business and would be happier have a commercial building in the city.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for the repair and improvement of her shop for the safety and comfort of her customers

location.town: Tangub-Sta. Cruz, Tangub, City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Florinda

texts.en: Florinda, age 55 and a widow, is from Aquino, Tangub, Philippines. Florinda joined PMPC and she appreciates the programs and services of the Co-op. The Co-op supported her by providing the capital to start her snack vending business. Helping the family survive, she gives her best ability to make delicious food snacks in order to sell out.  Florinda is now trying to expand her resources. She decided to engage in hog raising. She presented her project proposal to Paglaum MPC to finance the project and has applied for a loan of PHP 24,000 to build a concrete pig cage and pay for bags of feed and vitamins.  She is thankful to Paglaum MPC for financing her capital needs. In addition, she wants her business to be well known and to build a good business management for her loyal customers.  With her extra income, she wishes to live a happy and comfortable life.

loans.use: to build a concrete pig cage and buy bags of feed and vitamins

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rahel

texts.en:
Rahel is a 26-year-old lady from Mamboleo in Kisumu County which is located in the western part of Kenya.  She supports two people in the family and is married with two children.
