She has a boutique where she sells new clothes and new shoes. She has been operating this business for the last 10 years and makes a monthly income of KES. 25,000. She is taking her first  loan with VISION FUND KENYA, which she will use to purchase new clothes at a wholesale price to resell. She will use the anticipated profits to start a new business and support her family.

Her dream is to open another business and support her family.

loans.use: to purchase new clothes to resell.

loans.name: Tertuliana

texts.en:
Tertuliana is married and she is known in their neighborhood for being a hard-working mother. Tertuliana and her husband are both farmers. To earn additional income, she engaged in a snack vending business. 

Tertuliana became a member of PMPC and is actively participating in the various programs and services that the coop offers. She hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house, for which she has applied for a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase bags of cement for the house's flooring. 

She hopes to maintain her membership in good-standing, with a good repayment record. She has been given a priority, as a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). This is what she is thankful for, that all her financing needs are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement for her house flooring.

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es:
El señor Isidro de 53  años de edad vive con sus  hijas  en su casa propia,  se dedica desde hace 15  años a la actividad de Pesca, y venta de Pescado,  sus clientes son todas las personas que se dedican a la actividad de venta de pescado ambulante o en un determinado puesto del mercado, sus clientes lo prefieren por su buena atención y sus buenos productos.
Don Isidro radica en la ciudad de San Lorenzo Valle  al sur de Honduras, el  es un hombre  emprendedor  con deseos de salir adelante y lucha junto a sus hijas  día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida.
Don Isidro esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de dos redes nuevas,  con este crédito él pretende mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida, es un cliente existente y desea seguir trabajando con prisma.
Don Isidro su sueño es  crecer con su negocio, para sacar adelante a su familia, y poder estudiar a todos sus hijos.
San Lorenzo valle, Honduras, - MARZO 2015.
texts.en:
Isidro, 53 years old, lives with his daughters in his own house. He has worked for 15 years in fishing and selling fish. His customers are all the people who work selling fish as street vendors or from a stall in the market. His customers prefer him for his good service and his good products.

Isidro comes from the city of San Lorenzo Valle, in the south of Honduras. He is an enterprising man with desires to get ahead and fight with his daughters, day by day, to improve their quality of life.

Isidro is asking for a loan to purchase new nets. With this loan he plans to improve his income and his quality of life. He is an excellent client and wants to continue working with Prisma.

Isidro's dream is to grow with his business to get his family ahead and provide an education for all his children. 

San Lorenzo Valle, Honduras - March 2015.

loans.use: to purchase two nets for his business.

loans.name: Adonis Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Adonis Alberto de 42  años de edad vive con su esposa  y sus  hijos  en su casa propia,  se dedica desde hace 20  años a la actividad de Pesca, y venta de Pescado,  sus clientes son todas las personas que se dedican a la actividad de venta de pescado ambulante o en un determinado puesto del mercado, pero ellos en especial tienen una persona a la cual le venden todo el producto por conjunto y luego esa persona lo vende por mayor a todo el mercado de san Lorenzo,  sus clientes lo prefieren por su buena atención y sus buenos productos.
Don Adonis radica en la ciudad de San Lorenzo Valle  al sur de Honduras, el  es un hombre  emprendedor  con deseos de salir adelante y lucha junto a su esposa  día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida.
Don Adonis esta solicitando el préstamo para reparar uno de sus tres motores el cual se daño y lo necesita reparar para tenerlo en buen estado, con este crédito él pretende mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida, es un cliente existente y desea seguir trabajando con prisma.
Su sueño es  crecer con su negocio, para sacar adelante a su familia, y poder estudiar a todos sus hijos.
San Lorenzo valle, Honduras, - MARZO 2015.
texts.en:
Adonis Alberto, 42 years old, lives with his wife and their children in his own house. He has worked for 20 years in fishing and selling fish. His customers are all the people who work selling fish as street vendors or at a stall in the market, but they specifically have a person to whom they sell all their product and later this person sells it in bulk to all the markets in San Lorenzo. His customers prefer him for his good service and his good products. 

Adonis is from the city of San Lorenzo Valle in the south of Honduras. He is an enterprising man with desire to get ahead and fight with his wife, day by day, to improve their quality of life. 

Adonis is asking for the loan to repair one of the three motors which is damaged and he needs to repair it to have it in good condition. With this loan, he plans to improve his income and his quality of life. He is an excellent client and wants to continue working with Prisma. 

His dream is to grow with his business to get his family ahead and to be able to provide an education to all his children. 

San Lorenzo Valle, Honduras - March 2015.

loans.use: to repair the motor on his boat for his business.

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Juan Alberto de 43  años de edad vive con su esposa  y sus dos hijos  en su casa propia,  se dedica desde hace 20  años a la actividad de Pesca y venta de Pescado,  sus clientes son todas las personas que se dedican a la actividad de venta de pescado ambulante o en un determinado puesto del mercado, pero ellos en especial tienen una persona a la cual le venden todo el producto por conjunto y luego esa persona lo vende por mayor a todo el mercado de san Lorenzo,  sus clientes la prefieren por su buena atención y sus buenos productos.
Don Juan radica en la ciudad de San Lorenzo Valle  al sur de Honduras, el  es un hombre  emprendedor  con deseos de salir adelante y lucha junto a su esposa  día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida.
Don Juan esta solicitando el préstamo para comprar dos Trasmallos o Redes nuevas, ya que las que tiene están un poco dañadas, con este crédito él pretende mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida, es un cliente existente y desea seguir trabajando con prisma.
Don Juan su sueño es  crecer con su negocio, y llegar a tener unas 4 o 5 lanchas para alquilarlas a los pescadores, ya que solo cuenta con dos por los momentos.
San Lorenzo valle, Honduras - MARZO 2015
texts.en:
Juan Alberto, 43 years old, lives with his wife and their two children in his own house. He has worked for 20 years in fishing and selling fish. His customers are all the people who work selling fish as street vendors or at a stall in the market, but they have a specific person to whom they sell all their product together and later this person sells it in bulk to all the markets in San Lorenzo. His customers prefer him for his good service and his good prices.  

Juan is from the city of San Lorenzo Valle in the south of Honduras. He is an enterprising man with the desire to get ahead and fight with his wife, day by day, to improve their quality of life. 

Juan is asking for the loan to purchase two trammel nets or new nets since the ones he has are a bit damaged. With this loan, he plans to improve his income and his quality of life. He is an excellent client and wants to continue working with Prisma. 

Juan's dream is to grow with his business and come to have some 4 or 5 boats to rent them to fishermen since he only has two at the moment. 

San Lorenzo Valle, Honduras - March 2015

loans.use: to purchase two trammel nets for his business.

loans.name: Vanessa Margarita

texts.es: Margarita esta cruzando por los 22 años de edad, Margarita es madre soltera, tiene un hijo de 2 años y  esta esperando el nacimiento de su bebe, Margarita vive con su madre y su hijo, Margarita obtiene sus ingresos por medio de la crianza de animales menores, el dinero del crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos, Margarita tiene la aspiración de comprar mas  chanchos y de su negocio espera tener mas ingresos para poder comprar lo necesario para sus hijos y sobre todo estar lista para la llegada de su bebe.
texts.en: Margarita is 22 years old. Margarita is a single mother, she has a 2-year-old child and is awaiting the birth of her baby. Margarita lives with her mother and her son. Margarita gets her income by raising small animals. The money from the loan will be invested in the purchase of pigs. Margarita aspires to purchase more pigs and, from her business, she hopes to have more income to be able to purchase what is needed for her children and have everything ready for the arrival of her baby.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Segundo Esteban

texts.es: Segundo es un señor humilde, vive en un cuarto por el que paga arriendo, Segundo tiene 49 años de edad, Segundo tiene 2 hijos mayores de edad, Segundo apoya a sus hijos con lo poco que puede, Segundo se dedica a trabajar al jornal y a la crianza de animales menores, Segundo va  a invertir el dinero del crédito en la compra de chanchos  Segundo espera mejorar su negocio y  seguir apoyando a sus hijos.
texts.en: Segundo is a humble man. He lives in a room for which he pays rent. Segundo is 49 years old. Segundo has 2 adult children. Segundo supports his children with the little he can. Segundo works as a day laborer and raises small animals. Segundo will invest the money from the loan in the purchase of pigs. Segundo hopes to improve his business and continue supporting his children.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to put railings on the porch that she build recently.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Célibataire et âgée de 31 ans, Abla est une femme qui a deux personnes à sa charge. Habitant à Agoè, Abla est une revendeuse ambulante de chaussures, et est très dynamique dans son commerce. Abla s’approvisionne au marché quatre fois par mois. Pour commander quelques chaussures, Abla sollicite ce prêt pour réaliser sa commande afin d’avoir plus de revenus pour faire face aux besoins qu’elle affronte quotidiennement.
texts.en: Abla is single, 31 years old and has two dependents. An inhabitant of Agoè, Abla is a street vendor who sells shoes and a very dynamic businesswoman. She gets her supplies at the market four times a month. Abla is requesting this loan in order to be able to buy shoes, so that she can earn more money and meet her daily needs.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Juana Alberta

texts.es:
La  señora  Juana  de 40 años de edad es casada vive en sus casa de habitación, se dedica desde hace 2 años al negocio que es una PULPERIA donde vende lo que es manteca, azúcar, jabón frescos, y todo lo relacionado a la canasta básica, sus ventas son de lunes a domingo  en su casa de habitación donde le visitan sus clientes quienes vecinos amigos,  quienes le visitan todos los días de la semana, radica en san Lorenzo valle al sur de Honduras.
Doña Juana  solicita 15,000.00 lempiras para invertir en su pulpería en Carnes, azúcar, manteca, jabón, detergentes, embutidos, papel higiénico, arroz, frijoles, condimentos, churros y otros productos de consumo.  Con  el apoyo de este préstamo  Doña Juana desea salir adelante y seguir mejorando su negocio y brindarles un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Doña Juana su sueño es mejorar más su casa.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Febrero del 2015.
texts.en:
Juana is 40 years old, married, lives in their house, and has worked for 2 years at her business which is a grocery store where she sells butter, sugar, fresh soap, and everything for the basic pantry. Her sales are from Monday to Sunday, in her house where her customers come, who are neighbors, friends, who come every day of the week. She is from San Lorenzo Valle in the south of Honduras.  

Juana asks for 15,000.00 lempiras to invest in her grocery store in meat, sugar, butter, soap, detergent, cold cuts, toilet paper, rice, beans, seasonings, chips and other food products. With the support of this loan, Juana wants to get ahead and continue improving her business and offering the best service to her customers. 

Juana's dream is to improve her house more. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - February 2015.

loans.use: to purchase meat, sugar, butter, soap, detergent, cold cuts, toilet paper, rice, beans, seasonings, chips and other food products for her grocery store.

loans.name: Sada

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 37 ans, Sada est une femme qui vit à Agoè avec ses six enfants. Pour participer aux besoins, Sada prépare du riz qu’elle vend dans son quartier pour trouver un profit. Sada s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Pour acheter des sacs de sacs pour la préparation, Sada demande ce microcrédit pour financer sa commande et faire plus de revenus lui permettant de promouvoir l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Sada is married, 37 years old and lives in Agoè with her six children. To be able to contribute to the family's needs, Sada prepares rice which she sells in her neighbourhood for a profit. Sada gets her supplies once a month at the market. Sada is requesting this microloan in order to be able to fund an order of several bags of rice to prepare and sell so that she can earn more money and further support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy 4 bags of rice.

loans.name: La Gran Familia Group

texts.es:
Ana (la primera del lado derecho) es una mujer de treinta años de edad es casada, tiene una linda familia de tres hijos de las edades entre un año y tres años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Ana para apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos de la casa se dedica a la agricultura desde hace quince años, para ella trabajar en el campo es una gran bendición pues le ayuda a obtener sus ingresos y también cuidar la naturaleza.
Ana por ser la agricultura su única fuente de ingresos, ahora ha pensado en incrementar su cultivo, pero una de las limitaciones que Ana tiene es que no cuenta con suficiente dinero para poder comprar sus semillas de papa y fertilizantes, por tal motivo ella se ha unido a un grupo de personas para  solicitar un préstamo que lo invertir en su cultivo.
El gran anhelo de Ana es poder cultivar en esta época para obtener mejores ganancias y sostener a su familia.
texts.en:
Ana (the first on the right) is a woman, thirty years old, who is married and has a lovely family of three children between the ages of one and three. This humble family lives in a community in Sololá.

Ana, to support her husband with the household income, has worked in agriculture for the past fifteen years. For her, working in the countryside is a great blessing since it helps her to get her income and also care for nature. 

Ana, as agriculture is her only source of income, now is thinking of increasing her crops, but one of the limitations that Ana has is that she doesn't have sufficient money to be able to purchase her potato seeds and fertilizer. For this reason, she has joined a group of people to ask for a loan to invest in her crops. 

Ana's great desire is to be able to plant in this season to have more income and sustain her family.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Tunupa Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “TUNUPA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Ollanataytambo, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Bethy ella es soltera y tiene 35 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes , la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, azúcar, aceite y arroz.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Tunupa communal bank group. This bank is located in Ollanataytambo district, belonging to Urubamba province and Cusco department. 

Bethy is single and is 35 years old and has 2 children. She works in her business, a grocery store. She sells basic products such as rice, sugar, milk, and oil. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. She has had this business for 5 years now and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to expand her grocery store business. She asks for the loan to purchase milk, sugar, oil, and rice. 

The other members work in an animal sales business, a clothing sales business, a grocery store business and a food sales business.

The member is grateful to those who are part of this dream through this platform and promises to make the payments on the established schedule.

loans.use: to purchase milk, sugar, oil and rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay to make a dental plate and other dental work that he needs to look better.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is a 32-year-old merchant from Leyte, Philippines. She runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Wilma has been in the business for almost four years now. 

As of this time, Wilma would like to take a loan to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, rice, bread and biscuits, soap and detergents, mosquito repellents, tissue paper, soda and beverages. 

Wilma believes that a loan will allow her to augment her inventories, thus attracting more buyers in her store. In the future, Wilma hopes to make her business more profitable and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, rice, bread and biscuits, soap and detergents, mosquito repellents, tissue paper, soda and beverages

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
A 46-year-old married woman from Leyte, Philippines, Emma earns a living through a hog-raising business. She has been in the business for more than four years now. 

Emma is asking to take a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed. A loan will enable her to improve her hog-raising business as well as her income. Emma’s future dreams include the expansion of her business, as well as to continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed

loans.name: Mchakato Group

texts.en:
Tumaini, who is in her early 40s, is single with three kids who are still in school. She has been selling medicine in a small shop for 13 years now. She works from 8 am to 7:30 pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Tumaini's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy medicines and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees, saved some in her bank account, repaid her loan, and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to buy the fast-moving medicines in her shop. She dreams of opening an official pharmacy. 

Tumaini will share this loan with her loan group, Mchakato, which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the fast-moving medicines in her shop.

loans.name: Mercedes Margarita

texts.es:
En el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.  Se reúne cada quince días las socias del Grupo de Crédito 24 De Diciembre.
En este lugar vive la señora Mercedes, tiene 48 años de edad está casada y de esta relación tuvo seis hijos pero dos fallecieron tiempo atrás, los cuatro que tiene son de 32, 27, 24 y 13 años de edad, el menor estudia en escuela y es el que  aun viven en su casa. Su esposo es comerciante de legumbres.
Doña Mercedes tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí ella con la ayuda de los créditos que ha recibido de la Fundación y de las personas que hacen que ella pueda recibir los créditos ha podido de a poco ir mejorando su local, allí ella se gana la vida vendiendo víveres de toda clase como  arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, carnes, ciertas cosas de bazar,  agua en bidón, sodas, golosinas, entre otras,  ella cada vez que recibe un crédito lo invierte en mayor variedad de productos lo cual le ha servido para aumentar su clientela, ella también le da parte dl crédito para que su marido salga por la localidad a vender frutas y legumbres con lo cual él se gana algo que junto a su ganancias en su tienda le permiten salir adelante. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda y va a comprar víveres,frutas y legumbres para su marido. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ella aumenta su negocio. Sus sueños seguir mejorando y tener un mejor local.
texts.en:
In Montecristi, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts which are known nationally and internationally, a place of famous straw hats, the members of the 24 de Diciembre communal bank group meet every two weeks. 

Mercedes lives in this place. She is 48 years old, married, and in this relationship had six children, but two have died. The four she has are 32, 27, 24 and 13 years old. The youngest is in school and still lives in their house. Her husband is a vegetable salesman. 

Mercedes has a grocery store in her house. With the help of the loans that she has gotten from the foundation and from the people who make it so she can get the loans, she has been able to improve her retail space little by little. There, she earns her living selling all sorts of groceries such as rice, sugar, oil, detergent, vegetables, meats, certain small items, bottled water, soda, candies, and more. Each time that she gets a loan, she invests it in a larger variety of products which has served her to expand her customer base. She also gives part of the loan to her husband who goes through the area selling fruits and vegetables with which he earns something that, together with the earnings from her store, lets them get ahead. 

This loan will be used to stock the store more and she will purchase groceries, fruits and vegetables for her husband. She has been in the communal bank group since the beginning and she likes it because, thanks to the loans, she has expanded her business. Her dreams are to continue improving and have a better retail space.

loans.use: to purchase groceries, fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Melitona

texts.en:
From General Trias Cavite, Philippines, Melitona is a single mother and was employed in a garment factory in Cavite through the auspices of the Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT). Melitona works as a seamstress, sewing clothing according to the company’s or client’s dictates. She uses a sewing machine and other stitching machines, as well as hand-stitching hems and linings.

One of the main dilemmas of employees like Melitona is meeting family expenses without access to savings or credit. Workers can become heavily indebted to money lenders, who take their ATM cards as loan collateral.

For this reason Melitona is asking for your assistance to help her circumvent loan sharks. She has previously accessed loans through CCT and had no problem in repaying them, since the loan payments were automatically deducted from her paycheck. She is seeking a 9,000 PHP loan to pay for her pawned ATM card.

Melitona wants to manage her own "sari-sari" store (variety store). She looks forward to your positive response and says any amount will surely be of great help.

CCT works to provide local communities with a trained labor force equipped with the skills required for employment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative assists its members in acquiring those skills necessary for quality jobs, cultivating savings consciousness and providing decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs include Professional Staff Services, Workers Guild Development, Enterprise Development and Consultancy Services.

CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for factory workers before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions, spiritual mentoring, and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and after-work hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: to redeem her pawned ATM card.

loans.name: Bignikado

texts.fr: Bignikado est âgée de 44 ans et vit à Agoè. Mariée, elle a six enfants à sa charge et travaille dynamiquement pour aider son mari pour leur épanouissement. Bignikado vend des céréales et des tubercules en grandes quantités en les livrant aux clients à son domicile. Bignikado s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Pour acheter des sacs de maïs et quelques tubercules, Bignikado demande ce prêt pour réaliser son objectif et gagner un profit pour contribuer à l’avancement de la famille
texts.en: Bignikado is 44 years old and lives in Agoè. She is married, takes care of six children, and works hard to be able to support her husband with their development. Bignikado sells cereals and tubers in large quantities to customers at her home. Bignikado gets her supplies twice a month at the market. Bignikado is requesting this loan in order to buy bags of maize and some tubers, so that she can reach her goal and earn a profit which she can use to contribute to the family's progress.

loans.use: to buy bags of maize and tubers.

loans.name: Jose Mario

texts.es:
José, de 70 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está acompañado y tiene 2 hijos de 20 y 25 años de edad.

José, se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. junto a su esposa e hijos a realizar las actividades agrícolas y a ordeñar las vacas. 

José, se dedican a la agricultura, este oficio lo aprendió de sus padres; durante la mañana su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y en la tarde trabaja ayudándole a su esposo a cuidar los animales y en otras parcelas.

José, necesita el crédito para comprar dos vacas, que le vende un familiar, para que en un futuro le produzcan leche, ya que su esposa desea elaborar queso, crema y requesón. Para poder vender en los al rededores de su comunidad, para obtener ingresos adicionales para su familia.

José, con que con los ingresos que obtenga de la venta de leche y la siembra, podrá construir una vivienda digna para vivir con su familia.
texts.en:
José, 70 years old, went to school up to the sixth grade. He is partnered and has two children, ages 20 and 25.

José gets up at 5:00 a.m. along with his wife and children to do the agricultural work and milk the cows.

José works in agriculture, which he learned from his parents. In the mornings his wife takes care of the household tasks and in the afternoon she works helping her husband to care for the animals and on other plots of land.

José needs to loan to purchase two cows, which an acquaintance is selling him, so that in the future they will produce milk, since his wife wants to make cheese, cream, and requesón [farmer's cheese] to be able to sell it in the areas near their community to get additional income for their family. 

José, with the income that he gets from selling milk and his crops, will be able to build a respectable house to live in with his family.

loans.use: to purchase two cows.

loans.name: Dominique

texts.en:
Dominique is aged 48 years. He is married with three children aged between 5 and 12 years. They all go to school. 

He is a farmer, and he has been growing maize for the past 25 years. Also his wife is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay the school fees of his children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). 

Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. 

Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Garatie

texts.en:
Garantie is aged 53 years. She is married with one child aged 13 years, who goes to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past twelve years, while her husband is a businessman.

With the loan from Kiva, she would pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Adonis

texts.es:
El señor Adonis de 37  años de edad vive con su esposa  y sus  hijos  en su casa propia,  se dedica desde hace 10  años a la actividad de Pesca, y venta de Pescado,  sus clientes son todas las personas que se dedican a la actividad de venta de pescado ambulante o en un determinado puesto del mercado, pero ellos en especial tienen una persona a la cual le venden todo el producto por conjunto y luego esa persona lo vende por mayor a todo el mercado de san Lorenzo,  sus clientes lo prefieren por su buena atención y sus buenos productos.
Don Adonis radica en la ciudad de San Lorenzo Valle  al sur de honduras, el  es un hombre  emprendedor  con deseos de salir adelante y lucha junto a su esposa  día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida.
Don Adonis esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de dos Redes Nuevas para su actividad,  con este crédito él pretende mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida, es un cliente nuevo  con deseos de trabajar con prisma.
Don Adonis su sueño es  crecer con su negocio, para sacar adelante a su familia, y mejorar su calidad de vida.	
San Lorenzo valle, Honduras, - MARZO 2015.
texts.en:
Adonis, 37 years old, lives with his wife and their children in their own house. He has worked for the past 10 years fishing and selling fish. His customers are all the people who work selling fish as street vendors or at a stall in the market, but they have a person specifically to whom they sell their product and later this person sells it in bulk in all the markets in San Lorenzo. His customers prefer him for his good service and his good products. 

Adonis is from the city of San Lorenzo Valle, in the south of Honduras. He is an enterprising man with desire to get ahead and fight with this wife, day by day, to improve their quality of life. 

Adonis is asking for the loan to purchase two new nets for his work. With this loan, he plans to improve his income and his quality of life. He is a new client with desire to work with Prisma.

Adonis's dream is to grow with his business to get his family ahead and to improve his quality of life.

San Lorenzo valle, Honduras - March 2015.

loans.use: to purchase 2 nets for his business.

loans.name: Geovany

texts.es:
El señor Geovany de 43  años de edad vive con su esposa y sus   hijas  en su casa  propia,  se dedica desde hace 20  años a la actividad de Pesca, y venta de Pescado,  sus clientes son todas las personas que se dedican a la actividad de venta de pescado ambulante o en un determinado puesto del mercado, sus clientes lo prefieren por su buena atención y sus buenos productos.
Don Geovany radica en la ciudad de San Lorenzo Valle  al sur de Honduras, el  es un hombre  emprendedor  con deseos de salir adelante y lucha junto a su esposa  día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida.
Don Geovany esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de 1 Trasmallo nuevo,  con este crédito él pretende mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida, es un cliente nuevo  y desea  trabajar con prisma.
Don Geovany su sueño es  crecer con su negocio, para sacar adelante a su familia, y poder estudiar a todos sus hijos.
San Lorenzo valle, Honduras, - MARZO 2015.
texts.en:
Geovany, 43 years old, lives with his wife and their daughters in their own house. He has worked for the past 20 years fishing and selling fish. His customers are all the people who work selling fish as street venders or at a stall in the market. His customers prefer him for his good service and his good products. 

Geovany is from the city of San Lorenzo Valle in the south of Honduras. He is an enterprising man with desire to get ahead and fight with his wife, day by day, to improve their quality of life.

Geovany is asking for the loan to purchase 1 new trammel net. With this loan, he plans to increase his income and improve his quality of life. He is a new client and wants to work with Prisma.

Geovany's dream is to grow with his business to get his family ahead and provide an education to all his children.

San Lorenzo Valle, Honduras - March 2015.

loans.use: to purchase 1 new trammel net for his business.

loans.name: Martina Adriano

texts.es:
La señora Martina de 65 años de edad, vive con su esposo y su hijo en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 10 años al negocio de venta de Pescado Ambulante, como ser Robalo, Palometa, Curvina, Lisa, Ruco, y otros más  Ella radica en la ciudad de San Lorenzo Valle, al sur de Honduras, ella es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Doña Martina esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de más producto como pargo, palometa, robalo, curvina y otros mas, con el apoyo de este crédito ella pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente existente  con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Doña Martina su sueño es tener un buen negocio y aumentar su clientela  y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia. 
San Lorenzo, Honduras - MARZO  2015.
texts.en:
Señora Martina is 65 years old and lives with her husband and their son in their own home. She has made a living for 10 years in the business of selling Traveling Fish, such as sea bass, halibut, croaker, mullet, ruco, and others. She lives in the city of San Lorenzo Valle, in the south of Honduras. She is an entrepreneurial woman with desires to succeed and she struggles day after day to improve her quality of life.

Doña Martina is asking for the loan to buy more products such as snapper, halibut, sea bass, croaker and others. With the support of this loan she seeks to improve her income and also her quality of life. She is an existing customer with the desire to work with Prisma.

Her dream is to have a good business and to improve her customer base, and at the same time improve her future with her family.

loans.use: to buy snapper, halibut, sea bass, croaker and other fish to sell.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is a 33-year-old, married woman and a mother of five children from Leyte, Philippines. She has been engaged in a hog-raising business for more than a year now. This is the source of her income. Her husband works as a carpenter. 

Mary Grace is asking to take a loan to buy piglets to raise and animal feed. In the future, Mary Grace hopes to make her business a success and sustainable. Moreover, she wants to save money for her children’s education fees.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and animal feed

loans.name: Maria Sarit Del Rosari

texts.es: A sus 62 años de edad Maria es una señora trabajadora, ella se divorcio de su esposo y es Maria quien saco adelante a sus hijos, Maria se dedica a la crianza de animales menores y en los fines de semana que transcurre mas personas en la ciudad Maria se dedica  a venta de CDs, Maria necesita le crédito para comprar chanchos y mejorar su negocio, Maria vive con una hija y una nieta y espera que le vaya bien es su negocio para apoyarse en el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en: At 62 years old, Maria is a hard-working woman. She is divorced from her husband and Maria is the one who got their children ahead. Maria works raising small animals and on the weekends, when many people pass through the city, Maria sells CDs. Maria needs the loan to purchase pigs and improve her business. Maria lives with a daughter and a granddaughter and hopes that her business goes well to support her in her family's well-being.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Janeth Amparo

texts.es:
En el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.  Se reúne cada quince días las socias del Grupo de Crédito 24 De Diciembre.
En este lugar vive la señora Janeth, tiene 61 años de edad,  hace varios años su esposo falleció y quedo viuda pero de esta relación tuvo tres hijos mayores de edad e independientes. 
Doña  Janeth es una mujer que le gusta estar activa y tener la posibilidad de ganarse lo suyo y así salir adelante ella sola sin depender de sus hijos, para esto ella hace 15 años atrás surtió un pequeño negocio en su casa donde vende  colas, aguas, golosinas, helados, hielo, helados, entre otras cosas. Gracias a los créditos que ha recibido de parte de la Fundación ella ha podido de a poco ir surtiendo su negocio por lo cual está muy agradecida con ellos y con las personas que hacen posible que pueda recibir un crédito que le permite salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar aguas, sodas, golosinas, helados, entre otras cosas que vende. Lleva 10 años en el  Grupo de Crédito  y le gusta porque los créditos son una bendición para ella. Sus sueños son tener buena salud y seguir contando con los créditos.
texts.en:
In Cantón Montecristi, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and craftsmanship that is recognized nationally and internationally, the place of the famous straw hats, Doña Janeth meets every fifteen days with the partners of Grupo de Crédito.

Janeth lives here, she is 61 years old and many years ago her husband died and she was widowed. From this relationship she had three children who are grown up and independent. 

Janeth is a woman who likes to be actives and be able to earn her own money and succeed without depending on her children. Because of this, she started her own small business 15 years ago in her home where she sells sodas, water, candy, ice cream, and ice, among other things.

Thanks to the loans she has received because of the Fundación she has been able to supply her business. For this she is very thankful to them and with the people who have made it possible for her to receive a loan that allows her to succeed. 

This loan will be used to buy water, soda, candy, ice cream, among other things that she sells. She has spent 10 years in the Grupo de Crédito and she likes it because the loans are a blessing for her. Her dreams are to have good health and continue counting on the loans.

loans.use: to buy water, soda, candy, ice cream, etc.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine, 31, is married and has three children between 5 and 8 years old. They all go to school. 

She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 12 years. Her husband is a businessman. 

With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to buy a piece of land. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
The woman in the photo is called Ruth. She is 30 years old, married and a mother of two children. 

She is a dairy farmer and is borrowing from Kiva to buy dairy feeds for her cows. This will help in increasing the production of milk and therefore increase her income level to comfortably be able to meet her family's expenses, such as food.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the support.

loans.use: To buy dairy feeds to enable her to increase her milk production and meet her family's expenses, such as food.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a 32-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Matag-ob, Leyte. 

Mary Ann has been engaged in a hog-raising business for more than four years now. Mary Ann is requesting a loan to buy piglets to raise and animal feed. A loan will be a great help for Mary Ann in improving her business as well as her income. 

In the future, Mary Ann dreams of making her business more sustainable and productive. She also wants to save money for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and animal feed.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is a 58-year-old married man and a father of four grown children from Matag-ob, Leyte. 

He is a farmer and has grown rice for many years now. Jose also earns an additional income through a hog-raising business. 

Jose is asking to take a loan to buy a new rice thresher and animal feed for the pigs. A loan will help him improve his business as well as his income.

loans.use: to buy a new rice thresher and animal feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Everline, who, with her partner, has become a very good smallholder farmer. They didn't just get together romantically; they joined their hands in improving their farm to create financial strength for the home that they share. She is happily married and has been practicing mixed farming for the last 14 years and has gained so much experience. 

To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling eggs and varieties of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has also been engaging in another small personal business. 

The Kitale area is very populated, and the demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable. She stated that what she like best is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand, which is really high. 

She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. Being a woman, she finds that accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and she will be able to buy more poultry. 

As a result of the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, and this will translate to an increased profit margin and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and expand her poultry sales to other markets. This will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used to fully repay the loan, permanently changing her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going children. Help this hardworking woman realize her dream!

loans.use: To buy poultry.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more maize for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cups and chairs

loans.name: Anuhar Sahid

texts.es:
EL Joven Anuhar de 27  años de edad  vive en su casa de habitación ubicada en la aldea la Cuesta, se dedica al negocio que es compra y venta de pescado desde hace 3 años,  sus clientes son las personas de la aldea, vecinos cercanos de la comunidad.
Anuhar está solicitando el crédito para compra de pescado FRESCO Y SECO ya que se acerca la temporada de semana santa y es un tiempo muy bueno para el comercio de pescado en especial el pescado seco ya que en Honduras es una tradición la sopa de pescado seco en la semana mayor.
Anuhar solicita 10,000.00 lempiras para compra de pescado Y Con las ganancias y el apoyo de este préstamo EL Señor Anuhar  desea salir adelante y seguir mejorando sus ingresos.
Su sueño es  mejorar más sus ingresos y la vivienda de sus padres.
San Lorenzo, Valle – Febrero 2015
texts.en:
Anuhar is a young man who is 27 years of age. He lives in a house located in the neighborhood of La Cuesta. Anuhar has been in the business of buying and selling fish for the past three years. His customers include people from the neighborhood and those who live in communities nearby.

Anuhar is requesting a loan in order to buy fresh and dried fish for the upcoming season of Holy Week. This is a very good time for the fish trade, especially dried fish, because it is a tradition in Honduras to eat soup containing dried fish for most of the week.

Anuhar is requesting 10,000 HNL in order to buy fish. With his earnings and the help of this loan, he wants to move forward and continue improving his income. His dream is to improve his income even more so that he can repair his parents’ home.

San Lorenzo, Valle – February 2015

loans.use: to buy fresh and dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Lourdes

texts.en:
Ma. Lourdes is a 36-year-old married woman with three children, ages 12,15 and 17.

She owns an automotive shop. She caters services like auto repair, lubrication and vulcanizing. She also runs a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells commodities like noodles, canned goods, soap, condiments and beverages. 

She is asking for a loan to buy stocks like coffee, soft drinks,and gasoline. Her income will improve and she will be able to handle her finances. In this way, her income will increase and she will be able to prepare a healthy diet for the whole family.

Ma. Lourdes would like to expand her both business to be come sustainable and able to finish the schooling of all her children for a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy stocks like coffee, soft drinks and gasoline.

loans.name: Obed

texts.en:
Obed is a 25-year-old married man with two children, age 4 and 2 years, living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. 

He has been in business for five years and it enabled him earn a living and provide the family with basic needs. 

He has challenges in the price fluctuation of the products he deals in and poor roads, especially in rainy seasons when they are muddy and impassable. Nevertheless, he has a vision of building a permanent home. 

Obed needs the loan to buy maize to resell.

loans.use: to buy maize to resell.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor, de 62 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, porque sus padres no tenían los recurso necesarios para poder continuar ayudandole para que estudiara; está casado y su pareja estudio solo hasta primer grado y se dedica al trabajo domestico, tienen cuatro hijos, los cuales ya no dependen de ellos, solo dependen unicamente sus tres nietos.

Víctor, se ha dedicado a la agricultura desde hace cuarenta años, por lo cual conoce a perfección el trabajo de la agricultura; pero también, tiene conocimiento en la ganadería.
 
Con el préstamo que está solicitando pretende comprar un novillo de repasto, para criarlo y venderlo cuando ya este grande.

Su sueño es, tener una gran cantidad de novillos de repasto, para criarlos y que su ganancia pueda ser mayor.
texts.en:
Víctor, age 62, studied through the sixth grade because his parents did not have the necessary resources to help him continue his studies. He is married and his partner, who only completed the first grade, takes care of the household duties. They have four children who are no longer dependent on them. Their only dependents are their three grandchildren.

Víctor has been farming for 40 years and has perfected his work in this trade. In addition, he is knowledgeable about raising livestock. With the loan he is requesting, Víctor intends to buy a young bull for grazing. He will raise the animal and sell it when it is grown.

His dream is to have several young bulls for grazing so that he can raise them and earn more income.

loans.use: to buy a young bull for grazing.

loans.name: Yara1 Group

texts.en:
Laila is the featured borrower for Yara1 Group. She joined with her other group members to request a loan from Al Majmoua because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses.

Laila is a 31 years old, married, and has three children. She makes handicrafts, which she has been doing for eight years to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their children. She is a hard worker who has creative skills in making handicrafts, as she has a good reputation among her customers. 

Laila is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, which she will use to buy necessary raw materials to make new handicrafts to satisfy her customers' special requests. She hopes to expand her business in the future to increase her income and satisfy her family's needs. She is sitting in the middle of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make handicrafts

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is a 27-year-old married woman and a mother of five children from Leyte, Philippines. Liezel runs a small sari-sari (or retail store) business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. She also earns an additional income through a hog-raising business. 

Liezel is asking to take a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments and animal feed for the pigs. In the future, Liezel has hopes of making her business more sustainable and productive. She also wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments and animal feed for the pigs

loans.name: Aurerie

texts.en:
Aurerie is aged 46 years. She is married with five children aged between 2 and 21 years; three of them go to school. She is a farmer, and she has been growing maize for the past 21 years, while her husband is a businessman. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay the workers who harvest her maize. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay the workers who harvest her maize.

loans.name: Nerry

texts.en:
From Cavite, Philippines, Nerry is employed in a garment factory in Cavite through the auspices of the Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT). Nerry works as a seamstress, sewing clothing according to company or client dictates. She uses a sewing machine and other stitching machines, as well as hand stitching hems and linings.

One of the main dilemmas of employees like Nerry is meeting family expenses without access to savings or credit. Workers can become heavily indebted to money lenders who take their ATM cards as loan collateral. 

For this reason, Nerry is asking for your assistance to help her circumvent loan sharks. She has previously accessed loans through CCT and had no problem in repaying them since the loan payments were automatically deducted from her paycheck. She is seeking a 14,000 PHP loan to buy medicinal products she needs in her buying and selling business for additional profit.

Nerry hopes to have additional sources of income, and she wants to grow her business. She looks forward to your positive response and says any amount will surely be of great help. 

CCT works to provide local communities with a trained labor force equipped with the skills required for employment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative assists its members in acquiring those skills necessary for quality jobs, cultivating savings consciousness and providing decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs include Professional Staff Services, Workers Guild Development, Enterprise Development and Consultancy Services.

CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for factory workers such as Nerry before they start their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions, spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and after-work hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: to buy medicinal products she needs in her business for additional profit.

loans.name: Panha

texts.en:
Panha is a 21-year-old single teacher who is from Kandal province in Cambodia. She teaches English to small kids at a private school. Currently, she is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in English literature, in the fourth year at a university in the city. 

Panha needs the finances to cover her fourth-year university fees; therefore, she has decided to request a loan. This loan will help her have enough finances to earn a bachelor’s degree successfully to improve her job. 

In the future, she is going to find a job in another school because she wants to teach higher grades. She hope to earn a reasonable salary to help her parents and to save money to buy a house.

loans.use: to cover her fourth-year university fees

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is 39 years old and a single father of two children. He has had a barber shop business for 12 years, and it has been profitable. He will be using the loan to purchase more shaving machines and equipment and hopes this will help him to serve more customers and make more income to pay school fees for his children. 

His hopes and dreams for the future are to have a prosperous business and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to purchase more shaving machines and equipment for the business expansion to help him serve more customers and make more income to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to enable her to increase the number of liters of milk supplied to her increasing number of customers who are demanding the same product.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is 65 years old, married to Mathew and blessed with seven children. She has been practicing dairy farming for the last two years, and the business earns her KES 8,000 per month. 

Stella has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow to enable her to add to the amount of milk supply to meet her customers' demands. She plans to use the generated profits to repay the loan and start a retail shop.

Her future hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to enable her to add to the amount of milk supply to meet her customers' demands.

loans.name: Roxana Marilu

texts.es:
En el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.  Se reúne cada quince días las socias del Grupo de Crédito 24 De Diciembre.
En este lugar vive la señora Roxana, tiene 28 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 9  y 4 años de edad, ambos estudian en escuela. Su esposo es maestro en construcción.
Doña Roxana es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, se dedica a la venta de zapatos por catalogo y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella trabaja tres o cuatro días a la semana, aprovecha las horas de la mañana que sus hijos están estudiando para salir a realizar sus recorridos, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Lleva más de 4 años con este negocio el mismo que empezó con uno de los créditos que recibió de la institución por lo cual está muy agradecida.
Este crédito es para comprar zapatos ya que tiene varios pedidos por entregar. Lleva más de 10 años en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque gracias a uno de los créditos empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus pequeños por lo cual lucha día a día.
texts.en:
The village of Montecristi is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts which are known at a national and international level. It is the home of the famous straw hats. The members of the credit group 24 de Diciembre meet every 15 days.

In this place lives Roxana. She is 28 years old. She is married, and from this relationship she has two children of 9 and 4 years of age. They both study in school. Her husband is a master of construction.

Roxana is a homemaker who, to obtain her own resources and with them be able to help her husband with the home expenses, makes a living from selling shoes by catalog. Her form of sale is door-to-door. She works three or four days a week. She takes advantage of the morning hours when her children are studying to make her rounds. She leaves her products on credit and collects every eight days. She has had this business for more than 4 years, the same business that she began with one of the loans that she received from the institution, for which she is very thankful.

This loan is to purchase shoes since she has many orders to fill. She has been with the credit group for more than 10 years and she likes it because, thanks to one of the loans, she began her business. Her dreams are to give the best to her small ones, for which she struggles every day.

loans.use: to purchase shoes.

loans.name: Apolinaria

texts.en:
Apolinaria is grateful that she was granted a 20,000 PHP loan that she used for spare parts and maintenance of her jeepney. Her earnings helped cover her and her aging parents' personal, medical and household needs.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy new tires and pay for the maintenance of her jeepney. Her profits from her business will definitely cover their daily needs and the medical expenses of her parents. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Apolinaria plans to buy another jeepney to grow her transport business. She prays for good health and long life for her parents. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay Micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for tire replacement and maintenance of her jeepney.

loans.name: Theophile

texts.en:
Theophile is aged 41 years. He is married with seven children aged between 2 and 22 years; five of them go to school. He is a farmer, and he has been growing maize for the past 18 years. Also, his wife is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay the workers who harvest the maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay the school fees of his children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay the workers who harvest the maize.

loans.name: Bonifride

texts.en:
Bonifride is aged 28 years. She is married with one child, age 3 years. She is a farmer, and she has been growing maize for the past eight years, while her husband is a businessman. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay the workers who harvest maize. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay the workers who harvest maize.

loans.name: Elvis

texts.es:
ELVIS: Es un hombre alegre miskito originario de Waspam Río Coco; es luchador, tiene 45 años de edad, es casado, tiene 3 hijos adolescentes que estudian su primaria. Trabaja desde hace más de 12 años como maestro en una escuela rural de educación primaria. Está solicitando su segundo financiamiento para terminar de construir poco a poco su vivienda de tambo y madera, con el propósito de brindarle a su familia una vivienda más segura y con mayor calidad de vida. Con el préstamo podrá comprar: madera cepillada, zinc y cubrir costo de mano de obra. Su sueño es llegar a tener una casa de mayor durabilidad, segura y con las condiciones de comodidad para su familia. 

En la fotografia, apararece con su esposa e Hijas.
texts.en:
Elvis is a happy Miskito man originally from Waspam Río Coco. He is a survivor. He is 45, married, and has 3 adolescent children who are studying in elementary school. He has been working for more than 12 years as a teacher in a rural primary school. 

He is asking for his second loan to to be able to finish building his wooden stilt house bit by bit, with the aim of providing his family with a safer house and a better quality of life. With the loan he will be able to buy planed timber and zinc and cover the workforce costs. His dream is to have a more safe and durable house in which his family can live in comfortable conditions.  

In the photograph he is shown with his wife and daughters.

loans.use: to buy planed timber and zinc and cover workforce costs

loans.name: Francois

texts.en:
Francois is 36 years old. He is married with 4 children aged between 1 and 11 years. Two of them go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 15 years, while his wife is a businesswoman. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to buy a house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Kenkonzi  Mubuku Women Group

texts.en:
Rose is a 45-year-old hardworking female. She is widowed with four children and is a member of Kenkonzi Mubuku Women Group. Rose is living in Kasese, Uganda. 

Rose sells cassava flour, a business she ventured into after the death of her husband in order to get income to look after her children. From the business profits she has managed to build rentals, which give her additional income. She hopes to increase her business capital in order to generate more profits. 

Rose is requesting a loan to buy cassava flour for selling.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour for selling.

loans.name: Layanne

texts.en: Layanne is a 32 year-old married lady, who has worked as a tutor for the seven years to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. Lately, she opened a fruit and vegetable shop, as a second source of income. Today, Layanne is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmou to develop her business through buying more requested fruits and vegetables. This loan will help Layanne gain her own loyal customers. She hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to develop her business through buying more requested fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Las Flores De Yanaconas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS FLORES DE YANACONAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Santa Teresa, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convencion y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Vicentina ella es viuda y tiene 84 años y tiene 8 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de agricultura, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva maiz,trigo y papa,la socia tambien se dedica al negocio de venta de chicha, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes y semillas.
Las socias que estan pegadas a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de agricultura, negocio de ganaderia, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are the members of the communal bank “Las Flores de Yanaconas.” This bank is located in the Santa Teresa District, which belongs to the La Convencion Province and the Department of Cusco.

This member is Vicentina. She is a widow, 84 years old, and has 8 children. She works in her farming business. She has land where she cultivates corn, wheat, and potatoes. She also makes a living from the business selling chicha (corn beer). She works from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. She already has worked 5 years in this business and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to increase her land for cultivating. She is requesting the loan to purchase fertilizer and seeds.

The members who are added to the group photo had their picture taken after the meeting because they asked for permission because of work.

The other members make a living from an agricultural business, a livestock business, a convenience store, and an animal sales business.

Vicentina is thankful to those who are a part of her dream through these means, and she promises to makes her payments in the established timeframe.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to supply milk for more income.

loans.name: Winson

texts.en:
Winson is a factory worker, age 54. He lives in Cavite, Philippines, with his wife and three children. He has been in the service for three years through the aid of CCT Covenant Community Service Cooperative*.

Winson works as a maintenance supervisor. He coordinates with building management on budget development, maintains the inventory of tools and hires workers. He also assists employees with related administrative and human resources issues.

One of the main dilemmas of employees like Winson is the improper balancing of their salaries with family expenses. They have no access to savings or credit, a situation that makes them heavily indebted to usurious money lenders who capture their automated teller machine (ATM) cards as loan collateral.

For this reason, Winson is asking for your assistance to prevent him from being exposed to any loan sharks. He has also previously accessed loans through CCT Credit Cooperative, and he had no problem in returning it back since the loan payment is being deducted every payday. He looks forward to your positive response, and any help from you will surely be of great help. 

He will use the loan primarily to redeem the pawned deed of their house. 

Winson wants to be successful someday. He desires to give his family a better future through all his hard work. He meets up with his co-fellowship** members to share stories of his work.

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, qualify for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services. 

** CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meeting for the factory workers before they start their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions and spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and post-working hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: to redeem the pawned deed of his house

loans.name: Melody Women Group

texts.en:
In 2014, Melody Women Group joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in order to be trained, especially in enterprise development and financial management. The group members mostly practice agriculture, both crop and livestock farming.

The person raising her hand in the photo is Elizabeth. She is 39 years old and a mother of one child. She practices poultry farming, and she is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy poultry feeds. She says that this loan will help her increase her egg and poultry production and thus earn more income, which will help her pay her child’s tuition fee.

She is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy poultry feeds to increase egg and poultry production, and hence, get more income to enable her to pay tuition fees for her child.

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en:
Angelique is 24 years old and married with 1 child aged 5, who attends school. She is a farmer growing maize for the past 5 years. While her husband is a business man. With the loan from Kiva, she would to pay the workers harvesting her maize. The profits from the business will be used to increase her savings. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers for harvesting her maize.

loans.name: Solidario Buena Vista Group

texts.es: Solidario Buena Vista La señora Antonia desde hace 2 años tiene una tienda de consumo diario vendiendo arroz, frijol, pastas en general, sopas instantáneas, gaseosas en lata, jumbos, caja, jabón de baño y ropa,   en la calle principal de su colonia y es la encargada de este grupo. Al lado de su esposo y sus 5 hijos que aun están pequeños, cada mañana le pide a Dios darles lo mejor y luchar grandemente por el sueño de su negocio que es agrandar la tienda y vender algún día todo tipo de verduras. Hay varias tipos de gaseosas que le hacen falta en la tienda y necesita comprar, pero el dinero que tiene no le alcanza y por eso necesita un préstamo para no quedarles mal a sus clientes que siempre la buscan.
texts.en:
Solidarity Group Buena Vista - Antonia is in charge of this group.  For two years now, Antonia has had a convenience store selling rice, beans, pastas, instant soups, bathroom soap, clothing, and soda in cans, boxes, and big bottles. The store is on the main street in her neighborhood. 

Alongside her husband and her five children who are still quite small, each morning she asks God to give them the best and to fight nobly for her dream, which is to grow her store and someday sell every type of vegetable.  There are various types of soda she is missing from her store and needs to buy, but the money that she has doesn’t cover it.  So, she needs a loan so that she doesn’t leave a bad impression on the customers who always look for her.

loans.use: to buy grocery products

loans.name: Thadeo

texts.en:
Thadeo is 42 years old. He is married with five children with ages between two and fifteen years. Three of them go to school. He is a farmer and has been growing maize for the past 13 years, while his wife is a businesswoman. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Marjorie Rocio

texts.es:
En el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.  Se reúne cada quince días las socias del Grupo de Crédito 24 De Diciembre.
En este lugar vive la señorita Marjorie, tiene 21 años  de edad, es soltera y vive con sus padres.
Doña Marjorie es una joven mujer que le gusta ganarse lo suyo para así ir de a poco adquiriendo sus cosas para cuando le toque formar su hogar, ella trabaja en un cibert, pero en sus ratos libres se  dedica a la venta de productos de Yanbal y Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, sale a recorrer casi  todos los días en sus ratos libres ya que no tiene horario fijo, ella deja sus productos a  crédito y cobra cada ocho o quince días. Lleva casi 2 años que se dedica a esta actividad la cual le permite ganar algo por su cuenta para beneficio propio y de su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y todo lo que ella vende. Lleva 4 ciclos en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con el primer crédito comenzó su negocio. Sus sueños son tener un buen local algún día.
texts.en:
Montecristi canton is known for it's rich culture and for it's nationally and internationally recognized handicrafts and home to the famous Panama hat. The members of the "24 De Diciembre" communal bank meet here every fortnight.

Marjorie lives in this place. She is single, 21 years old and lives with her parents. Marjorie is a young woman who likes to make her own living so that she can gradually buy the things she will need to one day form a family. She works in a cybercafe and in her spare time works selling Yanbal and Avon products 9beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and accessories for women).
Her method of sales is door-to-door. She goes out to sell almost every day in her spare time as she has no fixed timetable. She leaves her products on credit and collects every 8 or 15 days. She has been doing this for almost 2 years which allows her to make money on her own to benefit her family.

This loan is to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and all that she sells. She has been in the communal bank for 4 loan cycles and she likes it as she started her business with her first loan. Her dream is to one day have a good store.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Pheromene

texts.en:
Pheromene 52 years old. She is married with eight children between 6 and 25 years old. She is a farmer and has been growing maize for the past 21 years, while her husband is a businessman. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be use to improve her welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions.
