Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Jostina

texts.en: Jostina is a 50 year-old hard working lady, married with 8 children, who lives in Kasese Uganda. Jostina is a farmer dealing in crop production, primarily growing rice, onions, maize and beans, and also selling cassava flour. Jostina has a dream of buying land and constructing her own house. Jostina is faced with the challenge of price fluctuations, which affects agriculture products. Jostina needs a loan to buy land to make a home.

loans.use: to buy land to make a home.

loans.name: Keo's Group

texts.en:
A mother of a child living in the Chhloung district of the Kratie province, Keo is 44 years old. To improve her family’s living, she grows rice and cassava. She has been involved in this business for 24 years, and she can earn about 26,600 KHR per day. 

This is Keo's first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In this group of three members, she is the leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy pesticide, fertilizer and seeds to support her farmland. She hopes that she can improve her farmland and earn more income to update her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy pesticide, fertilizer and seeds to support her farmland

loans.name: Unity Group

texts.en:
From Chorkor, these three women are part of a group called Unity. The ladies are focused on transforming their lives through empowerment, small loans and education. They have a vision of raising their standard of living and creating a more prosperous future for themselves and their families. They are selling kenkey (cooked corn paste) and fried fish. 

Rebecca, a member of Unity, is married with one child. She is a 29-year-old trader who has been selling kenkey (cooked corn paste) and fried fish for six years. Rebecca wants to continue to support her child so that she can grow well and continue with her studies up to university level. Rebecca buys maize, fish and oil to prepare kenkey and fried fish for her food vending business, which is well patronized by customers in her area of residence. 

Rebecca has made tremendous improvement in her business and so have the other members. The ladies do not know how to read or write and so the ID Ghana training sessions are essential to their success as caretakers of their family members and business entrepreneurs. The training is given in the indigenous language of the women, often with pictures, and covers a variety of subjects including effective business management practices, nutritional and health tools, and self-esteem. The seven women look forward to creating a brighter tomorrow as empowered women eliminating poverty.

loans.use: To buy maize, fish and oil to prepare kenkey and fish for her food vending business, which is well patronized by customers in her area of residence.

loans.name: Selvin Mauricio

texts.es:
El señor Selvin Mauricio de 39 años de edad es padre soltero, vive en su casa propia con sus hijos, radica en la comunidad del comercio, san Lorenzo al sur de Honduras, se dedica al negocio del transporte desde hace vario tiempo, el se levanta muy temprano todo los días a atender a sus clientes, es un hombre ejemplo de la comunidad porque él es padre soltero y lucha por sacar adelante a su familia.

Don Selvin el préstamo lo necesita para pagar un adelanto del numero que alquila del taxi ya que desea comprarlo y no estar pagando un alquiler, con el apoyo del crédito él desea suplir la necesidad de financiamiento es un buen cliente con deseos de salir adelante, es su cuarto crédito que solicita. 

Su sueño es mejorar su vehículo para atender mejor a sus clientes y con estos que su negocio mejore.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Febrero del 2015.
texts.en:
Selvin Mauricio, age 39, is a single father.  Along with his children, he lives in his own house located in a community in southern Honduras known for commerce—San Lorenzo.  He has worked in his transportation business for quite a while.  He gets up very early each day to take care of his customers.  He is a good example to his community because he is a single father and he is fighting to get his family ahead.

Selvin needs this loan to pay an advance on the unit that he rents because he wants to buy the taxi and not keep paying rent.  With the help of this loan he wants to replace the need for financing.  He is a good client with a desire to get ahead.  This is the fourth loan he has taken out.

His dream is to improve his vehicle in order to give better service to his customers; in this way he wants to improve his business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - February 2015

loans.use: to pay an advance on the taxi that he rents for his business.

loans.name: Lourdes Marlene

texts.es:
En el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.  Se reúne cada quince días las socias del Grupo de Crédito 24 De Diciembre.
En este lugar vive la señora Lourdes, tiene 24 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre, ella aun no tiene hijos pero espera muy pronto tener esa felicidad,. El marido es albañil. 
Doña Lourdes es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto  ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos por catalogo,  su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale a recorrer tres o cuatro días a la semana y también vende en su casa cuando sus clientes necesitan de algo de lo que ella vende sobretodo artículos de oferta, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Lleva más de 2 años que se dedica a esta actividad con lo cual de gana lo suyo, ella aprovecha los productos que están de oferta y es así como ella invierte los créditos ya que así se gana más ingresos.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos, y productos naturales que ella vende. Lleva 3 años en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque gracias los créditos ella aprovecha las ofertas. Sus sueños son tener un bebé.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the members of the 24 De Diciembre credit group meet in the canton of Montecristi, known for its rich, pre-colonial culture and for its artisan crafts, which are famous at the national and international level.  It is the place of the famous “paja toquilla” straw hats.

Lourdes lives in this place.  She is 24 years old and is in a common law relationship.  She doesn’t have children yet but she hopes very soon to experience that joy.  Her husband is a construction worker.  Lourdes is a housewife who works selling clothing and shoes from catalogs in order to have her own resources and, with those, to support her husband.  

Her method of sales is door-to-door.  She heads out three or four days a week and also makes sales from her home.  When her customers need something that she sells—most of all, products on sale—she sells her merchandise on credit and makes collections once a week.  She has been doing this for more than two years; it’s how she makes her living.  She takes advantage of products that are on sale; this is how she invests her loans because in this way, she earns more.

This loan is to buy clothing, shoes, and natural products that she sells.  She has been in this credit group for more than three years.  She likes it because thanks to the loans she can take advantage of sales.  Her dream is to have a baby.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, and natural products

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine is 38 years old. She is married, with six children aged between four and nineteen years. They all go to school. She is a farmer and has been growing maize for the past 12 years, while her husband is a businessman. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine is aged 22 years. She is married. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past six years, while her husband is a businessman. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be use to improve her welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence used the previous loan to buy items for farming. He lives in Kasese, Uganda and is 44 years old, married, with six children. 

Lawrence earns a salary from teaching services in addition to farming, where he gets additional income for his family.  He has been in the teaching service for 18 years. 

Lawrence has great hopes of building his family's house. However, he is hindered by the small salary payments and the prolonged drought that affects his farming. 

Lawrence wants money to buy land to construct a family house.

loans.use: to buy land to construct a family house.

loans.name: Electerio

texts.es: ELECTERIO: Es originario de Waspam Río Coco, pertenece a la etnia miskita, tiene 52 años, casado con 6 hijos: 2 son mayores de edad y 4  adolescentes que estudian su secundaria. Está solicitando un préstamo para poder reparar las paredes de madera de su casa donde habita con sus hijos y esposa. Con el préstamo podrá comprar madera cepillada, clavos y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es  brindarle a su familia una vivienda más segura y en buenas condiciones.
texts.en: ELECTERIO is a native of Waspam, Río Coco and he belongs to the Miskito ethnic group. He is 52 years old, married and has 6 children. Two of them are adults and four are adolescents who attend secondary school. He is requesting a loan to be able to repair the wooden walls of his house where he lives with hie children and wife. With the loan he will be able to buy planed wood, nails and cover the costs of labor. His dream is to offer his family a more secure place to live in better conditions.

loans.use: to repair the walls of his wooden house built on stilts.

loans.name: Sreymom's Group

texts.en:
Sreymom, a farmer living in the Chhloung district of the Kratie province, is 37 years old. She is a mother of four children, three of whom are dependent on her. Those three kids are not in school for they are too young. She overcomes her family’s hardship by growing cassava and working for others for a fee, and she has been involved in these businesses for 10 years. 

This is Sreymom's third time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loans. She leads the group of five members to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion on buying fertilizer to support her farmland. She hopes that she can expand her current business to earn more income than she has before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to support her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow so as to increase milk supply to sell to her clients

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
This is Manuel, 52, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Gregornia, a homemaker who manages their household, and has two children. He has a retail store to continually provide for his family’s daily personal and household needs.

Manuel operates a small general store. In the Philippines, a sari-sari store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, five PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. He earns profit by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from his general store, he is also a dealer of natural and organic products. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day. 

To help him continue operation of his business, he is requesting a PHP 11,000 loan which he will use to buy grocery items such as corn, rice, canned goods, noodles, sugar, and cooking oil. With part of the loan, he will also pay for natural and organic juice and capsules to meet orders from his clients. He is positive this will boost his income as he expands his business. He is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given him, for it will surely cover their everyday needs and the schooling of his children.

Manuel aims to grow his business to improve their status in life. He wants to give his children the best education possible and see them become professionals someday. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for groceries for his general store and natural and organic direct selling products to sell.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is thankful for her previous loan. The loan was a big help for her business, as she was able to purchase products for her direct-selling business. Her income from the loan assisted with their everyday expenditures at home. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

Marlyn would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan. It will be used to buy additional supplies and merchandise, such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from this business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marlyn hopes that her business will continue to become successful, and she dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week also to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise needed in her business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Grace from the Nandi Hills area of Kenya, an area that is very fertile. Grace is 33 years old and a proud mother of four lovely angel-looking children, whom she really adores and cherishes. 

Aside from doing a side hustle business, Grace is a hardworking farmer who has been farming for the past seventeen years. She has gained so much experience through those years of farming. Grace practices mixed farming, that is, she grows maize and keeps dairy cows. Through these activities she has been able to earn a decent and honest income. Because of the passion she has for farming, she has even nicknamed one of her cows Lelgina. She really enjoys taking care of her dairy cows. 

Although Grace has been making profits through farming, not everything has been easy for this humble and industrious mum. She needs to increase her land. She is respectfully requesting for a loan to buy more land. Through this loan, her cows will have enough grazing land, and she will be able to plant more crops on the land. Through the purchased land, Grace will be assured of a bumper harvest, and this will translate into more profits and cash. Grace's plan is to increase her farming and to be able to save more money so that she can buy more and more land for farming.

loans.use: To buy land

loans.name: David's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is David, often described as an extremely hardworking individual. He is 22 years old and, as a group leader, he is representing his group of 13 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. He is married and has one child.

David is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again, as this means that he is able to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds, which is why he decided to join in the first place. David says that he is happy to have made that decision because, since he first joined in 2014, he has learnt a lot from farming trainings, which has improved his day-to-day life significantly. David will use the profits from this season to invest in a business.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 6.25 acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan, the group will also receive a total of six solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Mindia

texts.en: Mindia is a 37-year-old married man. He lives with his wife, parents and two infant children in the Batumi district. Mindia is unemployed at the moment. The source of income for his large family is his father's small monthly salary. Mindia wants to start his own business and has requested a loan. The startup program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 600 USD. With the received credit he will purchase paints to paint cars. He has experience in this field and thinks that the business will be profitable. Mindia will provide better living conditions to his children as his income is increased by help from the startup program.

loans.use: to start painting cars in order to generate income

loans.name: Netramani

texts.en:
Netramani is 39 years old, a divorced woman who lives in a village of Dhenkanal district in Odisha with her parents and two children. Netramani's children are studying in a government school near her village. For lack of other opportunities, Netramani herself, though educated till class 8, has been running a grocery shop from her home for the last eight years to add to the family income. 

If Netramani wants to expand her business and really benefit from increased inventory, she must buy the goods in wholesale quantities. As the market prices keep fluctuating, buying in bulk guards against price spikes and hence ensures decent profits. She is, therefore, seeking a loan of Rs 20,000 to purchase in bulk grocery items like edible oil, spices, condiments, sugar, and biscuits for her shop.

loans.use: to purchase edible oil, spices, biscuits, sugar and cereals in bulk to resell

loans.name: Lafia Group

texts.fr:
YOUSSOUF est le monsieur qui a les mains sur le sac de sucre sur la photo.
YOUSSOUF est un malien âgé de 60 ans, scolarisé, Il est marié père de 06 enfants, 5 garçons et 1 fille. Les enfants sont âgés de 8 à 37 ans dont  04 fréquentent l’école. 
Sa femme est une ménagère. Il fait recourt au RMCR pour pouvoir bien mener son activité, il fait le commerce de céréales et d’autres articles divers (sucre, Boissons non alcoolisées etc.), depuis plus de 30 ans il mène cette activité. Il s’approvisionne sur les marchés environnant et revend dans le marché de sa localité. Il peut gagner  35000 FCFA de profit par mois  sur les ventes. 
Le  profit qu’il génère lui  permet de faire face aux charges de sa famille. Le prêt du RMCR lui a beaucoup encouragé dans son activité. Il rencontre souvent des problèmes de mévente sur le marché. Dans l’avenir, il veut avoir un prêt plus élevé pour pouvoir  augmenter le volume de son activité afin de gagner plus de profit.
texts.en:
Youssouf is the one who poses his hands on the bag of sugar in the photo. Yousouff is a citizen of Mali, 60 years old, he has completed school. He is married and has six children: five sons and one daughter. His children range from eight to 37 years of age; four of them are still in school. His wife is a homemaker.

Youssouf has reached out to RCMCR in order to better manage his business. He  has been selling cereals and other miscellaneous items (sugar, soft drinks etc) for over 30 years. He stocks up at the nearby markets and sells at his local market. His sales revenues reach up to 35,000 West African francs per month.  This income allows him to support his family. The loan from RMCR has really given him a boost. Youssouf often faces the challenge of low sales. In the future he would like to obtain a larger loan in order to expand his sales volume and increase his profits.

loans.use: to buy cereals and other items for resale.

loans.name: Agnes's Group

texts.en:
Agnes is 43 years old and has six children. She has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is always said to be a very hardworking individual. Even though Agnes is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by 14 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya.

Agnes started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011, and decided to do so because she wanted to earn enough to feed her family. Since then, she has seen her life improve, especially in the sense that she has had more profits from each harvest ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers.

Agnes’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 10.25 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light, so with this loan, the group will also receive a total of seven solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvest season.

loans.name: Aparna

texts.en:
Aparna is 32 years old, a widow and young lady entrepreneur who started her tailoring business at the age of 28 when she lost her husband. She is now in to her third year of business. She has a child. Her enterprise caters to part of the 1000 population at Remuan, Angul, Odisha. 

The present loan request of 25,000 INR  is to enable her to stock material since the main market is not very accessible. She will use this loan to purchase cloth and thread in bulk to make dresses. This enables her to sustain her family of two in their own 1000 sq ft home. An expansion in the business will enable her to better provide for her child.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and thread in bulk to make dresses

loans.name: Anupama

texts.en:
Anupama, 35 years old and an unmarried lady, lives in a small village of Dhenkanal district in Odisha, earning a livelihood by tailoring. She has been in this trade for the past seven years . She now needs a loan of Rs. 15,000 to buy cloth and thread to make dresses.

 Anupama buys cloth and thread from the market and then she makes dresses for children. Once the dresses are made, they will be sold in the market at a profit. Her brother helps her in this business. This loan will help her to improve her business and add income to her family, consisting of her father, mother, and brother.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and thread to make dresses

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
This is Magdalena, 67, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She has been a widow for a number of years already, but by God's grace she was able to handle two businesses, which has helped a lot in meeting her daily needs and assisting her grandchildren in their studies.

Magdalena has put up an ice scramble business. She buys different kinds of fruit flavors, syrups and ice to make and sell ice scramble. Her refreshing and yummy ice scramble has become a favorite drink of kids and young adults as well, especially this summer season. Aside from her ice scramble, she also buys various kinds of dried fish from a wholesaler in their town, repacks them, and sells them at retail price.

To help her continue operation of her business, Magdalena is requesting for a PHP 50,000 loan, which she will use to buy plastic cups, ice, different flavors of syrups, marshmallows, milk and chocolate bits for her ice scramble business. She will also use part of the loan to buy various kinds of dried fish to sell. She earns a minimum of 1,200 a day in sales. She is thanking God for a good return on her investment and the financial help that will be given her, for it will surely help fund their everyday needs.

Magdalena hopes to open more branches for her ice scramble and to own a place to sell her dried fish. She wants to buy a house and a vehicle for her grandchildren. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to find strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans

loans.use: to pay for ice, milk powder, small marshmallows, sugar, choco and strawberry syrup, milk, and choco bits to make ice scramble and to pay for various dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Najat

texts.en:
Najat is a 53-year-old married mother of four children and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. She has been working in her grocery shop inside the camp for three years to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. 

Today, Najat is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to develop her business through increasing her merchandise with new products to satisfy her customers' needs.


Najat hopes to expand her business further in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with new products to satisfy her customers' needs.

loans.name: Adama S.

texts.en:
This is 33-year-old Adama S. She is married and has one child who is 17 years old. Adama S. established her own household utensils business. Working six days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about SLL 4,655,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Adama S has already received and successfully repaid six loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy dozens of assorted household utensils: tea kettles, flasks, bowls, enamel pans and source pans. 

In the future, Adama S plans to reinvest her business, educate her children, and buy a commercial motorbike.  She worked very hard during her previous loan term. She was able to raise a huge amount of money that she gave her elder sister for safekeeping, but unfortunately her sister died without returning the money, so she is presently facing serious problems in her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy dozens of assorted household utensils: tea kettles, flasks, bowls, enamel pans and source pans.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.ru: Элиза, 25 лет, замужем, сыну 2 года. У Элизы средне-специальное образование, по профессии аптекарь, сейчас в декретном отпуске. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 2012 года занимается животноводством и полеводством. На сегодняшний день ежемесячная прибыль составляет 15,000 сом (KGS), что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. В хозяйстве есть корова, 3 овцы, на участке в 0,95 Га она выращивает ячмень. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Элиза обратился в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота за счет покупки 2 нетелей. Доходы от кредита Элиза планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса и постройку сарая для скота.
texts.en: Eliza is 25 years old, married and has a 2-year-old son. Eliza has a specialized secondary education, is a pharmacist and currently on maternity leave. To provide the primary income for her family, she has been involved in animal husbandry and farming since 2012. Her current monthly income amounts to 15,000 som (KGS), which serves as the basis for covering the family's food and consumer needs. Her farm contains 3 sheep and 0.95 hectares of land, where she grows barley. In order to further develop her business, Eliza requested a loan in the amount of 70,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to increase her livestock headcount by buying 2 heifers. Eliza plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further growing her business and building a barn for the livestock.

loans.use: to buy two heifers in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 30-year-old married woman with three children, all attending school. She is a palm oil seller working for 11 hours a day, 7 days a week, and her additional income is from farming. She wants the loan to buy palm oil to sell and increase her business capital.  

Mary hopes to expand her business in future by owning a palm oil store supplying many people at wholesale prices. Mary is a hardworking person, despite being faced with a challenge of competition. The photo was taken on a market day so it was not easy to exclude other people.

loans.use: to buy palm oil to sell

loans.name: Violet's Group

texts.en:
Violet, pictured above, has been a farmer for 4 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 13 farmers in Webuye District. She is 25 years old, is married and has 5 children.

Violet likes to think of herself as a very hardworking individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has been able to consistently feed her family. Violet plans to use the profits from this coming season to send her children to school.

In total, Violet’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 7.5 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 7 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Rose is 33 years old and has 6 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 13 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Rose has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although she described her last harvest as excellent, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Rose also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Rose's Group will be able to receive a total of 9 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 7.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a vehicle to collect plastic waste.

loans.name: Nina

texts.ru: Нина, 27 лет, не замужем, мать 3 детей. У нее среднее образование, после потери кормильца семьи в поиске доходов для своей семьи Нина стала заниматься полеводством и животноводством. Бизнес начала с 3,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря ее непосильному труду Нина достигла больших успехов и получает прибыль в сумме около 13,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. На сегодняшний день у Нины уже есть дойная корова с теленком и 6 овец, выращивает фасоль, на ежедневной основе продает молоко. Нина ищет любую возможность заработать для своей семьи, но доходов не хватает на достойную жизнь, поэтому она решила развить свою деятельность и обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Нина планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своей деятельности, она мечтает отремонтировать свой дом.
texts.en: Nina is 27 years old, not married and a mother of 3 children. She has a secondary education. In search of a source of income for her family, after losing the family's provider, Nina got involved in farming and animal husbandry. She started the business with 3,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her backbreaking work, Nina achieved significant successes and now received a profit of about 13,000 som (KGS) per month. Today, Nina already has a dairy cow with a calf and 6 sheep, also grows beans and sells milk on a daily basis. Nina tries to find any opportunity to earn money for her family, but because her earnings are not enough for a decent life, she decided to develop her business and requested a loan in the amount of 40,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to buy cows for fattening up and resale. Nina plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further developing her business and dreams of repairing her house.

loans.use: to buy cows for fattening up and resale in order to increase her livestock headcount and business income

loans.name: Senesie Walay

texts.en:
This is 49-year-old Senesie. He is married and has 4 children, aged 31, 20, 19 and 14. In 1995, Senesie established his cotton clothes and slippers business. He began his business just to be self-reliant and to take care of his family. Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about 2,000,000 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. He has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to add to his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits. He used the proceeds from his last loan to pay school fees for his children, feed their family and buy some items for his home.

In the future, Senesie still plans to expand his business and to educate his children to a higher level. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more clothing for his shop

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en: Shehnaz is the devoted mother of two children who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. For the last 20 years, her husband has provided transport services by driving a taxi. He is committed to meet the needs of entire family, and needs to maintain his vehicle because its current condition is not good. Because her husband lacks the money to do this, Shehnaz has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan her husband can easily maintain the vehicle and earn a good income. She also plans to save some of the money her husband makes so that she can meet the family's needs in the future. Shehnaz is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their support.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the professionalization modules of her degree studies

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en: Alaa is a 31-year-old single Palestinian man who lives in a refugee camp. For the last eight years, he has worked as a barber inside the camp. He is a hard worker and ambitious and is trying hard to develop his business. That is why he has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to renovate his shop in order to attract more customers. Alaa hopes to expand his business in the future to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his shop in order to attract more customers

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 32-year-old lady from Kisumu, She is married and supports her family.

She has a greengrocery stall which has been operating for the last five years and generates a monthly income of KES. 5,800. She has applied for her third loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase more assorted  fruit and vegetables for sale and she will use the anticipated profit to increase her stock.

Her dream is to run a wholesale business and build a nice home for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more assorted  fruit and vegetables for sale

loans.name: Nancy Narcisa

texts.es:
En  el sector  de la calle 26 de Septiembre  de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita conocida como la Ciudad De Los reales Tamarindos, se reúnen  cada quince días los socios  del Grupo De Crédito Las Acacias. 
En este lugar vive la señora Nancy, tiene 57 años de edad,  está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Nancy con la intención de ganarse algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante y ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar  se dedica al comercio, ella vende zapatos  de todo tipo y modelos, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos, es así como ella puede ganarse algo por su cuenta que les sirven para salir adelante. Lleva más de 20 años con su negocio y  le gusta porque se gana algo y se entretiene al mismo tiempo con sus ventas.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar zapatos de todo tipo. Lleva 2 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos financia mejor su negocio. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
In the '26 de Septiembre' street neighborhood of the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabi province, known as the City of the Royal Tamarinds the members of the "Las Acacias" communal bank get together every fortnight.

Nancy lives in this place. She is 57 years old, married and from this relationship has 3 adult children, one of who still lives with her. Her husband is a driver. Nancy works in business with the intention of making some money on her own and use it to be able to get ahead and help her husband with the household expenses. She sells shoes of all types and models. Her form of selling is from door-to-door and also from her house where her best known clients come.

Doing this she can make some money on her own which serves to get ahead. She has been in the business for more than 20 years and she likes it as she makes money and enjoys herself at the same time. She will use this loan to buy shoes of all types. She has been in the communal bank for two loan cycles and she likes it as the loans improve her business. Her dream is to provide her family with the best.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Pal

texts.en:
Pal managed to put some money aside to build a little home for the family. "My kids always had to sleep in a very old house with no toilet and no water at all, and it was leaking from the roof and always rain coming in from the windows," said Pal. With the loan that he is requesting from you, he wants to install doors and windows and do other work inside the home. 

Pal has been photographed with Vitore, his wife.

loans.use: to do some work in their recently built little home

loans.name: Lia

texts.en: Lia is 38 years old and lives in Tbilisi, the capital of Georgia, with her two nephews. She works as a stylist at local beauty salon where she earns a small monthly income. She wants to open her own beauty salon but needs money for go into business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, is willing to give her a loan for $1,550. With this money, she can buy equipment for her salon and increase her family's income.

loans.use: to increase her income by opening a beauty salon.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
This is Catherine who is 30 years old. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in the year 2013 to benefit from training in enterprise development and financial management. She is married and blessed with two children who both attend  school.

Catherine does dairy, poultry and vegetable farming and also operates a kiosk  selling items such as salt, sugar, bread, cooking flour, cooking fat and bar soap.  She has applied for a loan to add stock to her kiosk so that she can sell more and earn more income. This will help her improve her life and pay school fees.

She is grateful to Kiva and the lenders for their help and support.

loans.use: To buy more stock of salt, sugar, bread, cooking flour, cooking fat and bar soap that will help boost sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to make milk to sell.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 35 years old and married with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. Joyce deals in produce, buying and selling dry foods such as maize, beans, nuts, millet and many other dry foods. She has been in this business since 2009. 

Joyce is a hardworking woman with a dream of having a successful business. However, she is faced with challenges of transportation and limited capital. Joyce wants money to buy dry maize, beans, nuts, and millet for selling.

loans.use: to buy dry maize, beans, nuts, and millet for selling.

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah is 36 years old, married, and has two children. She is from Kisumu, which is located in the western part of Kenya. Her husband is a businessman and supports the family. Norah has a kiosk where she sells cereals, which she has been doing for five years. She earns a month income of 8,000 KES.

Norah requested her first loan from VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase more cereals. She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. Her dream is to expand her business and support the family.

loans.use: to purchase more cereals

loans.name: Roza

texts.ru: Роза, 37 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей - школьников. Роза имеет среднее образование, по характеру она спокойная и трудолюбивая. Работает реализатором бензина. Супруг сейчас на заработках в России. В поисках дополнительного источника дохода, в 2001 году начала заниматься разведением скота. Начав свой бизнес со стартовой суммы 3,000 сом (KGS). Она приложила все усилия для развития своего дела, на сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 10 овец. Также есть надел мерою 1,2 ГА орошаемой земли, где Роза выращивает фасоль. Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Роза является лидером группы "Раззак", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 3 человека, всего их 4. В будущем, Роза планирует и дальше расширять свою деятельность.
texts.en: Roza is 37 years old, married and a mother of 2 school-age children. Roza has a secondary education. She is calm and hardworking by nature. She works as a gasoline seller. Her husband currently works in Russia. In search of additional income, she started fattening up livestock in 2001 with an initial capital of 3,000 som (KGS). She put forth all her efforts to develop the business and currently has 2 cows, 10 sheep, and also 1.2 hectares of irrigated land, where Roza grows beans. To continue developing her business, she requested a loan in the amount of 80,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to buy livestock. Roza is the leader of the Razzak group that, besides her, consists of 3 more people, with 4 of them all together. In the future, Roza plans to further expand her business.

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to expand her business

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en:
Gifty is a 33-year-old married woman. She sells African wax fabric. She has been doing this for eight years at the market. 

Gifty needs a loan to buy African wax fabric to sell to customers. The profits will be used to pay for household expenses, make savings, and reinvest into the business. 

She became a member of ID Ghana in 2010 to gain access to capital for her business. She is on her eighth loan cycle.

loans.use: To buy African wax fabric to sell to customers.

loans.name: Nazmi

texts.en: Nazmi's sheep has just given birth to twin baby sheep as seen in the photograph. The loan he is requesting from you will be used to buy food such as bran for his animals. He plants food for them such as fodder and corn, but it is not enough.

loans.use: to buy bran food for the animals

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is 47 years old and an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of four children and her husband is a plumber by trade. Her husband is the only one responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family. Samina has also been doing her boutique business for the past three years and contributes her income with her husband to manage the household.

Samina needs to buy different types of boutique clothes for reselling purposes but due to insufficient financial means she is not in the position to buy these clothes for her business purposes, therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she can purchase the clothes easily to fulfill her business needs, so that she can earn a more profitable income to support her family and business.

For this financial assistance, Samina is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her boutique business

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis is a responsible mother of six children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for one year. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to do maintenance on his taxi, because the current condition of his taxi is not good. It requires more maintenance charges on daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to do maintenance on his taxi. Therefore, Nargis has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Nargis's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily. This will enable him to provide the better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Nargis also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's future needs.

Nargis is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi

loans.name: Jenny Magaly

texts.es:
En  el sector  de la calle 26 de Septiembre  de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita conocida como la Ciudad De Los reales Tamarindos, se reúnen  cada quince días los socios  del Grupo De Crédito Las Acacias. 
En este lugar vive la señora Jenny, tiene 33 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de 15, 10, 9 y 5 años de edad, la mayor estudia en colegio y los menores en escuela. El marido es maestro en construcción. 
Doña Jenny es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos  y otros productos de catalogo, bisuterías, perfumes, entre otros. Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta ella realiza sus recorridos  cuatro días por semana allí mismo deja y cobra  ya que  deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Tiene más de 5  años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana algo que en ocasiones le sirve para afrontar los gastos cuando su marido no tiene trabajo.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa,  cremas, cosméticos y otros productos. Ella lleva 4 ciclos  en el Grupo De Crédito le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son darles la mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en: Every two weeks, the members of the Credit Group Las Acacias meet up in the area of 26 de Septiembre Street, in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabi Province, known as the "City of the Royal Tamarinds". Jenny lives here. She is 33 years old, and has a domestic partner with whom she has four children, ages 15, 10, 9 and 5. The older daughter attends high school, and the younger ones go to school. Her husband is a builder. Jenny is a housewife, who sells clothes, shoes, and other catalog products, custom jewelry, perfumes, among other things, in order to help her husband with household expenses. She sells door to door. She goes around four days a week, and leaves her products on a loan basis returning to be paid every week. She has more than five years doing this job. With it she earns something which at times helps her to pay expenses when her husband is out of work. This loan is to buy clothes, creams, cosmetics and other products. She has been 4 cycles in the Credit Group, and she likes it because of the support these loans give her. Her dream is to give the best education to her children.

loans.use: to buy clothes, creams, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more palm oil to sell.

loans.name: Zuriko

texts.en:
Zuriko is a 28-year-old married man. He lives with his wife, an infant son and parents in the Telavi district in eastern Georgia. The family cultivates an agricultural piece of land and grows maize to sell. Zuriko works as a baker at a local bakery. He is very experienced and loves his job. Zuriko decided to open his own bakery and requested a loan.

The startup program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 3,200 GEL. With the received credit he will open a bakery and will purchase a stock of raw materials. Zuriko will increase his income and thus will be able to improve the living conditions of his family. Zuriko awaits your support.

loans.use: to open his own bakery and increase income

loans.name: Aracely Edith

texts.es:
En  el sector  de la calle 26 de Septiembre  de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita conocida como la Ciudad De Los reales Tamarindos, se reúnen  cada quince días los socios  del Grupo De Crédito Las Acacias. 
En este lugar vive doña Aracely, tiene 32 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual  tienen 4 hijos de 18, 16, 12 y 11 años  de edad, todos estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo es pintor.
La señora Aracely es una mujer muy luchadora a la cual la vida le ha enseñado  que a través del trabajo honrado puede sacar adelante a su familia, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa y dos veces por semana fleta un carro y se transporta  a Charapoto lugar en el cual compra  arroz al por mayor  el mismo que luego vende ya sea por quintales o por libras, ella entrega a domicilio en el trasporte que fleta o vende  en su casa a conocidos del lugar. Ella Lleva más 8 años dedicada a esta actividad la cual ha podido sostener y mejorar con los créditos que ha podido recibir de la fundación razón por lo cual está muy agradecida con ellos y con  las personas que hacen posible que el crédito llegue a sus manos.
Este crédito es justamente para comprar ropa y arroz. Es fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque  los créditos son lo mejor para su negocio. Sus sueños es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the area of the 26 de Septiembre Street, in the city of Portoviejo—the capital of the Province of Manabí and also known as the city of the "Royal Tamarind Trees"—the members of Las Acacias communal bank meet every two weeks.

In this place lives Aracely. She is 32 years old, is in a common-law relationship, and has four children—aged 18, 16, 12, and 11—all of whom go to school. Her husband works as a painter.

Aracely is a hard-working woman to whom life has taught that she can provide for her family through an honest job. She makes a living as a merchant. She sells clothes, and she rents a car twice a week and goes to Charapoto, a place where she buys rice wholesale to sell it later by the quintal or by the pound. She either makes home deliveries using the car she rents or sells the product at her home to the neighbours. For over eight years, she has been following this occupation—a business that she has been able to sustain and improve with the loans she has received from the Foundation. For this reason, she is very grateful to them and to the people who have made possible for the loans to come into her hands.  

This loan is precisely to buy clothes and rice.

She is the founder of the communal bank, and she likes it because the loans are the best thing for her business. 

Her dream is to give her children the best she can.

loans.use: to buy clothes and rice.

loans.name: Shiringul

texts.ru:
Это Ширингул. Она проживает в районе Чиликул. Ширингул замужем и мать троих детей. У нее один сын и две дочери. Сын женат и имеет двоих детей. Сын находится на заработках в Российской Федерации, чтобы заработать на жизнь. 
Ширингул 44 лет. Она живет вместе семьей. Ширингул  занимается земледелием и животноводством. Этим она занимается уже 15 лет. Ее основная работа является животноводством. Потому, что доход от животноводство обеспечить ее семью. Сейчас Ширингул решила увеличить поголовье скота, чтобы сохранить деятельность  и зарабатывать по больше. По этой причине она обратилась к Вам за кредитом. Ваш кредит поможет ей улучшить условия жизни.  Вы можете поддержать ее сейчас.
texts.en:
This is Shiringul. She lives in the Jilikul district. Shiringul is married and a mother of three children. She has one son and two daughters. Her son is married and has two children. He currently works and earns a living in the Russian Federation.

Shiringul is 44 years old. She lives with her family. Shiringul is involved in farming and animal husbandry. She has been in this business for 15 years. Her primarily business is animal husbandry because its income provides for her family. Now Shiringul decided to increase her livestock headcount to retain her business and earn more. This is why she came to You for a loan. Your loan will help her improve her living conditions. You can support her now.

loans.use: to buy livestock, retain her business and increase her earnings

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es:
Rodolfo tiene 34 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico junto con su cónyugue y sus 4 menores hijos en el distrito de Pucará, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de piña, desde hace varios años, su esposa le apoya en este rubro, cocinando para asistir a los jornaleros que trabajan dando mantenimiento a su cultivo de piña. Ha solicitado un prestamo para el pago a jornaleros por el mantenimiento de su cultivo de piña y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos lo que le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Rodolfo is 34 years old. He lives in his own house, made of rustic materials, with his spouse and their four young children in Pucará district -- its population works in agriculture, trade and animal husbandry -- located in Jaén province, belonging to Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru.

He has worked in agriculture, specifically growing pineapple, for some years. His wife supports him in this work, cooking for the laborers who work maintaining the pineapple crop. He has asked for a loan to pay the laborers to maintain the pineapple crop and, in this way, generate more income which will allow him to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to pay day laborers to maintain his pineapple crop.

loans.name: Cathorina

texts.en:
Cathorina is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be patient and humble. She operates a retail business where she sells cakes, drinks, and juices. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a strategic place. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

Cathorina will use her KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of drinks and cakes. Her business goal is to have a bigger shop within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will maintain her business. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of drinks and cakes.

loans.name: Alice's Group

texts.en:
Alice, pictured above, has been a farmer for 17 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 13 farmers in Webuye District. She is 37 years old, is married and has 5 children.

Alice likes to think of herself as a very hard-working individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2014 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has had more profits from each harvest. Alice plans to use the profits from this coming season to send her children to school.

In total, Alice’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 7 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 7 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Kulbahira

texts.ru: Кульбахира, 57 лет, замужем, двое детей. Кульбахира в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи в 1993 году начала свой бизнес в сельском хозяйстве. Благодаря упорному труду Кульбахира на сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве имеет 2,22 Га земли, где она выращивает фасоль для реализации. Выручка от деятельности составляет до 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на обработку земли и выращивание экологически чистой продукции. Доходы от кредита Кульбахира планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса, что позволит ей построить дом.
texts.en: Kulbahira is 57 years old, married and has two children. In search of a source of income for her family, Kulbahira started her own agriculture business in 1993. Thanks to Kulbahira's hard work, today her business contains 2.22 hectares of land, where she grows beans for sale. The profit from the business amounts up to 15,000 som (KGS). In order to continue developing her business, she requested a loan in the amount of 40,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to treat the land and grow ecologically clean crops. Kulbahira plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further developing her business, which will allow her to build a house.

loans.use: to cultivate her land in order to grow organic crops

loans.name: Eliud's Group

texts.en:
Eliud, pictured above, has 6 children and is always described as a very experienced farmer, which is why he was selected to become the group leader of his group. Eliud is representing his group of 11 farmers in Webuye District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Eliud has been a farmer for 15 years and, in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, he decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. His loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which he is very happy to be getting as that means he will now reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this coming season, Eliud is planning to send his children to school.

A total of 6 acres will be planted by Eliud's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 7 solar lights."

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase medicines and have medical tests done.

loans.name: Estela Monserrate

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como 4 esquinas en la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las socias  del Grupo De Crédito Nueva Esperanza, Portoviejo es una ciudad rodeada de vegetación y un hermoso rio que baña los campos los mismos que son propicios para los cultivos.
En este lugar vive la señora Estela, tiene 42 años de edad, está separada y de esta relación  tienen cinco  hijos, tres mayores y dos de 16 y 4 años, ambos  estudian en colegio y escuela, los menores son los que aun viven con ella.
Doña Estela es una muy buena madre que le ha tocado trabajar para solventar los  gastos que generan el hogar y la educación de sus hijos, para esto ella se dedica al comercio, ella vende productos Belcorp (perfumes, cosméticos, cremas, accesorios, entre otras cosas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y por pedidos, ella sale a recorrer por su localidad casi todos los días más que todo por las mañanas ya que a esta hora es más fresco y sus hijos están estudiando, deja sus productos a crédito y  cobra cada 8 días, lleva 3 años en este negocio el cual  le permite sacar adelante a sus hijos.
Este crédito lo va  a emplear para comprar perfumes, cremas, bisutería y cosméticos. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ella sale adelante en  su negocio. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos
texts.en:
In the sector known as 4 Corners in the city of Portoviejo, the members of the Nueva Esperanza communal bank group meet every two weeks. Portoviejo is a city surrounded by vegetation and a lovely river that crosses through the fields, which are fitting for the crops. 

Estela lives in this place. She is 42 years old, separated, and from this relationship has five children, three adults and two who are 16 and 4 years old, both go to school (secondary and primary), the younger ones are who still live with her. 

Estela is a very good mother who has had to work to pay the costs generated by the household and the education of her children. For this, she works in sales, she sells Belcorp products (perfumes, cosmetics, creams, accessories, and more). She sells from door to door and to order. She goes out through the locality almost every day, usually in the mornings, since that is the coolest time and her children are in school. She leaves the products on credit and collects every week. She has been in this business for 3 years, which allows her to get her children ahead. 

This loan will be used to purchase perfumes, creams, costume jewelry and cosmetics. She has been in the communal bank group since the beginning and she likes it because, with the loans, she gets ahead in her business. Her dreams are to give her children the best.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, creams, costume jewelry and cosmetics.

loans.name: Letania Mercedes

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como 4 esquinas en la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las socias  del Grupo De Crédito Nueva Esperanza, Portoviejo es una ciudad rodeada de vegetación y un hermoso rio que baña los campos los mismos que son propicios para los cultivos.
Aquí vive doña  Letania, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada pero hasta la actualidad no ha podido tener hijos. Su esposo se dedica al comercio. Ella lleva tres ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y está muy contenta ya que gracias a los créditos y a quienes colaboran para que ella pueda recibirlos cada vez mas mejora su situación económica.
La señora Letania es una mujer que siempre le ha gustado salir adelante por sus propios medios y ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar, para esto ella se dedica a la venta de semi-joyas, bisutería de Brilho y productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), su forma de venta es puerta a puerta ella sale casi todos los días unas tres horas al día, no tiene horarios fijos ya que sale cuando puede, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene más de 8 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana algo por su cuenta y se olvida de su soledad cuando su marido sale a su trabajo.
Este crédito es para comprar joyas, perfumes, cremas, cosméticos bisutería, entre otras cosas. Sus sueños son tener un bebé.
texts.en:
The Nueva Experanza communal bank meets every 15 days in the area known as Four Corners in the city of Portoviejo.  Portoviejo is a city surrounded by vegetation and a beautiful river that bathes the fields.  The rivers are advantageous to the crops.

This is where Letania, age 39, lives.  She is married, but she has not been able to have children so far.  He husband works in commerce.  She has been in her communal bank for three loan cycles, and she is very happy.  Thanks to the loan and those who help so that she is able to get them, her financial situation improves each time.

Letania is a woman who has always liked to get ahead by her own means and to help her husband with the household expenses.  In order to do so she sells jewelry made with semi-precious stones, Brilho costume jewelry, and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women’s accessories).  She sells door-to-door for three hours a day almost every day.  She does not have a fixed schedule, but goes out when she can.  She leaves her products on credit and collects every eight days.  She has been engaged in this business activity for over eight years.  Through this business she earns something on her own, and she forgets her loneliness when her husband goes to work.

This loan is to buy jewelry, perfume, creams, cosmetics, and costume jewelry, among other things.

Her dream is to have a baby.

loans.use: to buy jewelry, perfume, creams, cosmetics, and costume jewelry, among other things.

loans.name: Zhibek

texts.ru: Жибек, 34 года, замужем, мать 4 детей. В качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, она с 1999 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 2,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве Жибек на сегодняшний день имеется 1 корова, 8 овец, также 1,11 ГА собственной земли, где она выращивает фасоль. Совокупный ежемесячный доход составляет до 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жибек обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 65,000 сом (KGS) на покупку одной коровы для увеличения объемов реализации экологически чистого молока. Жибек является одним из 4 участников группы "Раззак". Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en: Zhibek is 34 years old, married and a mother of 4 children. To provide the primary income for her family, she has been involved in animal husbandry and farming since 1999, when she started this business with 2,000 som (KGS). Today, Zhibek's farm contains 1 cow, 8 sheep and also 1.11 hectares of her own land, where she grows beans. Her combined monthly income amounts up to 15,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Zhibek requested a loan in the amount of 65,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to buy one cow to increase her sales volume of ecologically clean milk. Zhibek is one of the 4 members of the Razzak group. She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further growing her business.

loans.use: to buy one cow to increase her sales volume of ecologically clean milk

loans.name: Ana Luisa

texts.es:
Ana tiene 32 años de edad, es soltera, vive con su familia en el ditrito de Oyotún, en una zona rural que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Piura, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales principalmente.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales como cuyes, gallos, gallinas, pollos, etc, cuenta con más de 5 años de experiencia en el negocio y con buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos. Solicita préstamo para la compra de más animales así como alimento balanceado para estos, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en animales, con gran influencia en el negocio, con esto Ana espera incrementar su stock de animales para poder atender los diversas gustos y necesidades de los clientes de la zona lo que le generará mayores ingresos que le van a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana is 32 years old, single, and lives with her family in Oyotún district, in a rural zone which is located in Chiclayo province, Piura region, on the northern coast of Peru. The inhabitants of this district primarily work in agriculture, trade, and raising animals. 

She works raising and selling animals such as guinea pigs, hens, chicks, etc. and has more than 5 years of experience in the business with good references from her neighbors. She asks for a loan to purchase more animals and balanced feed for them. This investment will serve her to have more variety and productivity of animals, with a great impact on the business. With this, Ana hopes to increase her stock of animals to be able to meet the various tastes and needs of the customers in the zone, which will generate more income, which will permit her to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more animals and also balanced feed for them.

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es:
Porfirio tiene 42 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico con su cónyuge y sus dos menores hijos en la parte rural del distrito de Pucará que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales principalmente.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de aves de corral como gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos. El crédito será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de aves y ganado caprino para incrementar el stock de su negocio, con esto el espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de animales a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Porfirio is 42 years old, lives in his own house made of rustic materials with his spouse and their two young children in the rural part of Pucará district, which is located in Jaén province, Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru. The inhabitants of this district work in trade and raising animals, primarily. 

He works raising and selling poultry such as chickens, ducks, turkeys, and more, and has experience in the business and good references from his neighbors. The loan will be used to purchase a larger number of birds and goats to increase the stock of his business. With this, he hopes to offer a greater variety of animals to his customers, which will have a positive impact on his income level, with the end of improving his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of birds and goats to increase the stock of his business.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a single man. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a retail business where he sells rice, flour, sugar and other items. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in a good, convenient place and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low stock. 

John will use his KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of rice, flour, sugar and other items. His business goal is to have more business branches within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have improved living standards. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice, flour, sugar and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy medication

loans.name: Joash

texts.en:
Joash is 32 years old. He is married with 2 children. He has had a furniture-making business for 3 years. He will be using his loan to purchase metal bars and equipment and hopes this will help him to make more metal tables and chairs to meet his customers' needs and demands. He will use the generated income to provide for his family's needs such as food, education and clothing. 

His hopes and dreams for the future are to expand his business by opening another furniture-making business, make more income and be able to pay for his children's school fees.

loans.use: to make more metal tables and chairs to meet his customers' needs and make more income to educate his children.

loans.name: Anita Georja

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como 4 esquinas en la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las socias  del Grupo De Crédito Nueva Esperanza, Portoviejo es una ciudad rodeada de vegetación y un hermoso rio que baña los campos los mismos que son propicios para los cultivos.
En este lugar vive l señora Anita, tiene 67 años de edad, está separada y de esta relación  tienen  11 hijos  mayores de edad, una hija vive con ella.
Doña Anita es una mujer que le ha tocado trabajar muy duro para salir adelante, ella se dedica a la venta de productos naturales de la marca Garden  lo cual lo realiza puerta a puerta, su hija le ayuda con sus ventas, ella también todas las tardes instala un local en su casa en la cual vende empanadas y corviches, también los fines de semana compra y vende queso lo cual lo hace en su casa o entrega al por mayor en el mercado local, ya son más de 12 años  que se dedica a estas actividades con las cuales se gana la vida.
Este crédito es para comprar productos naturales, queso y víveres para preparar las empanadas. Ella está desde  el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
The Nueva Experanza communal bank meets every 15 days in the area known as Four Corners in the city of Portoviejo.  Portoviejo is a city surrounded by vegetation and a beautiful river that bathes the fields.  The rivers are advantageous to the crops.

This is where Anita, age 67, lives.  She is separated, and they have 11 grown children.  One daughter lives with her.  Anita is a woman who has had to work very hard in order to get ahead.  She sells Garden brand natural products by going door-to-door.  Her daughter helps her with her sales.

Also, every afternoon she sets up a place at her house where she sells empanadas and ‘corviches’ [a dish made out of green bananas and fish].  On the week-ends she buys and sells cheese at home or delivers it wholesale to the local market.  She has been engaged in these business activities from which she earns a living for over 12 years.

This loan is to buy natural products, cheese, and supplies to make the empanadas.

She has been in the communal bank since it began.  She likes it for the help the loans provide.  Her dream is to continue improving her business.

loans.use: to buy natural products, cheese, and supplies to make the empanadas.

loans.name: Gema María

texts.es:
En  el sector  de la calle 26 de Septiembre  de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita conocida como la Ciudad De Los reales Tamarindos, se reúnen  cada quince días los socios  del Grupo De Crédito Las Acacias. 
En este lugar vive la señora Gema, tiene 26 años de edad,  está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 6 y 1 año de edad, el mayor estudia en escuela. Su esposo es mecánico.
Doña Gema es una mujer que le gusta valerse por sí misma y conseguir sus propios ingresos por el bien de ella y su hogar, ella  se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, sale a realizar sus recorridos unos tres o cuatro  días por semana más que todo en horas de la mañana, ella aprovecha que uno de sus pequeños esta en clases y solo tiene que llevar al más pequeño, también vende en  su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan algo de lo que ella vende, deja sus productos a  crédito y cobra cada semana o cada quince días.  Lleva más de 5 años con esta actividad con la cual se gana algo por el bien de su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, blusas, camisas, entre otras prendas. Lleva 2 ciclos  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la facilidad que le dan  los créditos. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus pequeños.
texts.en:
In the 26th September Street area of the city of Portoviejo, the Manabi capital known as the "City of the Royal Tamarind Trees", the members of the Acacias Credit Group meet up every fortnight. 

This is where Gema lives. She is 26, married, and she and her husband have 2 children who are 6 and 1 years old. Their oldest child is at school. Gema's husband is a mechanic. 

Gema is a woman who likes to stand on her own two feet and make her own income. For the well-being of herself and her household she sells clothing of all kinds. She sells her wares from door and does her routes three or four days a week. She usually works in the mornings, making the most of the fact that one of her children is at school and she only has to take the smallest one with her. She also sells from her house, where her customers come if they need something that she sells. She sells her products on credit and collects the money every week or fortnight. She has been doing this for more than 5 years, and in this way she earns something for the good of her family.

This loan will be used to buy trousers, blouses, shirts and other items of clothing. She has been with this Credit Group for 2 years and she likes it because they give her loans easily. Her dream is to give the best to her little ones.

loans.use: to buy trousers, blouses, shirts and other items of clothing

loans.name: Consuelo Raquel

texts.es:
Consuelo tiene 50 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura y crianza de animales y se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral como gallinas, cuyes, cerdos, entre otros, se dedica a este negocio desde hace 05 años, contando con experiencia en el sector y con buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos. Solicita préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de cerdos, patos, gallinas, pavos, entre otros animales para incrementar su negocio, el prestamo le ayudará para tener un mayor stock de animales, esto con la finalidad de incrementar su negocio de los mismos y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes lo que le generará ingresos mayores con los que mejorará su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Consuelo is 50 years old with a live-in partner. She lives in her own home in a rural zone of the Oyotún District, a community that makes a living from agriculture and raising animals. It is situated in the Chiclayo Province, Lambayeque Region, on the northern coast of Peru.

She makes a living raising farmyard animals, such as hens, guinea pigs, and pigs, among others. She has made a living from this business for 5 years, counting on experience in this area and with good references from her neighbors.

She is requesting a loan for the purchase of a greater quantity of pigs, ducks, hens, and turkeys, among other animals, to increase her business.
