The previous loan made it possible to offer a variety of products in her business. With it, she has had the income necessary to subsist and up to now hasn't had any problem keeping working.

loans.use: to purchase corn, sweets, bread, spices, soap, juices, etc. to keep her business stocked and have customer satisfaction.

loans.name: Mirna Beatriz

texts.es:
Mirna, de 31 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está casada y su esposo trabaja de chef  temporal en un comedor, tienen dos hijos que estudian y viven con ellos.

Mirna, trabaja en un centro comercial desde hace cinco años, le dieron la oportunidad de trabajar en ese lugar para que se superará, antes solo estudiaba y vivía en casa de sus padres.- Su lugar de trabajo está a 5 minutos y viaja en autobús y su horario de trabajo es desde las 7:00 a.m. hasta las  5:00 p.m.

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar postes de metal y cables de energía para colocar energía eléctrica en su casa, el préstamo mejorará su condición de vida y su necesidad de tener luz en su casa será cubierta. 

Sus sueños son, trasladarse a la casa que acaba de construir, porque en estos momentos vive con  su mamá.- Ella espera además, que sus  hijos tengan la oportunidad de ir a la universidad y graduarse de la carrera que ellos elijan.
texts.en:
Mirna is 31 years old. She went to school up to high school. She is married and her husband works as a temporary chef in a restaurant. They have two children who go to school and live with them.

Mirna has worked at a shopping center for five years. She was given the opportunity to work there so she can get ahead. Before, she just worked and lived in her parents; house. Her workplace is 5 minutes away and she gets there in a bus. Her work schedule is from 7:00 a.m. to  5:00 p.m.

She needs the loan to buy metal posts and electrical cables to install electricity in her house. The loan will improve her living conditions and her need for lights in her house will be covered. 

Her dream is to move into the house she just built because right now she is living with her mother. She also hopes that her children will have the opportunity to go to college and graduate with a degree in whatever they want.

loans.use: to buy metal posts and electrical cables to install electricity in her house.

loans.name: Oscar Rene

texts.es:
Oscar, es soltero y dueño de un cibercafé en el que también ofrece servicio de copias, tiene un horario de atención al cliente de nueve de la mañana a ocho de la noche, es una actividad que disfruta mucho al realizarla, todo lo relacionado con la informática le llama su atención desde muy niño.
Necesita comprar papelería, tintas, teclados, audífonos y otros accesorios para ir equipando su negocio y lograr ampliarlo, él espera tener una mejor situación financiera para cancelar su deuda y tener un mejor estilo de vida.
Sus aspiraciones son adquirir equipo más moderno para cubrir las demandas de sus clientes y saber administrar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Oscar is single and the owner of an internet cafe in which he also offers copy services. He is open from nine in the morning to eight at night. It is work that he enjoys doing a lot. Everything technology-related has caught his attention since he was very young.

He needs to purchase paper goods, ink, keyboards, headphones and other accessories to continue supplying his business and manage to expand it. He hopes to have a better financial situation to pay off his debt and have a better lifestyle.

His aspirations are to acquire more modern equipment to meet his customers' demands and know how to manage his income.

loans.use: to purchase paper goods, ink, keyboards, headphones and other accessories to continue supplying his business and manage to expand it.

loans.name: Magaly Cristabel

texts.es:
Magaly, vive con su esposo y sus hijos, su esposo es fotógrafo y ella es propietaria de una tienda de productos varios, ambos comparten la responsabilidad de cubrir los gastos familiares, su negocio lo tiene desde hace cinco años y lo atiende con ayuda de su familia.
Comprará jugos, gaseosas, pan, aceite, azúcar, sal, productos enlatados, etc., la inversión le ayudara a disminuir las necesidades de sus clientes, espera que las ventas e ingresos sean mayores para ir cumpliendo con sus obligaciones.
Sus sueños son ser una persona reconocida en su comunidad por su espíritu de superación y dar a sus hijos un futuro más prometedor.
texts.en:
Magaly lives with her husband and their children. Her husband is a photographer and she is the owner of a store with varied products. They both share the responsibility of covering the family's needs. She has had her business for five years and she manages it with the help of her family. 

She will buy juices, sodas, bread, sugar, canned goods, etc. The investment will help her meet the needs of her customers. She hopes that the sales and income will be better so she can meet her obligations.  

Her dream is to be a person who is well known in her community for her overcoming spirit, and to give her children a more promising future.

loans.use: to buy juices, sodas, bread, oil, sugar, salt, canned goods, etc. The investment will help her to meet her customers' needs.

loans.name: Love Group

texts.en:
Love Group is a group of three members who live together. They sell African wax fabric, sobolo (a local drink), slippers, and wigs. They have been together for the past three years and are doing very well in the community. 

The leader of the group is Rose, who is 43 years old. She is married to Owusu, a 53-year-old mechanic. They have two children. Rose attended school to the secondary level, and she started her business selling African wax fabric door-to-door 11 years ago. She does this in order to provide for her family. 

She buys her items from the market in Ghana. In order to improve customer satisfaction, she is requesting a loan of GHS 1,400. This loan will help her to meet customer demand and make a bigger profit. The group members need a total of GHS 3,300 to be able to meet their customers' needs.

loans.use: To buy more African wax fabric from the market and sell it to customers door-to-door.

loans.name: Shqiperi

texts.en:
Shqiperi wants to expand her livestock by buying five goats and your loan will help her achieve this goal. Currently, her goats have given birth only to baby males. She is 45 and a mother of three teen-aged children and they live in the southeastern part of Albania known for the best products such as apples, quinces, white beans and Lima beans, red onions and dried meat and also for their cuisine.
 
Shqiperi’s focus these past five years has been in agriculture and livestock; she has rented some land from other villagers where she plants tobacco and has grapevines from which she makes the alcohol drink called locally ‘raki’. In addition to this, she’s got some goats at the moment and she’s shown in the photograph holding a newborn baby goat.

loans.use: to expand her livestock by adding five goats

loans.name: Nazneen

texts.en:
Nazneen is a 49-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of three children. Her husband owns a printing shop. Her husband is the guardian of the family and responsible to fulfill the needs of all family members. Nazneen has been running her own beauty salon for the past five years. She also contributes her income with her husband to manage the household. 

She needs to buy different types of cosmetics, i.e., creams, hair brushes, and other accessories for her beauty salon but due to financial constraints she is not capable to buy these items for her business purposes. Therefore Nazneen has applied for a Kiva loan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business purposes so that she can provide better services to her customers. It will also be helpful for her to earn maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.

For this financial assistance Nazneen is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to expand her beauty parlor business.

loans.name: Ranta

texts.en:
Ranta is 51 years old. She is married with five children. She does farming as well as selling milk. She has been in business for seven years. Her monthly income is 9,000 KES.

This is her third loan with VisionFund Kenya. She plans to use the entire loan to purchase milk for selling. She plans to use the profits to educate her children. In future, she wants to prosper in life.

loans.use: to purchase milk to sell

loans.name: Cristina

texts.pt:
A senhora Cristina de 54 anos de idade é mãe de 7 filhos, 4 dos quais ja maiores de idade e trabalhadores, 3 frequentam o ensino primário.Alem dos filhos e responsavel por 4 netos.
Com o valor do empréstimo pretende comprar cimento, barrotes e chapas para dar continuidade a sua obra.
Tem como sonho, concluir a sua casa , comprar bens de consumo e um carro para o uso pessoal.
Os principais desafios são financeiros e tem recorrido ao trabalho e ao xitique para suprir as suas necessidades e pretende tomar mais crédito para poder dar resposta as suas necessidades.
texts.en:
Ms Cristina is 54 years old and the mother of 7 children. 4 of them are already of age and working, 3 are in school. As well as her children she is also responsible for 4 grandchildren.

With this loan she plans to buy cement, beams, sheets of metal to continue the building work on her home.

Her dream is to finish her home, buy consumable good and a car for personal use.

Her main challenges are financial ones and she has turned to her work and to a savings group for her monetary needs. She plans to ask for further loans to be able to respond to her needs.

loans.use: buy cement, beams, sheets of metal to continue the building work on her home.

loans.name: Benon

texts.en:
Benon is a hardworking 41-year-old married man. He has six children and four of them attend school. He lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in livestock (cattle) fattening alongside farming, where he feels self employed and has been able to sustain his family.

He hopes to expand his cattle farm and become a specialist in livestock raising, but operating costs at the farm are high since he faces challenges such as bad weather and animal diseases like foot and mouth disease. Benon is requesting a loan to buy new calves to add to his farm.

loans.use: to buy new calves to add to his farm.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 38 years old with one child.

Emma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, snack foods, home products, and other groceries.

Emma has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from fishing.

Emma aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, snack foods, home products and other groceries

loans.name: Sagreti

texts.en:
Sagreti is a twenty-nine-year-old woman married with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. For four years, Sagreti has been selling cassava flour to get income to look after her family. She also does farming to supplement her income. 

Sagreti is hard-working with a dream of educating her children and becoming rich. Sagreti has asked for a loan to buy cassava flour for selling.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour for resale

loans.name: Afonso

texts.pt:
O senhor Afonso tem 32 anos, é casado e é  pai de 3 filhos, 1 dos quais   frequenta o ensino secundário e os outros 2 frequentando o ensino primário. Vive na casa própria e  tem na sua responsabilidade a sua mãe que vive com ele.
Diz que com o valor do empréstimo irá comprar tranquetas, reguladores, dobradiças , ferros para o fabrico de aros para reforçar o volume de mercadoria da sua serralharia.
Seus sonhos e esperanças para o futuro são ampliar o seu negócio, construir um estabelecimento melhorado e um aviários para aumentar a renda familiar.
Diz que tem como desafios insuficiência de   fundos  e para ultrapassar esta situação faz xitique como forma de poupar e irá solicitar mais créditos para concretizar os seus planos.
texts.en:
Mr. Afonso is 32 years old, married and the father of 3 children, 1 of whom goes to high school and the other two go to primary school.

He lives in a house he owns and is responsible for his mother who lives with him.

He says that with this loan he will buy locks, regulators, hinges and iron to make hoops/frames in order to reinforce the stock at his hardware store.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to expand his business, build a better establishment and some aviaries to increase his family's income.

He says that the lack of funds is his biggest challenge and to overcome it he is part of a savings group as a method of saving money and will ask for further loans to carry out his plans.

loans.use: buy locks, regulators, hinges and iron to make hoops/frames in order to reinforce the stock at his hardware store.

loans.name: Hamza

texts.en:
Hamza is a 28-year-old married man who has been working in the music business since 2013. He is working hard to develop his business in a well-managed way. To this end, Hamza is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to buy necessary speakers and a surround sound system.

He is a hard-working man, well known in his region with his special talents and good reputation in his domain. He hopes that in the future he can open a wider shop and cover special occasions and events.

loans.use: to buy necessary speakers and a surround sound system to develop his business in a well-managed way

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in women's shoes and sandals for sale.

loans.name: Crescenciana

texts.en:
Chris Glen is 19 years old and is 4 of 4 children in the family. His mother, Crescenciana, supports the family through her fish vending business in the Philippines.

Chris Glen is studying for a Bachelor's in Science Marketing and is currently in the 4th of this 4-year course.

Chris Glen is borrowing 10,000 to pay for tuition fees of the first semester of the year 2015-2016.

When he graduates, Chris Glen plans to graduate and be gainfully employed

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Laura Alicia

texts.es:
Laura, de 33 años de edad, es comerciante y una mujer emprendedora, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura.

Laura, hace un año se dedica a la venta de tortillas, este negocio lo coloco gracias a la ayuda de un crédito anterior, con el dinero construyo una pequeña galera en su casa, para la venta de tortillas.

Ahora Laura, necesita el efectivo del crédito para comprar maíz y leña para la elaboración de las tortillas y de está menera continuar haciendo tortillas para la venta.

Su sueño a futuro es, poner una pequeña tienda en su casa y continuar vendiendo tortillas.
texts.en:
Laura is 33 years old. She is a businesswoman and an enterprising woman. She is in a relationship, and her partner is dedicated to agriculture.

For one year, Laura has been selling tortillas. She invested in this business thanks to the help of a previous loan. With the money, she built a small gallery in her house in which to sell tortillas.

Now, Laura needs a loan to buy corn and firewood for making the tortillas. In this way, she will continue making tortillas for sale.

Her dream for the future is to establish a small store in her house and to continue selling tortillas.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood to make tortillas.

loans.name: Delphine

texts.en:
Delphine is 29 years old. She is married with two children, who are one and three years old and do not yet go to school. She is a farmer and has been growing maize for the past 10 years. Her husband is a businessman. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to increase her savings.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Sokol

texts.en: Sokol’s daughter is sick and requires immediate attention from health specialists; thus, he is seeking your compassion and financial help to take his daughter to the doctors.

loans.use: to take his daughter to a health specialist

loans.name: Douglas's Group

texts.en:
Douglas is 41 years old and has six children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by 13 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Douglas has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of his desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although he described his last harvest as good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. 

Douglas also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Douglas's Group will be able to receive a total of 10 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Iris Lorena

texts.es:
Iris, de 35 años de edad, es madre soltera de 4 hijos, se dedica a la venta de tortillas en su comunidad.
 
Iris, todos los días sale a vender tortillas a la orilla de la carretera, hoy en dia decidio realizar un préstamo, para comprar 3 sacos de maíz y una camionada de leña, todo esto para continuar con su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos, para ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios.

Sus sueños a futuro son, mejorar su calidad de vida y tener una tienda.
texts.en:
Iris is 35 years old. She is a single mother of 4 children. She is dedicated to selling tortillas in her community.

Every day, Iris goes to sell tortillas on the side of the highway. Now, she has decided to take out a loan to buy 3 sacks of corn and a load of firewood, all to continue with her business and improve her income to help her children with their education.

Her dreams for the future are to improve her quality of life and have a store.

loans.use: to buy 3 sacks of corn and a load of firewood.

loans.name: Rosemary's Group

texts.en:
Rosemary, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 20 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 11 farmers in Webuye District. She is 50 years old, is married, and has nine children.

Rosemary likes to think of herself as a very hardworking individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2014, and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has been able to consistently feed her family. Rosemary plans to use the profits from this coming season to send her children to school.

In total, Rosemary’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 7.75 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 2 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomas es un agricultor casado de 52 años que se dedica a cultivar distintos tipos de plantas especialmente café y hortalizas bajo criterios certificados orgánicos y de comercio Justo (Fair Trade).
Tomas tiene 3 hijos bajo su cargo y los ingresos actuales son demasiado limitados para suplir todas sus necesidades por lo que piensa que el producir otros productos que dejen una ganancia suficiente para mejorar su nivel de vida.
Tomas necesita un préstamo para construir un invernadero en el que plantará tomate orgánico. Los comercializará por medio de cooperativa COCAFCAL de la que es socio. La producción del tomate será hidropónica y 100% orgánica.
Ya ha comenzado su construcción y el préstamo ayudaría a Tomas a comprar todo lo necesario para montar su invernadero: madera, nailon, tela, bolsas de fibra de coco, pago de trabajadores agroquímicos (orgánicos), fertilizantes (orgánicos) y sistema de riego.
texts.en:
Tomas is a 55 years old married farmer. He dedicates his life to produce coffee, fruits and vegetables under fair trade and organic certification. Tomas has 3 children and his current income are not enough to cover all his family´s needs, that´s why he wants to produce other products that will enable his family to have the income they needs to improve their quality of life.
Tomas needs this loan to build a greenhouse where he will plant organic tomatoes. He will sell these tomatoes through COCAFCAL, the cooperative he is member of. Tomatoes production will be hydroponic and 100% organic.
He has started to build the greenhouse and this loan will help Tomás to buy all what he needs to finish it: wood, nylon, coconut fibre bags, fabrics, organic agrochemicals, organic fertilizers and an irrigation system.

loans.use: To buy the materials he needs to build an organic greenhouse, like wood, coconut fibre bags and an irrigation system.

loans.name: Ángel Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio de 60 años dedica su vida a la apicultura organica y a la enseñanza, está casado con Carolina y tiene tres hijos bajo su cargo. El vende su miel 100% orgánica en COCAFCAL(cooperativa de la que es socio) donde obtiene muy buenos precios por su miel. La producción de miel es la actividad que le provee recursos para poder suplir algunas necesidades que su trabajo no suple en su casa tales como mantener el estudio de sus hijos a un 100%.
La producción de miel es un proyecto que se viene impulsando por COCAFCAL con la intención que los productores de la zona diversifiquen sus ingresos fuera del rubro del café. La zona es muy propicia para la producción de miel ya que las condiciones climáticas son adecuadas para la supervivencia de las abejas y la variedad de flora ayuda a que el rendimiento sea excelente, el mercado esta 100% asegurado por COCAFCAL y a muy buenos precios.
Con el crédito Antonio piensa comprar: excluidores, velos, mantos y otros materiales necesarios para la manipulación y mantenimiento de las abejas. "La producción de miel nos da una oportunidad de hacer dinero sin invertir demasiado" dice Antonio.
texts.en:
Antonio is 60 years old and he dedicates his life to organic apiculture and teaching. He is married to Carolina and they have 3 children together. He sells 100% organic honey through COCAFCAL (the cooperative he is member of) thanks to which he gets good prices for his honey. Honey production is the activity that provides him that extra income that enables him to pay for 100% his children´s studies and that his current job is not able to give him.
Honey production is a project COCAFCAL has been pushing for with the aim to diversify their members income and not to depend only on coffee. The area is very convenient for honey production. The reason is climatic conditions are good for bees and the variety of the flora makes product performance to be excellent. The market is 100% assured by COCAFCAL and with very good prices.
Antonio will use the loan to buy 30 excluder devices, mantles, veils, and other material he needs to manipulate and maintain bees. "Honey production gives us an income opportunity without having to invest a lot", Antonio says.

loans.use: To buy 30 excluder devices for his organic apiary.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in skirts, blouses, shirts, pants, and children’s clothing.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Adelaida is 59 years old and has one child in school.

Adelaida has a buy and sell processed peanuts business in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more peanuts for her business.

Adelaida has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more peanuts for her business

loans.name: Rosemary's Group

texts.en:
Rosemary is 54 years old and has eight children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 15 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Rosemary has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds and, although she described her last harvest as very good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Rosemary also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Rosemary's Group will be able to receive a total of 10 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 8.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Aira

texts.en:
Aira is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Aira is 34 years old and has three children who are in school.

Aira has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Aira has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en:
Margaret, pictured above, has 10 children and is always described as a very friendly person, which is why she was selected to become the group leader of her group. Margaret is representing her group of 11 farmers in Webuye District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Margaret has been a farmer for more than 30 years and, in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. Her loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which she is very happy to be getting as that means she will now reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this coming season, Margaret is planning to save more money for the future.

A total of 4.75 acres will be planted by Margaret's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Yesenia Arely

texts.es:
Arely, de 25 años de edad, está soltera, estudio hasta sexto, debido a la falta de recursos economicos de sus padres, no pudo continuar estudiando y se dedico a ayudarlos en la agricultura; es por ello que sabe y conoce a perfección el trabajo, vive con sus padres, sus abuelos y sus hermanos.

Arely, se dedica especialmente a cultivar maíz y chile; pero también posee una pequeña granja de cerdos y gallinas, los cuales cuida y vende posteriormente cuando ya están grandes.

Arely, necesita el crédito para alquilar 7,000 metros cuadrados de tierra, para poder cultivar una parte de chile y la otra parte de maíz; también pretende comprar todos los insumos necesario, para el cultivo de estos.

En un futuro ella sueña con poder comprar ganado y cultivar 21,000 metros cuadrados de chile y maíz, para obtener mejores ganancias y así aportar para los gastos de su casa.
texts.en:
Arely, 25 years old, is single and studied until sixth grade. Due to her parents’ lack of financial resources she could not continue studying and devoted herself to helping her parents with farming. This is how she knows and understands the work perfectly. She lives with her parents, grandparents and siblings. 

Arely is especially devoted to cultivating corn and chili but also has a small farm with pigs and chickens which she cares for and then sells once they are big.

Arely needs the loan to let 7,000 square meters of land in order to cultivate one area with chili and the other with corn. She also intends to buy all of the supplies necessary for planting this.

In the future she dreams of buying cattle and cultivating 21,000 square meters of chili and corn to obtain better earnings and in that way contribute to the household costs.

loans.use: to let 7,000 square meters of land in order to cultivate one area with chili and the other with corn.

loans.name: Paul's Group

texts.en:
Paul is 69 years old and has eight children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by nine farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Paul has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of his desire to earn enough to feed his family and, although he described his last harvest as very good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Paul also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Paul's Group will be able to receive a total of 6 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 4.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Aireen

texts.en:
Aireen is 35 years old and married with three children. With her three children in school, Aireen works very hard to provide for them.

Aireen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store such as beverages, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Aireen has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Aireen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store such as beverages, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.en:
Ana Maria is 42 years old and married with five children. With four of her children in school, Ana Maria works very hard to provide for them.

Ana Maria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store such as eggs, junk foods, canned goods, and other groceries.

Ana Maria has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Ana Maria would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store such as eggs, junk foods, canned goods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Jackson's Group

texts.en:
Jackson is 69 years old and has five children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by fourteen farmers in Webuye District, Kenya.

Jackson has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of his desire to have access to the best seed prices and, although he described his last harvest as very good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund.

Jackson also decided to purchase two solar lights as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Jackson's Group will be able to receive a total of nine solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of eight acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Yonasani

texts.en:
Yonasani is 60 years old, married, and relatively hardworking. He lives in Kamwenge, Uganda and earns a living from farming, with extra income from goat selling.

He hopes to develop his business into a modern farm and increase his output of crop production, especially coffee. His major challenge is bad weather that affects the output from his garden.

He is requesting a loan to hire labor for his farm and buy more fertilizers for his coffee plantation.

loans.use: to hire labor for his farm and buy more fertilizers for his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie is a widowed woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ana Marie is 53 years old, and one of her children is in school.

Ana Marie has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy gallons of coconut wine to sell.

Ana Marie has been in this business for ten years.

In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy gallons of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Lia

texts.en:
Lia is a 40-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and an infant daughter in Senaki district. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they cultivate the family-owned agricultural land, where they grow maize to sell. In addition, they have 100 nut trees and sell the harvest locally at a good price.

Lia decided to build a greenhouse and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 1,000 GEL. With the received credit, she will build a greenhouse and will purchase seeds for tomatoes and cucumbers.

The new business initiative will be a great support for her family, as she will have stable income from the greenhouse. Lia awaits your support.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse.

loans.name: Jose Camilo

texts.es:
José, de 39 años de edad, se ha dedicado a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de maíz, chile y ajonjolí, este trabajo los aprendió, porque no pudo continuar estudiando, debido a los escasos recursos económicos de su familia.

José, siempre mantiene la tierra preparada para cultivar, normalmente cultiva solo en tiempo de invierno, porque vive en un lugar donde no se puede trabajar en cultivos de regadillo.

El crédito que está solicitando es para alquilar 7,000 metros cuadrados de tierra para cultivar maíz, chile y ajonjolí.

El sueño de José, es poder obtener una buena ganancia en el cultivo de este año.
texts.en:
Jose, 39 years old, works in agriculture - corn, chili and sesame seed crops in particular. He learned this work because he could not continue studying due to his family’s limited financial resources.

Jose always keeps the land ready for planting. He usually plants only in winter time because he lives in a place where one cannot work with irrigated land. 

The loan he is requesting is to let 7,000 square meters of land to cultivate corn, chili and sesame seed. 

Jose’s dream is to obtain good earnings with this year’s crop.

loans.use: to let 7,000 square meters of land to cultivate corn, chili and sesame seed.

loans.name: Annah's Group

texts.en:
Annah is 31 years old and has five children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by ten farmers in Webuye District, Kenya.

Annah has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds and, although she described her last harvest as very good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund.

Annah also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Annah's Group will be able to receive a total of five solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Jotham's Group

texts.en:
Jotham is 38 years old and has six children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by eleven farmers in Webuye District, Kenya.

Jotham has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of his desire to earn enough to send his children to school and, although he described his last harvest as good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund.

Jotham also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Jotham's Group will be able to receive a total of eight solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase ladies' sandals and shoes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stock her general store with a wider variety of products

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel, de 49 años de edad. estudio hasta sexto grado, dejo de estudiar por la guerra que vivía el país en ese tiempo, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica al comercio de camarón, tiene 7 hijos, pero cuatro de ellos ya están acompañados, 3 viven con ellos pero solo 2 estudian.

Manuel, se dedica a la pesca artesanal desde hace 20 años, después de los acuerdos de paz se traslado al lugar donde actualmente vive y una institución llamada IDCA capacito a los habitantes de esa comunidad, en la siembra de camarón, para darle uso a los estanques que habían en ese lugar.- Antes se dedicaba  a la agricultura, pero le gusta más la pesca porque obtiene ganancias mucho más rápido, ahora es socio de un estanque camaronero junto con 6 personas más, su horario es desde las 6:00 a.m. a 6:00 p.m. y por las noches, pesca  con sus hijos en el mar y regresan a la media noche.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar concentrado para la siembra del camarón, porque de eso depende el peso y la calidad de los camarones que cosechen.

Su sueño es ver sus dos últimos hijos graduarse de una carrera universitaria y mejorar las condiciones del estanque, para obtener mejores resultados.- Además, quiere comprar una lancha para pescar.
texts.en:
Manuel, aged 49, studied up to sixth grade. He dropped out of school because of the war that engulfed the country at the time.

He is in a relationship, and his partner makes a living selling shrimp. They have seven children, but four of them have already their own families. The other three children live with them, and only two go to school.

Manuel has been making a living in artisanal fishing over the past 20 years. After the peace agreements, he moved to the place where he currently lives. An institution called IDCA provided the inhabitants of that community with training on shrimp farming to make use of the ponds in the area. 

Before his current occupation, he used to work in agriculture, but he likes fishing better because he makes profits much faster. Now, he and six other people are partners in a shrimp pond. He works from 6:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. He goes fishing in the sea with his sons at dusk, and they come back at midnight.

The loan will be used to buy concentrated feed for shrimp farming because the weight and the quality of the shrimp they harvest depend on it. 

His dreams are to see his two youngest sons achieve a university degree and to improve the conditions of the pond to yield better results. Additionally, he wants to buy a fishing boat.

loans.use: to buy concentrated feed for shrimp farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in lotions, deodorants, creams, makeup, and other beauty products

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana, de 57 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, debido a la situación económica de su familia, tiene dos hijos, los cuales ya se independizaron.

Juana, se dedica al cuido de ganado de repasto y también siembra hortalizas, pues sus padres y hermanos le enseñaron a trabajar en las hortalizas y luego sale a venderlas en su cantón.

Juana, con el crédito que solicita comprará dos novillos de repasto, para poder obtener más ganancias en la venta del ganado de repasto.

Juana, pretende en un futuro poder tener cinco vacas lecheras y así poder llevar el sustento diario a su familia.
texts.en:
Juana, 57 years old, studied until the fourth grade due to her family’s financial situation. She has two children who are already independent.

Juana works caring for grazing cattle and also plants vegetables since her parents and siblings taught her to work with vegetables. She then goes out selling them in her neighborhood.

With the requested loan, Juana will buy two young bulls in order to obtain better earnings from selling pasture cattle. 

In the future, Juana aims to have five milking cows and to bring daily sustenance to her family in that way.

loans.use: to buy two young bulls.

loans.name: Ruth Elizabeth

texts.es: Ruth de 22 años de edad se gana la vida desde hace 5 años vendiendo almuerzos y refrescos en una zona de mucha afluencia de personas, por lo que cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes que gustan de sus productos, por la excelente calidad de estos y sus precios accesibles. Ella habita en casa propia al lado de sus 2 hijos una niña de 5 años y un varón de 2 años de edad a los que ha logrado sacar adelante como madre soltera. Ruth desea mejorar la presentación de sus productos, ya que no cuenta con los utensilios adecuados para esto, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: bandejas de aluminio, platos de cerámica, vasos, cubiertos, etc., y de esta manera atraer una mayor cantidad de clientes para obtener mejores ingresos que le permitan brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ruth, age 22, has been earning her living for the last five years by selling lunch and drinks in an affluent part of town. She has a lot of customers who enjoy her products, both for their excellent quality and their affordable prices. She lives in her own home along with her two children, a five-year-old daughter and a two-year-old son. She is managing to get both of them ahead as a single mother.

Ruth wants to improve the presentation of per products and she doesn't have the right utensils now. With this loan from FUSAI, she plans to invest in aluminum trays, ceramic plates, glasses, covers and more. She hopes to use this to attract more customers, earn more money, and provide her children with a better quality of life.

loans.use: improve the presentation of her meals and attract more customers

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es: José tiene 44 años de edad es un hombre emprendedor que desde hace 8 años se dedica a la venta de zapatos para dama de forma ambulante recorriendo las principales calles de su municipio, por lo que ya cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes que siempre esperan por sus productos. Él habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus 3 hijos una niña de 7 años y 2 varones de 23 y 11 años de edad. José desea aumentar sus ventas y para ello ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI el cual le permita invertir en: sandalias y zapatos para dama y de esta manera mejorar sus ventas al igual que sus ganancias.
texts.en: José, age 44, is an enterprising man who started selling women's shoes around town eight years ago. He travels through the main streets of the city and has a large customer base that anticipate his products. He lives in his own home with his partner and their three children: a seven-year-old girl and two sons, aged 23 and 11 years. José wants to expand his sales, so he has come to FUSAI for a loan. He will use it to invest in buying women's sandals and shoes so that he can increase his sales, and thus his earnings.

loans.use: buy women's sandals and shoes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy corn at wholesale so she can make more tortillas

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is a 43-year-old married woman with two children who attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Annie has operted a sand and gravel business for 6 years and requests 21,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more sand and gravel to sell.

In the future, Annie would like to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sand and gravel.

loans.name: Aggrey

texts.en:
Aggrey is a 43-year-old hardworking married man. He lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. He has 4 children who are 15, 13, 10, and 8 years old, all attend school. 

He raises livestock and farms to earn a living and pay his children's school fees. He has been in this business since 2006 and supplies cheese and milk to his entire parish. He hopes to expand his cattle farm and start an animal consultancy enterprise.  He faces  challenges including  fire outbreaks on the farm.

He requests a loan to buy more cattle to raise and sell.

loans.use: to buy more cattle.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is a 53-year-old married woman with five children, 2 attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Antonia has operated a coconut wine vending business for 3 years and requests 7,000 PHP through NWTF to buy containers of coconut wine to sell.

 In the future, Antonia would like to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy containers of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is a 34-year-old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. His main business is selling produce and working in a retail shop  to supplement his income. He is inspired by the need to expand and have a wholesale store. 

He faces a challenge of high rate of competition from other traders in the same area. 

He needs a loan to buy more bags of coffee, maize, beans and ground nuts to sell.

loans.use: to buy bags of coffee, maize, beans, and ground nuts to sell.

loans.name: Arlyne

texts.en:
Arlyne is a 36-year-old hard working entrepreneur with two children, one attends school.

Arlyne has had a spice business for 11 years and requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more spices to sell.

 In the future, Arlyne would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more spices to sell.

loans.name: Rosette

texts.en:
Rosette is a 46-year-old hardworking married woman. She lives in Kamwenge, Uganda and raises cattle.  She earns additional income from a monthly salary in the local government and operating a coffee plantation. 

She intends to have a big cattle farm but she is limited by stiff competition and unpredictable weather conditions (prolonged dry spells) which cause lack of water and pastures for her animals. 

She requests a loan to buy more cattle.

loans.use: to buy more cattle.

loans.name: Les Responsables 1 Group

texts.en:
Philomene is a member of the community bank group Les Responsables 1 in Brazzaville, the Republic of Congo. 

She helps lead a subgroup of 12 other micro-entrepreneurs and has run her business selling spices for one year. Philomene will use her next loan to purchase several large sacs of black pepper to sell in smaller quantities. 

She is a 6-year-old woman with 7 children who has experienced many challenges in life.  She continues to  dream that one day she will  to travel and make a wider variety of purchases of spices to offer to her clientele.

loans.use: to purchases black pepper for her spice stand.

loans.name: Azenith

texts.en:
Azenith is a 31-year-old widow with three children,  two attend school.  Azenith works very hard to provide for them.

Azenith has run a general store for 2 years and requests 10,000 PHPthrough NWTF to buy condiments, home care products, and other groceries.

In the future, Azenith would like to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy  condiments, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Giorgi

texts.en:
Giorgi is a 36-year-old man from Kvareli district. He lives with his pensioner parents and wife. 

There is a high unemployment rate in the region and the family members don't have  stable incomes. Giorgi works as a hired worker to earn 200 GEL monthly. The income is hardly enough to meet even basic needs of the family, so they live in poverty and require financial support for starting additional businesses. 

He requested a loan and the financial institutions rejected his requests because of his unstable financial conditions and lack of experience.  After several unsuccessful attempts, Giorgi applied for the credit to MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of Start Up program, which is joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. Giorgi will purchase a special tractor and work for private orders. He will work hard to become financially stable.
 
The loan will be great support to this hard-working man and his family, as their income will greatly increase due to the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a tractor.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en: Amos is a very hardworking married man with eight children, and four of them attend school. They live in Hoima, Uganda. In order to raise income for his family Amos started buying and selling maize, beans and rice. He hopes to grow and expand his business to the level of a fully stocked produce store, supplying his customers throughout the year and thus having a constant flow of income. However, inadequate capital hinders his desire. Amos will use the credit facility to buy more maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
"Mary, featured in the picture above, is representing her group of nine farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. She is best known in her community for being a very resourceful person and is very excited to be joining One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Mary’s decision to join the program was largely due to the fact that she wanted to earn enough to send her children to school. In addition, she was keen on purchasing a solar light that she could afford, as she says that by doing so she would be able to have an overall improved quality of life, which she is very excited about. With the profits she earns from the coming harvesting season, Mary plans to invest in a business.

Between the nine farmers in Mary’s Group, a total of five acres of land will be planted using the farming inputs received with this loan. The group will also receive a total of eight solar lights."

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Hellen's Group

texts.en:
"Hellen, pictured above, has five children and is always described as a very trustworthy person, which is why she was selected to become the leader of her group. Hellen is representing her group of 14 farmers in Webuye District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Hellen has been a farmer for 14 years and, in order to earn enough to send her children to school, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. Her loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which she is very happy to be getting as that means she will now have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this coming season, Hellen is planning to send her children to school.

A total of 6.5 acres will be planted by Hellen's Group, and between them they will receive a total of nine solar lights."

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis does it all. He produces documentaries, promotional videos, and commercials. He creates music for video games, commercials, documentaries, and TV shows, and offers a digital recording studio for musical artists. His company has done everything from a shooting a theatrical movie trailer to a documentary on Patagonia to interviews with famous politicians.

Luis is a testament to how far a hobby can take you. After producing videos and music for fun, he shrewdly recognized the demand for the quality skills he possessed, and evolved his passion into a business two years ago. Originally from Colombia, Luis works with his brother, and hopes to hire at least one new employee this year. 

In an exciting recent development, Luis’ company, Fusion Studios, won the Melrose Award for “Best Video Promotional.” His company holds great potential, but Luis has struggled to attract enough clients to keep the business afloat. With this loan, Luis will purchase a computer to speed up production services for his current clients, hopefully allowing him to attract more customers. His personal goal is to gain more experience in his sector, and do all he can to improve his business. He hopes that in the future, the company will obtain more contracts and establish itself as one of the best video producing companies in Orlando, Fla.

Check out his website at: http://fusionstudiosorlando.com/.

loans.use: to purchase a computer to speed up video and music production services performed by his company

loans.name: Katrina

texts.en:
Katrina has been passionate about the salon business for “forever and a day.” With a grandmother in the salon business, she was exposed to salon work from a very young age, and decided to continue her passion via a career as an adult. She started her own salon in the Elizabeth, N.J., area, and currently employs three stylists. She supports her two daughters with her work as an independent female entrepreneur.

Katrina works hard to make sure her clients are happy, and says, “I’m doing what I love to do and my customers love my work.” With such an attitude, it is no wonder she has experienced an increase in clients! In order to meet these needs, she will use this loan to expand her salon, adding additional space to accommodate more supplies and services.

loans.use: to expand her salon, creating space to accommodate more client services

loans.name: Alice's Group

texts.en:
Alice is 51 years old and has seven children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by eight farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Alice has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, and although she described her last harvest as very good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Alice also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Alice's Group will be able to receive a total of seven solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 4 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a 38-year-old single lady with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is a retailer and has a bar and rentals that add more income. She is faced with challenges of limited capital plus high license fees that hinder progress of her business. 

She has asked for a loan to buy cement, windows and doors for the house she is constructing.

loans.use: to buy cement, windows and doors for the house she is constructing.

loans.name: Phionah

texts.en: Phionah is a 24-year-old married lady with one child. She lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is a retailer and at the same time has a popcorn machine that gives her more income. She is faced with the challenge of limited capital to increase her stock, which would in turn increase her profits. Besides that, she has hopes of expanding her business to new areas. She has asked for a loan to add stock of sugar, soap and maize flour to sell.

loans.use: to add stock of sugar, soap and posho to sell.

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara is 55 years old, married, and has one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Clara runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 18,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy items to sell in her general store such as condiments, eggs, as well as other groceries.

Clara has been in this business for 15 years now. 

In the future, Clara would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store such as condiments, eggs, as well as other groceries

loans.name: Les Responsables 2 Group

texts.en:
Three years ago, Dieu Merci started his own business as a butcher in Brazzaville, the Republic of Congo. He is requesting his loan portion of 375,000 XAF to purchase several new varieties of meat to add to his stock as well as replenish his supplies of chicken, fish, and beef. 

Dieu Merci is a member of the community bank Les Responsables 2, and he leads 10 other member of his group. By offering the best quality meat to his clients, he is able to attract more business and boost revenue, thanks to the personal nature of his customer interactions. 

With 1 child and 3 other family members under his care, Dieu Merci has ambitious plans to grow his business in the future and also diversify his activities. He hopes to become the owner of a car to use as a taxi service in Brazzaville.

loans.use: to purchase chicken, fish, and beef for his butcher shop.

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Jeniffer is a 38-year-old hardworking woman. She lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. She earns a living from a livestock farm and a school, where she gets additional income to educate her children. She wishes to become a prominent livestock farmer in her village, where she supplies milk to most of the households. Her main challenges are diseases that attack her cattle leading to death, and the dry season that makes pastures plus water very scarce. 

She will use the loan to buy more bulls for fattening to mature quickly for selling.

loans.use: to buy more bulls for fattening to mature quickly for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fabrics, thread, adhesives, and other tools for his upholstery business

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat has been winning art competitions since she was 5 years old. Between now and then, she has moved to the U.S. from India, excelled in art school, developed a taste for photography, and started her own fashion photography business. 

After starting her business in 2012, Nusrat has had many successes, such as being approached by a CEO of a new makeup line to shoot a business advertisement campaign. However, she has faced the challenges of dealing with the occasional unforeseen business expense. This loan will allow her to upgrade some of her equipment and purchase new equipment. Being able to improve and expand her equipment will allow Nusrat to increase profits and take on more shoots. 

In the future, Nusrat hopes to rise to the level of major fashion photographers like Irving Penn and Jean Baptiste, and eventually shoot campaigns for major fashion labels. Most of all, she wants to continue pursuing fashion and photography — two mediums she loves — and share her passion with others.

Check out her work at www.studio5800.com

loans.use: to upgrade and purchase new equipment for her fashion photography business

loans.name: Hilary

texts.en:
Hilary’s equine assisted therapy and learning services company is a prime example of how microloans help not just single individuals, but also hold the potential to indirectly improve the lives of scores of others. As she was pursuing her degrees in social work and psychology, Hilary began working with horses. She became familiar with the ability of animal interaction to improve the mental and behavioral health of both children and adults. Seeing an opportunity to change the lives of many people for the better, she decided to start her own business in Chicago over 10 years ago. She recently relocated to Georgia for a more temperate and year-round therapeutic setting. 

Hilary works with one other partner, and often contracts with licensed mental health professionals and equine specialists to co-facilitate therapy sessions and groups. Hilary is “proud that we are able to do what we love and [are] passionate about while helping people improve their lives!” Her business shows a commitment to helping in as many ways as possible. For example, the horses she raises are rescued horses from appalling backgrounds of abuse and neglect.

With this loan, Hilary will be able to consolidate some of the business' debt, incurred from starting this vast venture. In the future, she hopes to purchase permanent facilities for her program. With this temporary financial help, she will be able to focus on building her business and providing valuable services to as many people and animals as possible.

loans.use: to help expand and improve her business providing equine health therapy for children

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 41 years old and married with three children. With three children in school, Cristina works very hard to provide for them.

Cristina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products and other groceries.

Cristina has been in this business for 12 years now. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a 37-year-old married mother of 2 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She sells secondhand shoes at a business she started with the hope of earning an income. 

Limited capital challenges Christine to be able to meet her customer's increasing demands. That aside, she has hopes of constructing a permanent home. 

Christine requires a loan to add to her inventory of secondhand shoes.

loans.use: to add to her inventory of secondhand shoes.

loans.name: Luis Angel

texts.es:
Luis, de 27 años de edad, es un joven muy luchador, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañado y tiene dos hijos, los cuales están estudiando y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

Luis, se dedica a la elaboración de pan desde hace un año, aprendió a hacer pan gracias a un amigo, el cual le enseño y lo empleo.- Tiempo después, su amigo no continuo haciendo pan y fue en ese momento que Luis, tomo la decisión de comenzar un nuevo negocio, con sus ahorros compró un horno y le pidió a su amigo que le alquilará el cilindro de gas, para iniciar con la panadería.

Ahora Luis, solicita el crédito para comprar el equipo completo de equipo para la elaboración de pan, porque el que tenía no era propio.

El Sueño de Luis, es tener una panadería con altos estándares de calidad y amplia, que surta todas las tiendas cercanas y que su pan sea el más vendido.
texts.en:
Luis is 27 years old, he is a young man who strives hard to get ahead. Luis studied up until the ninth grade, he has a partner and two children. His children are studying and his partner looks after the home. 

Luis has been making a living as a breadmaker for one year. He learnt how to make bread thanks to a friend who hired him and taught him. Some time later, his friend discontinued his business and so Luis decided to start his own business. With his savings he bought an oven and he asked his friend to rent a gas tank, in order to open his bakery. 

Now Luis is seeking a loan to buy all the necessary equipment for making bread, because what he has is not his own. 

Luis's dream is to have a high quality, large bakery, that becomes very popular and supplies all the nearby shops.

loans.use: to buy all the necessary equipment for making bread.

loans.name: Arcangel Gabriel Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “ARCANGEL GABRIEL”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Otilia Leonor ella es conviviente y tiene 47 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio confecciones como pantalones, faldas, vestidos, pantalones y blusas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 40 años en este negocio, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de costurera. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar telas, tijeras e hilos.
Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de librería, negocio de internet, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.




La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to community bank “Archangel Gabriel”, which is located in the district, province and department of Cusco, Peru.

One of these members is Mrs. Otilia Leonor, who is 47 years old, married and has two children. She has a business working as a seamstress, making garments such as pants, skirts, dresses, trousers and blouses. She works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm, and has been in the business for 40 years; her dream is to expand her seamstress business. She is requesting this loan to purchase fabric, scissors and threads.

The members whose picture is attached to the group photo, asked to have their picture taken after the meeting, which they could not attend due to work matters. Other members in the group are in the business of selling books or running internet cafes, grocery stores or restaurants.

Mrs. Otilia Leonor is grateful to those who help her achieve her dream through this medium and is committed to making her payments according to the specified terms.

loans.use: purchase fabric, scissors and threads

loans.name: San Jose De Urubamba Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA.
La socia Juana tiene 51 años de edad tiene 01 hijo y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurante, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia prepara diferentes tipos de comida como arroz con pollo, saltados, sopas entre otros para todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como arroz, aceite, carnes entre otros.
Los socios se sienten agradecidos por el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Las socias que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
Juana belongs to the communal bank San Jose de Urubamba. Juana is 51 years old and has one child. She is single. 

Juana runs a restaurant, she has been doing so for quite some time. Thanks to the determination of Juana, her restaurant is going well. Juana prepares different types of food such as rice with chicken, stir-fries, and soups, for all the customers that come to visit. 

Juana wishes to continue with her business and thus be able to continue supporting her family. 

Juana is seeking a loan to buy basic ingredients like rice, oil and meat. 

All of the bank members feel grateful for the offered loan and they are committed to making the regular repayments.

loans.use: to buy basic ingredients like rice, oil and meat.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 20 years old. She works very hard to help her family.

Gloria runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested an 8,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy items to sell in her general store such as eggs, canned goods, home care products, as well as other groceries.

Gloria has been in this business for 3 years now. 

In the future, Gloria would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store such as eggs, canned goods, home care products, as well as other groceries.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith is a 28 year old single lady living in Fort Portal Uganda. She runs a dairy selling milk and at the same time earns a monthly salary from another job. She is faced with challenges of limited capital that hinders progress in her business. However, she hopes to expand her business to new market areas. Edith needs a loan to  buy a fridge and sodas for her business.

loans.use: to buy a fridge and sodas for her business.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 62 years old and has six children. For the past three years she has been farming vegetables in the Philippines.

Daisy has taken out and successfully repaid four prior loans through NWTF. She has now applied for a 6000 PHP loan to buy fertilizer and other supplies for her farm.

Daisy’s desire is to make enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other supplies for her farm.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 48 years old and has four children. Imelda is married and has one child in school.

Imelda is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Imelda has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Imelda  would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Irene is 25 years old and has two children who are in school.

Irene has a buy and sell fruits business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fruits to sell in her stall.

Irene has been in this business for three years. In the future, Irene would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fruits to sell in her stall

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Emily is 27 years old and has one child in school.

Emily has a buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell in her stall.

Emily has been in this business for four years. In the future, Emily would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell in her stall

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 43 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Evangeline works very hard to provide for them.

Evangeline runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like biscuits, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Evangeline has been in this business for five years now. 

In the future, Evangeline would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like biscuits, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 33 years old with six children.

Gemma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell spare parts in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more spare parts to sell.

Gemma has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell spare parts business for 15 years and also earns an income from a general store.

Gemma aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts for her business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Gloria is 58 years old and has one child in school.

Gloria has a processing peanut business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more peanuts for her business.

Gloria has been in this business for six years. In the future, Gloria would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more peanuts for her business

loans.name: Herminia Teresita

texts.en:
Herminia Teresita is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Herminia Teresita is 60 years old now.

Herminia Teresita has a making native souvenir business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more scrap and recycled materials to use for her business.

Herminia Teresita has been in this business for one year. In the future, Herminia Teresita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more scrap and recycled materials to use for her business

loans.name: Wendy Isamar

texts.es:
Wendy, 24 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, debido a la falta de recursos económicos, de su familia no pudo seguir con sus estudios, es madre soltera, pero afortunadamente el padre del niño le ayuda con algunos gastos, actualmente Wendy, vive con su madre y sus hermanos.

Wendy, desde la edad de 16 años, comenzó a vender ropa casa por casa en las colonias, tiene aproximadamente 8 años de realizar este trabajo, hoy en día también vende pupusas, papas fritas y panes junto a su mamá por las tardes.- Wendy, se dedicó a la venta de ropa, debido a la necesidad de aportar económicamente a la familia y hoy más que nunca para suplir las necesidades de su hijo.

El dinero será utilizado para comprar blusas y pantalones para señorita, porque son las que más se venden, también vende ropa para niños.

El sueño de Wendy, es hacer crecer su negocio que tiene con su madre y además tener su propio negocio de ropa en el mercado, para brindarle una mejor educación a su hijo.
texts.en: Wendy is 24 years old and studied until the 6th grade. Due to a lack of money, she could not continue with her studies. She is a single mom, but fortunately, the child's father helps with some expenses. Wendy currently lives with her mother and her siblings. From the age of 16, Wendy started selling clothing door to door in the townships. She has approximately 8 years of doing this work. Also, now she sells pupusas, french fries, and breads along with her mother, in the afternoons.  Wendy was also devoted to selling clothes due to the need to also contribute financially to the family, and now more than ever, to cover her child's needs. The loan she is applying for is to buy ladies blouses and pants because these are the items that sell the fastest. She also sells children's clothes. Wendy's dream is to grow the business she has with her mother and to have her own clothing business in the market to give a better education to her child.

loans.use: To buy ladies blouses and pants.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is 32 years old and married with three children. With two of her children in school, Janice works very hard to provide for them.

Janice runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as beverages, canned goods, home care products and groceries to sell.

Janice has been in this business for 11 years now. 

In the future, Janice would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items such as beverages, canned goods, home care products and groceries to sell

loans.name: Jazel

texts.en:
Jazel is a married woman with three children. Jazel is 26 years old and has two children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Jazel has a manicure and pedicure business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials such as a nail cutter, nail polish, etc.

Jazel has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials such as a nail cutter, nail polish, etc.

loans.name: Isha Allahu Allah Group

texts.en:
Yufusi is a member and a group representative of Isha Allahu Allah. He is 39 years old and married with two children. Their ages are 12 and 8 years old and they are currently attending school. Yusifu lives with his family in the Efutu Koforidua in the Cape Coast North District in the Central Region of Ghana. 

Yusifu has been a farmer for the past 15 years. He grows oranges, plantains, and cassava. Yufusi is very optimistic about his farms prospects and wishes to expand his farms in the coming years. Yusifu's only challenge is the high financial cost of maintaining his farms. In particular, he has to hire many labourers to work on his farms, which are spread across huge areas. The labourers assist him with the application of fertilizers, insecticides, weeding, pruning, and harvesting of the crops. 

A loan will provide Yusifu with the financial capital he needs to get a good harvest. After repaying his loan, his profits will be re-invested into his farms' expansion, and he would also be able to pay the school fees for his two children. Yusifu and his group members thank all their micro-lenders for their generous support.

loans.use: To buy insecticides and  fertilizer and pay for the maintenance of the farm

loans.name: Akyede Firi Nyame Group

texts.en:
Eliaso is a member and a leader of Akyede Firi Nyame Group. He is 45 years old and comes from Efufu Koforidua in the Central Region of Ghana. He is married with six children. The ages of the children are 18, 16, 14, 12, and 10 years,  and 3 are currently attending school. 

Eliaso is an orange farmer with 26 years farming experience on 10 acres of land. On a smaller scale, he also grows maize and cassava, to supplement income from his orange farm, which he sells at the local market. This year, Eliaso has been enterprising but faces the challenges common to farmers in his area. which is lack of financial support.
