In spite of these difficulties, Eliaso is optimistic and believes he can expand his farms. 

A loan will help him cover the high labor costs for applying fertilizers and insecticides and for weeding and pruning, and will go a long way in improving the lives of his family as they rely on the income he takes home. Eliaso and his entire group members are very grateful to all their micro-lenders for their generous financial support.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizer and to pay for the general maintenance of the farm

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is married and has three kids. Her husband has been living in the US for the last eight years and sends her remittances to support her family. She says that all her kids go to school. She enjoys spending time with them and also playing soccer. 

She owns a grocery store that was started by her father and later passed to her. She says that  her biggest accomplishment is growing her store and supporting her children. Hilda is asking for a loan to restock her grocery store and offer a big variety of products to her clients.

loans.use: To restock her grocery store.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is a married woman with two children. Jenelyn is 27 years old and has two children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Jenelyn has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her business.

Jenelyn has been in this business for six years. In the future, Jenelyn would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy plastic waste and resell it to recycling companies

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en:
Jinky is a married woman with three children. Jinky is 25 years old and two of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Jinky has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell.

Jinky has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Jinky would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 50 years old and married with eight children. With three children in school, Lolita works very hard to provide for them.

Lolita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as canned goods, home care products and groceries to sell.

Lolita has been in this business for six years now. 

In the future, Lolita would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items such as canned goods, home care products and groceries to sell

loans.name: Aseda Group

texts.en:
Gibridu is a 43-year-old orange farmer who comes from Efutu Koforidua in the Central Region of Ghana. He is a married man with one child. The child is 4 years old and attending school. Gibridu lives with his family in the Cape Coast North District in the Central Region of Ghana. 

Gibridu is a member of Aseda Group. He currently grows oranges on nine acres, and his farm is his main source of income. He is also a commercial driver, which provides him additional income to support his family. It is clear that Gibridu is enterprising and hardworking. 

However, he still finds farming challenging because of the high financial costs of maintenance. In particular, he has to hire many labourers to weed, prune and harvest the crops. He also has to purchase important agricultural inputs such as fertiliser and insect traps. Without such inputs, the crops are susceptible to being attacked by fruit flies and will not grow well. 

A loan will allow him to purchase these essential inputs and help increase his yield significantly, and his profits would far exceed the capital he needs to invest in his farms now. The profits derived from the use of this loan will also help pay the school fees for his child. Gibridu thanks all his micro-lenders for their generous assistance.

loans.use: To buy insecticides and fertilizer and to maintain the farm

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 41 years old, and she is separated with three children. She lives in Balatacan, Tangub. 

Fe is earning a living by farming; she engages in different farming activities in order to survive. This is how she supports their needs. She joined Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative in March of 2014. 

Fe requested a loan to purchase fertilizer to increase the production on her small rice farm, and to pay for seedlings and compost for her vegetable farm. This will help to give her farming income a big boost. 

Someday, Fe hopes to repair her house and live comfortably with her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to increase production on her small rice farm, and to pay for seedlings and compost for her vegetable farm

loans.name: Decilo

texts.en:
Decilo is a 51-year-old member of the Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative from Migcanaway, Tangub. He is married and has seven children.  

Decilo is industriously caring for his fishing activities. He personally takes charge of their business, and their children work for them as support. The business is doing well. 

Decilo has humbly taught his children the techniques of how to enjoy business and at the same time make earnings from it. The ups and downs of the business is nothing but a normal situation for him. Sometimes they have business losses, sometimes a good return. 

Now, Decilo sees a good opportunity to expand their business. He is requesting PHP 10,000 from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative to buy additional fish nets and fishing accessories. 

He deeply wishes for a good life for his children and for them to have businesses on their own.

loans.use: to buy additional fish nets and fishing accessories.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 62 years old and has five children. Delia is married woman.

Delia is in the agricultural business poultry in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her chickens.

Delia has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Delia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her chickens

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Delia has a manicure and pedicure business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials for her business such as nail cutters, nail polish, etc..

Delia has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Delia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her business such as nail cutters, nail polish, etc.

loans.name: Pascasie

texts.en:
Pascasie is aged 27 years. She is married with five children aged between 2 and 13 years. Three of them go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 16 years. Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and improve her welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Welcome 1 Group

texts.en:
Olga is a member of the community bank group Welcome 1 in Brazzaville, the Republic of Congo, helping to lead a subgroup of nine other micro-entrepreneurs, Olga has been running her general store for about three years. 

Olga is applying for her second loan with HOPE Congo and will use her next loan to purchase bags, large quantities of cooking oil, and sugar to add to her inventory. In addition to her general store, she also makes beignets (doughnuts) and always greets her clients with a warm smile to make them feel at home. 

In the future, Olga hopes to grow her business to focus more on her specialty, her beignets, and to open her own pastry shop as a part of a larger general store. With her increased income, she hopes to be able to send her 14-year-old daughter to a good school to continue her studies.

loans.use: to buy bags, large quantities of cooking oil, and sugar to add to her inventory.

loans.name: Ednalyn

texts.en:
Ednalyn is 47 years old and married with seven children. With four children in school, Ednalyn works very hard to provide for them.

Ednalyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Ednalyn has been in this business for 23 years now. 

In the future, Ednalyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Elisa is 53 years old and has two children who are in school.

Elisa has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Elisa has been in this business for three years. In the future, Elisa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam is a hardworking man with two children living in Fort Portal Uganda. He is a retailer and has a hardware shop plus farming that adds him more income. 

He is faced with challenges of limited capital, that hinders progress of his business. Besides that, he has hopes of expanding his business to new areas especially the nearby towns. Sam needs a loan to  buy doors and windows and pay for general finishing of his house.

loans.use: to buy doors and windows and pay for general finishing of his house.
